story:
if you actually know me..you know that i have been doing music since i was a child with great passion.  I have now aquired a team of producers and engineers to make that happen.  We have been blessed with the perfect opportunity to do something big and awesome!  As a part of the INKKWELL MUSIC GROUP (MAYBACH MUSIC GROUP) We are securing a space inside of Atlantas newest addition to SUPER STUDIOS....ALL PROFESSIONAL!!!!  WE NEED HELP ON THE BUILD OUT!  We want to make your studio recording experience the best.  We will provide 3 classes each Saturday for young up and coming producers and engineers so they will have access to seasoned musicians, producers and engineers, so they may further their love and passion for music and the audio/visual arts.  We will be doing Pod Casts and how to Video presentations aswell.  Our Goal is to take a "nobody" artist/producer/engineer to the level they seek to achieve to gain success.  In order to complete this task, we need to complete the build out...(sound both, insulation, and walls.) We have already aquired all the studio equipment needed (the top of the line stuff that makes dreams come true....).

We are asking for your love and assistance to build this dream!  CONTRIBUTE WHAT YOU CAN!...OR CONTRIBUTE YOUR HEARTS DESIRE...EVERY $1 COUNTS!!

PLEASE HELP MAKE DREAMS COME TRUE FOR ME, MY PARTNERS AND STAFF...AND FOR THE GENERATION WE PLAN TO REACH WITH THE ART OF MUSIC AND VISUAL ARTS..I ASK THAT YOU ENVISION WITH ME THE STRUCTURE WE WILL COLLECTIVELY PROVIDE THE YOUTH AND NEXT GENERATION WITH TO SUCCEED AND FOLLOW THEIR DREAMS....LETS PASS ON THE TOURCH OF BELIEVING IN ONES SELF BY SUPPORTING THE ROOT OF EXCELLENCE!!!

story:
BLACK VENGEANCE: The 2Head Tony EP

Tony will be releasing his debut Ep "Black Vengeance". If he reaches his goal the CD will be absolutely free and there will be a live show to celebrate our victory. We want to give back and this is how we say thanks.

Be a part of history by being a part the hottest and most groundbreaking album of this year. Help us help you. If you love passion, creativity, soul , sexiness & thought provoking music then you have finally come to the right place. Help us Reach our goal so we can shut the internet down on BLACK FRIDAY by giving the CD away absolutely free.

We Need Your Help

Here is what we need

  • We need new, lights, powered speakers, mics and mixers for live shows
  • Funding for the upcoming world tour
  • We are also upgrading our film studio
  • Security for haters 



The Impact will be Epic

You contribution will make a difference.

  • Some artist never get discovered because they dont have the proper machine behind them
  • Out goal is the get the message of peace, laughter, intelligence, health and free thinking out to the world.
  • With love education and intelligence we can have a better us & better planet.




What we stand for

We promote creativity self love elevation happiness and promotion

  • We believe in happiness through healthiness and laughter
  • We provide edutainment
  • Cometry (comedy infused poetry)

Other Ways You Can Help

if you cant make a donation there are other ways to help

  • Share this campaign
  • Tell your friends
  • Give us you email so you can be notified of later promotions



LIKE THE HARDFACE PAGE

story:
Avant garde/Progressive/Alternative band guided by  guitarist/composer Gabriel Gianelli and singer/writer Garrett Hollbrock.

The band has just released a 5 songs EP with a video clip (http://bit.ly/1S6p8if), but this a concept project, and wants to present the world the full opera which will also include a graphic and philosophical narration of the record thematics, plus a second video clip, hence: the crowdfunding.

Soundcloud:

"Pharaoh's Phoenix" http://bit.ly/1MNDW0n

"Falling Skyward" http://bit.ly/1XPttcP

 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

“Visionary” is not your typical rock band playing your typical rock record. Everything has to have a beginning, and Visionary is the beginning of a multiple-sided quest. Ultimately aimed at the understanding of the “Greater design”, this is a quest that comprehends musical, personal, philosophical and spiritual research.

Visionary is the brain child of guitarist/composer Gabriel (Gabriel Gianelli), who’s been very clear about his interests in discovering, understanding, and “musicalizing” the human journey to the realization of his connection to everything that exists. Also a mean to find what his inner self is looking for: embodied in the Visionary’s concept/opera with “Felicity”, a guide who “magically” appears in his inner life and provides the key to the door that most of us, sooner or later, wishes to open.

As he explains, “The quest that this projects represents has gradually grown and morphed alongside my own growth. My life in general, was too simple and relatively young to be literally translated into music, so to lay down the blue prints of this concept i started to pay more attention and get more in tune with everything that surrounds us . That’s why I began to draw from everything else around me, making every single piece of inspiration a fundamental part of the puzzle. By turning it into music, I hope everyone will understand and empathize with the message through this fantastic and most universal language. Though unconsciously at times, this message is aimed to reach the very core of the listener, and the addition of dreamful images and pertinent lyrics. I really hope it will facilitate the comprehension of everything I am trying to communicate.

The help of other very significant individuals, was and still is paramount for me. This communication and connection of souls and different vibes, I believe, is the most honest and heartfelt foundation for this journey of life, vision, feelings, music and growth. The musicians that are working with me on this concept, starting off with singer Garrett Holbrook, drummer Anthony JR Morra, bassist/producer Fabrizio Grossi and flautist Pippo Pippetti: came together more as a gathering of compatible souls rather than a "rock band cliché" audition assembly. Our interaction makes the intricate walk through the “Visionary” journey a secure and tamed “path” for our expression. Hopefully this will benefit you through your understanding and enjoyment!"

In conclusion, the young “Visionary," Gabriel, sums up his views and his presentation stating:
“I see “Visionary” as the communication vehicle that I’ve embraced to push people into observing the beauty of life from a different perspective. It is my story yes, but it is also the story of the “Whole”. Everything is part of it and everything reflects within it. Reality can be like a book. When we read it, we often get lost in it. And among its pages and words, we often lose or forget our curiosity for its overall true meaning. But I want to understand it. And here I am, looking up to the stars, close my eyes, and finally see it all."

Free your mind, drop all preconceptions, embrace the willingness to “feel”, and let the journey begin!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is CJ Pitts, and I’m a 24 year old Delawarean pursing music in the Twin Cities.  I’ve been professionally doing music for 5 years and now my heart desires to express my art through my original work!

I’m raising money because in March 2016 I will be releasing and performing my new EP entitled, ‘Lost Identity’.  This project is very special to me because it’s all original music and it’s also my first full-length project as a solo artist. This has been my dream to perform my own music on stages and to share my music with the world and now for that dream to be within reach, it’s an incredible feeling.

By supporting this project, it’ll help unlock access to 300 physical copies of the EP, a video production for the world to see and access the ability to bring the music to life with a live performance.

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised for this project will go to a variety of avenues.

·  Recording/Production Cost- $500

·  Graphic Design/Album Artwork- $250

·  300 Physical copies of the EP- $500

·  Music Video- $2500

·  Live band- $500

·  Advertising/Marketing/Merchandise- $300

·  Live Performance Production- $400

·  Copyright/Licensing- $100

There are some rewards to go along with donating! Anything will help but if you reach certain marks, you will receive some gifts! There will be gifts such as:

·  Thank Letter

·  Signed Album Poster

·  Signed EP and Poster

·  Name present in the music video credits

·  Free Concert Tickets

·  Receive EP Early

The Impact

Helping fund this project will help beyond words can express.  It will allow each goal that is set for this project to be completed and done with excellence.  My goal is to be able to make music from the heart that will people will remember for a long time.  The process has already begun with 3 songs I currently have streaming, and Id like that energy to transfer to an entire project.  Your contribution will swing the door wide open with endless possibilities and much more.


https://soundcloud.com/cjpittsmusic

Risks & Challenges

Some obstacles that could arise without the funding is not being able have physical copies by the actual release, or even every track completed in time to make the EP.  I believe the biggest obstacle would be, having to delay project further out.  The past year and a half there have been many obstacles that arose but I’ve realized being positive and hard work will keep that ball rolling.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone who sees this may not be in the position to donate towards the project but you can still help! You can come out to the show, share the page with others, follow my social media pages and the biggest thing of all, share my music with someone! We will make this dream come true together, thank you all!

story:
Short Summary

I've been writing songs for as long as I can remember. Music has always been there for me, even when times were tough and I felt alone. The unexpected success we had in 2015 with the release of my first full length album, Coming Home, has put my music on radio stations across the US and Canada, and allowed me to sign multiple sync licensing deals with major networks like Discovery, MTV, and NASCAR. It took a lot a work to get where we are now and I am so thankful to everyone who has helped to get us here. I'm proud that I was able to self fund the entire production, recording, promotion, and touring expenses related to Coming Home, but now I find myself without the budget to take advantage of an amazing and unexpected opportunity:

My fantastic band and I have been invited to play on 6th Street in Austin, TX during this year's SOUTH BY SOUTHWEST (SXSW) and I need your help to make it happen! Thanks to RedGorilla Festival and Tinderbox Music, I'll be on 6th St. playing alongside all the biggest showcases. This is such a fantastic opportunity to get heard and seen by the music industry's biggest tastemakers and could open the door to all kinds of things that could really help us get our music out there to the masses. From booking festivals this summer, to help with distribution, marketing, and management, it's all happening in Austin this March. Of course there are no guarantees, except one: If we aren't in Austin, nothing will happen.

What We Need & What You Get

SXSW has become such a big deal that everything from airfare to hotel room costs are jacked up during this time. Just to give you an example, the 2 star La Quinta in downtown Austin is charging $562 per room per night (as of Jan 25, 2016). Yikes! I have locked in much better rates on everything from airfare to hotel, so with relative accuracy I can tell you what we need to make this happen:
 
Airfare for 4 - $1050
2 nights, 2 hotel rooms - $450
Car rental - $350
Meals - $200
Band - $750
Cabs to/from airport - $300
--------------------------------------
Estimated total cost: $3100
 

In order to help reach this goal, we are offering some fun and unique perks at every pledge level that we hope will encourage everyone to get into the spirit of SXSW and help make this great opportunity a reality. Limited edition posters, CD's, and vinyl, guitar lessons, jam sessions, house/beach/rooftop/pool/wherever concerts for you and your friends, let me produce/mix your song, studio consultation, surf lessons, and more!

The Impact

How would you like to be able to say you helped get us to Austin where [insert awesome SXSW occurrence] happened that changed everything for us. I wouldn't be asking for help now if I didn't believe that there is real value in this opportunity. I hope you see that value too, and decide to make a contribution to help a struggling artist get his shot.

For all our successes in 2015, the cost of getting an independent artist like me to break through the noise and clutter in a world that is completely saturated with things trying to capture our attention is significant. Your support right now is critical. Help me get my band down to Austin so I can put on a killer show for our Austin friends and the music industry!

Risks & Challenges

If you start looking too closely at what could go wrong in the music business, you'll lose your mind (or leave the business.) That being said, I believe I have minimized the greatest risk - skyrocketing expenses - by securing airfare and accommodations well in advance. This action, however, was a risk unto itself. Call it a leap of faith. I know there are some good people out there who believe in me and would want to see this happen, like you. So it's a leap I felt good taking.

I'll be honest, I really need your help to make this happen. If we fall short of our goal, I will most likely make up the shortfall by selling some of my studio gear or a guitar or two (tear out my heart!) I hope that won't be the case, so the need for your help right away is great.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now, no sweat. I totally get it. There are lots of ways you can help that won't cost you anything:
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about this campaign and the exciting opportunity we have.
  • Join my email list at jontea.com
  • Join and share my YouTube, Facebook and Twitter pages.
  • Listen to Coming Home on your favorite online streaming service. (Spotify, Apple Music, Rdio)
  • Leave a nice review on iTunes or Amazon of the new album.
  • Tell all your friends in Austin to come see the show and make a lot of noise! Wednesday, March 16th @ Midnight (technically 3/17) at Touche on 6th St. It's FREE.

story:
Short Summary

I started rapping in 1992, and I wrote my first album in May of 1996.  I recorded the album in June of 1996, and released it in January 1997.  I now want to celebrate the 20 year anniversary of my first album, and of the song, Playin' a Little Basketball, by making a music video for it.  I will be working with the extremely talented, and inspirational, Henrique Cuoto.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $500-$1,000 to make this video the right way.  First and foremost, I need to pay the director.  I will be doing this out of pocket if I cannot raise enough funds here, but your support here actually contributes to my dreams and to his!  I also would like to rent out a basketball gym for a couple of hours so we can get the best footage possible.  In addition, I'll need to get jerseys made to help distinguish the teams, both for the video's sake, and so we know who is on which team during filming without having to go shirts and skins.  

Of course, you get the satisfaction of knowing you're contributing to two people's dreams, but you can also get music, a basketball jersey, a spot in the video, and an exclusive first look at the video (I'll let my backers see it at least a day ahead of everybody else).  

The Impact

For me, this isn't just about creating a music video for one of my most popular songs, and celebrating its 20 year anniversary.  It's about dreams.  Basketball was my first dream, and music is still the dream that gives me purpose every day of my life.  I also get to be a part of Henrique's dream.  I first met Henrique probably 10 years ago, when I performed at a place called Elbo's in Dayton, OH.  He started off as a fan of mine, and I have become a huge fan of his.  This will be the first music video of mine that I have not directed myself, and it feels good to be part of something bigger.  This will also be the first time that I've actively recruited people to be in a music video of mine.  This is about all of you, and letting you know that my music can only be great because of you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially contribute, you can still be in the video, whether as a ref (we only need one of those, but I have a couple things in mind, so you have to be ready to be funny), or just someone watching from the stands.  Maybe a scoreboard operator (if we can afford a scoreboard).  

And, of course, spreading the word through Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, ESP, talking through two cans connected via string hanging out of a window, texting, or talking to someone in person about it.  You are amazing!
story_txt:
Short Summary I started rapping in 1992, and I wrote my first album in May of 1996.  I recorded the album in June of 1996, and released it in January 1997.  I now want to celebrate the 20 year anniversary of my first album, and of the song, Playin' a Little Basketball, by making a music video for it.  I will be working with the extremely talented, and inspirational, Henrique Cuoto.   What We Need & What You Get I need $500-$1,000 to make this video the right way.  First and foremost, I need to pay the director.  I will be doing this out of pocket if I cannot raise enough funds here, but your support here actually contributes to my dreams and to his!  I also would like to rent out a basketball gym for a couple of hours so we can get the best footage possible.  In addition, I'll need to get jerseys made to help distinguish the teams, both for the video's sake, and so we know who is on which team during filming without having to go shirts and skins.  
Of course, you get the satisfaction of knowing you're contributing to two people's dreams, but you can also get music, a basketball jersey, a spot in the video, and an exclusive first look at the video (I'll let my backers see it at least a day ahead of everybody else).  
The Impact
 For me, this isn't just about creating a music video for one of my most popular songs, and celebrating its 20 year anniversary.  It's about dreams.  Basketball was my first dream, and music is still the dream that gives me purpose every day of my life.  I also get to be a part of Henrique's dream.  I first met Henrique probably 10 years ago, when I performed at a place called Elbo's in Dayton, OH.  He started off as a fan of mine, and I have become a huge fan of his.  This will be the first music video of mine that I have not directed myself, and it feels good to be part of something bigger.  This will also be the first time that I've actively recruited people to be in a music video of mine.  This is about all of you, and letting you know that my music can only be great because of you.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't financially contribute, you can still be in the video, whether as a ref (we only need one of those, but I have a couple things in mind, so you have to be ready to be funny), or just someone watching from the stands.  Maybe a scoreboard operator (if we can afford a scoreboard).  
And, of course, spreading the word through Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, ESP, talking through two cans connected via string hanging out of a window, texting, or talking to someone in person about it.  You are amazing!

story:
Battling Giants Entertainment Presents the first annual Stoned Meadow of Doom Fest

    This fundraiser is helping to kick off what will be an annual fest featuring a variety of bands in the rock, stoner, psychedelic, blues, doom and metal genres. The festival will take place in Omaha, Nebraska on Friday, September 2nd, 2016. A partnership between a promotion/booking company, Battling Giants Entertainment, and Clint Beed's YouTube channel Stoned Meadow of Doom has been formed to bring forth the festival. The partners anticipate attracting worldwide attention to the fest as it has the potential to build into multi-day, outdoor festival in the United States for this genre. Currently, there are not many options for festivals in the Midwest to compare with the likes of Maryland Deathfest, Psycho California, Housecore Horror Festival, etc. 

     Unfortunately, our ambitions outweigh our wallets, and we hope enough donations can be secured to set everything in motion. Raising $15,000 will secure the Slowdown, a 640 capacity indoor venue with two stages to provide quick changeover between sets, payment and lodging for the bands involved, and advertising online and in print. Donation options that include ticket(s) and/or merchandise are available. The highlight perk features a lifetime pass to the festival, which will never be available again. A website will be made to assist in travel plans as well as hotel booking. 

    This is your opportunity to be part of the creation of a new festival. Your donation will help bring together bands from different parts of the country for an epic evening of live music.

    Between fundraising and actual sales, we expect to secure a large outdoor area for multiple days for 2017's fest. This will feature major headliners within the genre. 

About Stoned Meadow of Doom

    In just over two years, the YouTube channel Stoned Meadow of Doom has amassed a following of over 75,000 subscribers. This has quickly turned into the premier spot for listeners to discover up-and-coming bands in the stoner rock, doom, blues and psychedelic genres. The channel has helped bands break out overnight through its streaming of full-length albums. Oftentimes, these bands are not signed to a record label and receive little promotion otherwise. The streams have helped numerous bands gain exposure within the industry, sell records and develop a fan base to support touring.

About Battling Giants Entertainment

    The Omaha, Nebraska based company was started by a band of the same name. Battling Giants was one of the many bands shared by Stoned Meadow of Doom's channel and saw first-hand the benefits of being a part of the community of listeners on the channel. The company itself assists numerous other bands in booking, promotion, and other management aspects all around the nation. 

About Yeti Printshop & Design

    The premier graphic artist in the region, Joseph Quentin Cutler, has been paving way for many bands that Battling Giants Entertainment have been booking. As a freelance artist, Joseph provides artwork and design for a variety of occasions outside of bands.

story:
We're Coming to Europe

Hi. I'm Jesse, the founder of Tin Pan. I'm hoping you've seen me perform on stage because then you'll know how passionate I am about making music.  Over the years we've attracted a lot of fans in Europe and I'm committed to bringing the band over there for a tour. However, the realities of being a full-time musician not named U2, or Bruce Springsteen, include that at our stage of the game none of the venues that we will be playing can afford to fly the band to Europe. 

As a band leader, I am willing to go into the hole personally so that I can make this tour happen but it isn't a sustainable endeavor and that is why I am asking for your help. I am responsible for paying all my musicians, making sure we have safe lodgings each night, and taking care of all transportation costs to get us there and to the different cities we will be performing in. The artists fees we will be receiving from the gigs booked so far cover everything but airfare.

Please consider supporting Tin Pan and the arts in general in exchange for some cool rewards that we hope you will enjoy.

We Need Airfare 

The members of the band will be flying in to Venice from New York City where we will meet our London based bass player and start the tour. From there we will be taking buses and trains to the different cities on our route. All the money you donate will help cover our travel expenses.

The Tour

Here are our dates so far:

June 11th - Swing Dance Festival - Rovinj, Croatia
June 17th - Swing Dance Event - Ghent, Belgium
June 19th - Club Metronome - Liege, Belgium
June 20th - Swing Dance Event - Sint-Niklaas, Belgium
June 22nd - Swing Dance Event - Utrecht, Netherlands
June 23rd - Private Party - Utrech, Netherlands
June 24th - Old Duke Music Venue - Bristol, England
June 25th - Blues Revolution Dance Event - London, England
June 26th - Aberjazz Dance Event - Wales, England
June 27th - The Nightjar Music Venue - London, England
July 2nd - Swing Dance Event - Paris, France
July 3rd - Swing Dance Event - Paris, France
As you see we have a few open dates on the schedule and with all hopes, these will fill in with other exciting performance opportunities.

Risks & Challenges

Touring musicians face so many challenges. Gigs get canceled last minute, you get snowed on in April, buses break down in Belgrade, promoters "forget" what the financial agreement was. But, we surmount all this and stick our necks out there because making music is a total thrill and we love it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money there other ways you can help.

• Donate frequent flyer miles

• Spread the word about this campaign to people you feel can contribute

• Help us secure gigs for the dates that are still open in our schedule

• Show us around your town and we'll get a pint at your favorite place.

Thanks so much for reading this and your enthusiasm about what we are doing.

story:
Hey Friends! I'm excited to announce that I'll be releasing a new album soon and I can't wait for you all to hear it. I'm recording this album at Virtue and Vice Studios in Brooklyn, New York with top engineer/producer Anthony Gallo, and some of the best Rock 'N Roll musicians in this great music town of New York City. We've already finished recording drums, bass, and rhythm guitars and it sounds like a million dollars. 

Recording an album is a thrilling, time consuming and expensive process. I can use your help. I'm not asking for any hand-outs or even investments, just the pre-order of an album which will be available online and in stores in early January of the new year. I'm putting the album up for sale along with my debut album "Burn for the Living." If you've appreciated my work in the past, derived enjoyment from it, and are excited about hearing more throughout the years, please, purchase the music. And if you're not willing or able to spend any money, please, spread the word. The advanced sales will help smooth this process out and allow me to get back to playing live shows sooner where I can do what I love doing best, in the company of you.  Cheers, Rob Bray of Gideon's Army

story:
My name is Marc Gleckman. I'm 18 and I'm an independent producer from San Francisco. I currently study at Seattle University as a Freshman. 

I've been producing music since 6th grade (7 years), and over that time I have developed a passion for music production. Through hundreds of songs, hundreds of reviews by my peers, hundreds of hours with digital audio workshops, and thousands of you tube videos, I have become independently fluent with electronic music production. 

That was two years ago.

Once I could produce the music I had in my mind, everything changed. 

I started to make my dreams come true through digital audio workshops, and I could translate my ideas to songs. This is when this idea of "Humanity" came into my head, the fact that I can take an idea that I processed and turn it into something produced entirely electronically amazed me. 

I have been working on my album "Humanity" for the past 2 years, and it tells the instrumental story of my life over the past 2 years. 

2 songs into its production I ran out of the projected budget I made for the album, due to the high costs of mixing, mastering, and promotions.

As an independent artist it is difficult to produce a professional album without the help of a mixing and mastering engineer. 

What I am asking of you is to help me accomplish my dream, and help produce Humanity. With your funding, I can mix and master my album, promote it, and give back to supporters like you, who know a good cause when they see one.

To give you a sense of the costs of production, Humanity has 7 songs:

Mixing is $960 ($160 per track)

Mastering is $204 ($34 per track) 

Master copy is $40 for the album 

Distribution is $30 for the album

Promotions are set to $60 for the album.

This leaves me at $1,294 for the album. 

In the mean time I am trying to do everything I can to collect the money to produce my album by January of 2016. I work as a sound board operator for the theater department of Seattle University, as well as a being a radio DJ at KSUB (soon to be KSXU FM Radio). 

To hear some my music, check out my website, sound cloud, or Facebook!

Check out my page at www.djdarkus.com

Sound cloud: https://soundcloud.com/dj-darkus

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DJDarkusMusic/?ref=hl

Contact djdarkusevents@gmail.com for any information or questions.


Whether you donate or not, I really appreciate you reading my story. I wouldn't be where I am today without supporters like you! 

Thank you!

story:
THE STORY

FOLLOW handles pressing and sensitive issues about race, religion, family, and equality. It delivers with honesty and truth. FOLLOW personalizes the issues and brings it all home. Home, where we all want to feel safe and welcome.

Marcus and Daniel are getting married.

Their foster son Noah calls them "Dad & Pops". They're a "typical" American family, juggling wedding and adoption plans... until suddenly their world is turned upside down.

Marcus' estranged religious father returns to take over the family business, setting events in motion that threaten to tear the family apart. After years of distance and denial, Marcus has one more chance to reconcile with his father and face the painful memories of his past, before he can raise a family of his own.

THE MUSIC

Music is  like another character in this film.  There is a juke box in the cafe that holds old and new tunes.  There will be a church choir.  We have the good fortune to have the multi talented Frenchie Davis on board to play JADE!

We also have the two-time Academy, Golden Globe and Grammy nominated song writer Allan Rich,  “Run to You” from the movie BODYGUARD,  on board to write the music.

Allan is well known for his Grammy  and Oscar-nominated song "Run to You" (co-written with Jud Friedman), sung by Whitney Houston in “The Bodyguard.” His song "For the First Time" (co-written with Jud Friedman & James Newton Howard) from “One Fine Day” starring Michelle Pfeiffer and George Clooney was also nominated for an Academy Award as well as Golden Globe and Grammy Awards – it was also a #1 adult contemporary song for Kenny Loggins. Allan’s song "I Drive Myself Crazy" (co-written with Ellen Shipley & Rick Nowels) was on NSync’s debut album, which sold 10 million units and was certified “Diamond” by the RIAA. 

We are raising money to develop the MUSIC to this film.  Allan will be writing songs for Frenchie to sing.

THE TEAM

Based on his stage play, Michael Patrick Spillers has written this ensemble character screenplay that blends the right mix of comedy and drama to tell the story.  

Emmy-winning actor/director Melanie Mayron (“Thirtysomething”, “Slap Her She’s French”, “The Baby-Sitters Club,” “Jane the Virgin,” “Switched at Birth”) will utilize her depth of knowledge and her incredibly honed vision as a director to tell our story.

Producers are LeeAnne Matusek, who after seeing the stage play, knew that this film adaptation would be her passion project, and Todd Shotz (Human Rights Campaign Award winner, former development executive on films such as “Live Free or Die Hard,” “Sixteen Blocks,” “Timber Falls” and exec. producer of Paramount’s “Ghost Team One”), who has yearned to work on a project like FOLLOW.

Executive Producers include the legendary film and television producer Howard Rosenman (“Father of the Bride,” “Buffy the Vampire Slayer,” Oscar-winning doc “Common Threads,” “Celluloid Closet,” founder of Project Angel Food), whose background as a gay rights activist is already having a crucial impact on the production.

Also on the team is Jan Miller Corran, Executive Producer, who has produced award-winning documentaries and most recently the feature film “See You In My Dreams” starring Blythe Danner & Sam Elliott, which premiered at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival and went on to a successful theatrical release this past spring. 


WHAT WE NEED 

This campaign will cover the cost of recording original songs and securing the copyrights for already recorded songs.  

If you know movie soundtracks, and I think you do if you're looking at our campaign, you KNOW it costs a lot to create those songs or secure previously recorded songs. 

Some of the costs will be studio rental, payment for musicians and vocalists.

Indie filmmakers usually don't plan for the musical part of their budget for the movie they are making and it can make or break the quality of a film.  

We are also currently raising money to film FOLLOW in Spring 2016.

WHAT YOU GET

We have some GREAT perks that we hope you like and will encourage you to support our quest to get it right!  We want to make sure this beautiful story about love and family has a wonderful soundtrack.  

We cannot do this without you!

story:
Else Ensemble?

The Else Ensemble is an Israeli-German chamber music group founded a little over a year ago. We are professional musicians, members in leading world orchestras and passionate performers of chamber music. We founded the ensemble after years of mutual studies and music making, where wonderful friendships and collaborations between Israeli and German musicians were born. The cultural and historical backgrounds of our musical activity were so powerful, that we decided to make it official.

We devote ourselves to the performance of music by German and Jewish composers, while constantly researching names that were unjustifiably forgotten due to the events of World War II and the Holocaust. 

We named our ensemble after the poetess Else Lasker-Schueler, whose life story is strongly connected both to Israel and to Germany. Inspired by her expressive art and fascinating personality, we aspire to give performance to women composers, and create thought-provoking crossovers between music and literature. 

Our first concert tour in Israel

This upcoming May, the Else Ensemble comes to Israel for a concert tour: our very first appearance in a place that means everything to us. For all of us this represents a milestone in our mutual path. We will be hosting our German friends during several concerts in some of Israel's best venues. We worked very hard and prepared wonderful programs including pieces by composers such as Mozart and Brahms, as well as works by Israeli composers Noa Guy and Shulamit Ran. 

As much as playing together is a personal joy for us, we deeply believe our ensemble shares an interesting story with the world: people of different cultures with a mutual complicated past, who come together for a celebration of chamber music at its highest level. 

We are all professional classical musicians, who tour alone and with others all over the world. We put tremendous amount of time and efforts into rehearsing, researching repertoire and creating unforgettable programs. Naturally, bringing our music to Israel is one of our biggest dreams - this is where half of us come from. But we also deeply believe it will enrich the local classical music scene, allow Israeli musicians to connect with international musicians and help develop a cultural-musical exchange of ideas.  

Who are we and what do we play? 

Linus Roth - Violin (Germany) 

Franziska Hölscher - Violin (Germany)

Miriam Manasherov - Viola (Israel)

Daniela Shemer - Cello (Israel, Germany)

Benedict Kloeckner - Cello (Germany)

Philipp Stubenrauch - Double Bass (Germany)

Avner Geiger - Flute (Israel, Germany) 

Shelly Ezra - Clarinet (Israel, Germany)

Teddy Ezra - Clarinet (Israel, Germany)

Mor Biron - Bassoon (Israel, Germany)

Itamar Leshem - Horn (Israel)

Naaman Wagner - Piano (Israel, Germany)


The tour will include the following concerts:

To see all information about these concerts please click here.

22.5.16 Haifa Hecht Museum - Hecht Auditorium

23.5.16 Haifa University 

24.5.16 Herzlia Pituah - "Zfunot Tarbut" Foundation 

25.5.16 Herzlia Pituah - Diplomatic Event of the German Embassy

29.5.16 Jerusalem Mormon University

30.5.16 Jerusalem Etnachta 

31.5.16 Tel Aviv - Leo Beck Institute and 

1.6.16 Tel Aviv Felicija Blumental Center


The tour is definitely happening, so why do we need your help?

Because our ability to create appropriate conditions for our musicians, who worked very for this, depends on it. We are not talking about 5 star hotels or expensive restaurants. We are talking about the basic needs of a musician on tour: comfortable rehearsal rooms, flights at decent hours, healthy food, instrument insurance and many other necessities which can make a huge difference in the quality of our concerts. Because even though we are playing at some of Israel's best venues, what we receive is far from covering the costs. Actually, we need much more than what we ask for here, but this amount would already be a tremendous help. 

How will we make it happen if we do not get your help?

We will use savings and bank loans, which means our ensemble won't be able to develop much in the next seasons. Even though we perform at places such as the Berliner Philharmonie, keeping the ensemble active and alive is a financial question that goes far beyond what we earn from playing our music. We all know that music, especially classical music - needs support. 

This is where the money goes to

Given that the sum we are hoping to raise here is only a part of the total budget we need, we can only estimate how we will use the money:

We are excited to be able to thank you with what we do the best - play music! Alongside concert tickets and live recordings, we invite you to join our rehearsals, meet the musicians in person and have dinner together! For businesses and fellow musicians we are happy to offer a shoutout on our website and social medias. If you're celebrating a birthday soon - let us play for you a song! Check out these and other great perks we are offering.

Other Ways You Can Help

We deeply appreciate any kind of help. Spreading the word about the Else Ensemble means a lot to us! We kindly ask you to:

  • Visit our Facebook page - if you like it, share it! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach more people. 

Thank you so much for your time and interest, we know how much time it takes to read such a long text...
We hope to see you in one of our concerts! 
Yours,
The Else Ensemble
story_txt:
Else Ensemble?
The Else Ensemble is an Israeli-German chamber music group founded a little over a year ago. We are professional musicians, members in leading world orchestras and passionate performers of chamber music. We founded the ensemble after years of mutual studies and music making, where wonderful friendships and collaborations between Israeli and German musicians were born. The cultural and historical backgrounds of our musical activity were so powerful, that we decided to make it official.
We devote ourselves to the performance of music by German and Jewish composers, while constantly researching names that were unjustifiably forgotten due to the events of World War II and the Holocaust. 
We named our ensemble after the poetess Else Lasker-Schueler, whose life story is strongly connected both to Israel and to Germany. Inspired by her expressive art and fascinating personality, we aspire to give performance to women composers, and create thought-provoking crossovers between music and literature. 
Our first concert tour in Israel
This upcoming May, the Else Ensemble comes to Israel for a concert tour: our very first appearance in a place that means everything to us. For all of us this represents a milestone in our mutual path. We will be hosting our German friends during several concerts in some of Israel's best venues. We worked very hard and prepared wonderful programs including pieces by composers such as Mozart and Brahms, as well as works by Israeli composers Noa Guy and Shulamit Ran. 
As much as playing together is a personal joy for us, we deeply believe our ensemble shares an interesting story with the world: people of different cultures with a mutual complicated past, who come together for a celebration of chamber music at its highest level. 
We are all professional classical musicians, who tour alone and with others all over the world. We put tremendous amount of time and efforts into rehearsing, researching repertoire and creating unforgettable programs. Naturally, bringing our music to Israel is one of our biggest dreams - this is where half of us come from. But we also deeply believe it will enrich the local classical music scene, allow Israeli musicians to connect with international musicians and help develop a cultural-musical exchange of ideas.  
Who are we and what do we play? 



Linus Roth - Violin (Germany) 

Franziska Hölscher - Violin (Germany)

Miriam Manasherov - Viola (Israel)
Daniela Shemer - Cello (Israel, Germany)
Benedict Kloeckner - Cello (Germany)
Philipp Stubenrauch - Double Bass (Germany)
Avner Geiger - Flute (Israel, Germany) 
Shelly Ezra - Clarinet (Israel, Germany)
Teddy Ezra - Clarinet (Israel, Germany)
Mor Biron - Bassoon (Israel, Germany)
Itamar Leshem - Horn (Israel)
Naaman Wagner - Piano (Israel, Germany)

story:
Choristers,

The White House...Carnegie Hall...Dwight Chapel...Ashley's...a barbecue place outside of Richmond. 

Over the last twenty years at Yale and around the country, Mark has conducted all of us in memorable venues, and through transformative times. We celebrate the music and the friends we've made in the Yale Russian Chorus over the past twenty years and look forward to more music-making! By making a donation to the YRC you will be supporting the chorus' efforts to continue to share the amazing repertoire of Slavic choral music with audiences everywhere!

Whether we reach our goal or not, all of the donations you (or anyone) make will go directly towards the operational expenses of the chorus. We thank you!

And...

Многая лета

story:
Short Summary

 

I am raising funds to make a music video for my song 'I'm Not This Layer of Skin.' This has turned into an empowerment project, that aims to challenge the shallow portrayal of women in the media, art, and other influential outlets. It will celebrate the minds and substance behind women.

The video will be a collage of women from all walks of life acting out everyday activities, plus showcasing some of their creative aspects, with the aim of portraying their human side. I am working with Davide Marchesi from 316 Queens, the same director as my last video for Endless Soul, plus James Westlake and Lorenzo Guerrieri.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The money is going towards:

studio and equipment hire - £400

Travel expenses for directors/actors - £200

Props - £100

 

The Impact

The project aims to benefit society as a whole.

I am a 25 year old women and the pressure on me and my fellow females to look a certain way is immense. It is't just annoying, it is dangerous. People are getting ill because of it. People die because of it.

The pressure is everywhere and I know so many people who have been affected - and those people are not shallow. It's normal to want to look our best , and natural to want to be attractive (it's how we continue as a species!) but our insecurities are being played on by people who want to make money. It isn't ok. It's dangerous and it's subtle.

The project is so important to me because I have struggled in the past with pressure to be perfect, and I still do. I was completely taken in by the need to look a certain way and for a short while I was ill because of it. This is not uncommon in the slightest, and in an age where we are bombarded with images of perfection, it's so totally to be expected. It has become normal to compare ourselves to the 'best' and most selected parts of people's lives.

I am no longer embarrassed or ashamed of all the emotions, being so 'weak' , and surrendering to how this pressure made me feel.

Just writing this song helped me face the whole thing head on and I began standing up to the industry. Then, I was performing the song and saw how many people felt the same. I saw how hard the words hit women and how angry they got when they were confronted with the reality of ta situation which has become so ingrained in our society.

The video is for every woman who has ever felt ashamed because they dont look how the media says is right. There are still, and always will be, people who buy into the image as I did in my late teens and early twenties. I am tired of our vulnerabilities being exploited and want to start focusing my own art on what people should really be valued for. Even if one person decides to screw the systmen and feel better about themselves then I would have succeeded.

 

Risks & Challenges

This project in itself has been a huge challange for me as an unsigned artist. Initially it was finding the courage to go ahead with it, but now putting the whole thing together. The support from Davide and the women has been great and I will be forever grateful, but, as it's my project I need to fund it. The extra financial support will bring it to a level needed to make it so much more effective and professional.

Other Ways You Can Help

In order for project to get as much exposure as possible I would very much appreciate you sharing it wherever you can, particularly on various social media platforms! Thank you

story:
Hi everyone, it’s Georgia here.  

Most of you will already know that I have around a quarter of a million subscribers to my YouTube channel (www.youtube.com/georgiammusic), but what you might not know is that I have around 40 million views to my channel, most of these being from my Disney medley’s and Disney projects.

Here’s the thing.  I’m hoping that as many of my subscribers as possible have enjoyed my medleys enough to be prepared to donate as little as £1. If you’re prepared to do that I would be forever grateful to you. If you'd like to contribute more you will receive a VERY special gift from me.  If you contribute £20 you will receive an exclusive signed photograph of me with a special greeting. If you contribute as much as £50 you will receive a signed photo of me, as well as a signed DVD with my 5 most popular Disney medleys. 

So what's the money for? It’s for three things. You’ll have seen the vast number of costumes I’ve bought for my medleys, some of the gorgeous locations I’ve hired to shoot videos in, and the high quality face-paint training that I paid to learn how to do. So far I’ve spent around £20,000 on my videos and a small amount of the money that I raise will help me to recover some of that. That’s the first use. The second thing I want to do is continue producing new medleys and the more funds I can raise to do that, the higher quality the costumes, locations and production can be. Finally, I want to be able to pay to have solo material produced for me so that, as well as making covers, I can buy studio time to produce my first solo album. The thought of that sends shivers up my spine. I’d love to be able to share that you.

If you can help me by contributing as little as £1 you’ll be part of my adventure, and the more you can contribute the more you’ll be able to say at some point in the future - "I was a part of that", and maybe you’ll even receive one of those special gifts from me.

Please help to make my dreams come true.

Lots of love,

Georgia

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi everyone!

My name is Jason Richmond and I am a composer who lives and works out of the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky area. I have a big project coming up and I need your help! ABLAZE Records, a record company based out of the United States and Australia did an International Call for Scores and has picked an orchestra piece of mine, titled Ctrl+Alt+Del, to be on their upcoming Orchestral Masters Vol. 4 CD that will be released later this year. The recording will be taking place in the Czech Republic performed and recorded by the Brno Philharmonic this May from the 7th to the 14th, along with the other composers that were selected for the album. 

ABLAZE Records is subsidizing a great deal of the recording, which includes mixing the album (which is done by the record company's four time Grammy award winner), manufacturing and packaging, photos, distribution, and marketing of the album. But recording a full orchestra is expensive, and I do have to pay a portion of the costs, as well as flying and staying in the Czech Republic for a week to attend and supervise the recording and mixing of my work. Now this is common that a band or artist may have to pay for a portion of the recording. I’m not in a popular band or some rock star with a huge recording contract where a record label can give that person or band an advance, even though those musicians eventually may have to pay that money back through album sales, touring, or merchandise. ABLAZE Records deals with contemporary classical music, so the worldwide audience and sales aren’t as high enough for the record company to give out any huge advancements to their artists, even though they do take on a large percentage of the cost, which is great! The kind of music that I play and write, myself and others do need record companies like ABLAZE to record and promote this type of music. The good news is I get to keep the rights to my work and I get royalties from any album sales.

So what I am asking for is $7,500 for the rest of my expenses that I have to pay and to get to the Czech Republic and stay for a week. I know that’s a lot of money! But this is an amazing opportunity and one that will get my music out there and possibly more performances of this work, in the hopes that this will push my career forward. I had an electronic piece called PLuCK that ABLAZE Records released last year on there Electronic Masters Vol. 4 album, which has been played at a few festivals and along with a few upcoming festivals as well, and was broadcasted on a radio station in Ottawa, Canada. So I am asking for you to help out with this project. This is such a huge and fantastic opportunity for me! I’m extremely happy to have been chosen out of 90 other composers from 18 different countries, and for other composers in my field of music, an opportunity like this that doesn’t come around that often.

story:
Radio Enemy is a multi-genre band based in Denver, Colorado. While Radio Enemy has only a few years under its belt, our members have been active in the Colorado music scene for a combined 40 + years.

Through our collective experience, the members of Radio Enemy have identified the need for an unbiased communal platform for music, one that unifies the Colorado music scene in our continued efforts to grow and thrive. While healthy competition is always good, The Radio Enemy vision is one of cooperation; a synergistic effort to accomplish our goals as well as the goals of all our fellow local musicians. We want to take any of the backstabbing and trash talking out of the equation as we all have something valuable to contribute to our community. In Addition, we personally don't want our "local" radio stations (owned & operated by a large corporate conglomerate), who claim to have their fingers on the pulse, defining what is the Colorado music scene and the culture surrounding. The way we figure, who better to define the pulse than the pulse itself? And it doesn’t stop there – we want to celebrate and help promote all aspects of Colorado culture whether it be filmmakers, artists, photographers, comedians, apparel designers, restauranteurs, business owners, etc. That is how the RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS idea was conceived.

What exactly is RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS? RE Sessions will be a podcast supported by video content. For those who do not know what a podcast is, the traditional podcast is a digital audio file made available on the Internet for downloading to a computer or portable media player, typically available as a series, new installments of which can be received by subscribers automatically. Podcasts have the capability to reach an endless number of people and have become one of the best outlets for entertainment and information sourcing. RE Sessions will be an audio/visual platform showcasing the diverse Colorado local music scene and beyond. Though the emphasis will be on the music, our all-inclusive platform serves anything Colorado. 

Our format will be simple. Similar to a late night talk show, we aspire to bring in local talent, entrepreneurs, and any Players in whatever game it is that you play. We want to interview and give YOU the opportunity to provide a comprehensive description of what makes you, your product, or business venture unique. We'll sit down with you, vibe, and have some uncensored fun. Our studio will be equipped for top-notch audio/visual transmission and as a result, every podcast will include a jam session featuring RADIO ENEMY or whichever Colorado artist(s) that may want to come through and throw down. All RE Sessions installments will be available via YouTube and/or the Radio Enemy Sessions website for guests and fellow Coloradans to view and share.

The good news is, we already have a prime time spot, located right in the heart of downtown Denver and the majority of audio and computer equipment required. The bad news is, we need some renovations to make this all come to fruition and actually realize our vision. We already have the meat and potatoes, what we need now is the dressing and dessert. This is where we need you! The following is a list of the equipment we will need to make RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS vision a reality:

· Drum mics

· Subs & Speakers

· Podcast Mics (x4)

· Table Mic Stands

·Headphones

· 10 Go Pro Cameras

· Desk

· Chairs

· Love seat

· Sound Wall Foam

· Ceiling & Wall covers (tapestries)

· Rugs 

· Disco Ball

· Paint/Supplies

The following is a list of what we already possess:

· 16th & California location (with 2 separate office spaces)

· iMac 2009

· Ableton Live suite (For audio recording)

· Logic Pro 9 (For audio recording)

· 28 Channel mixing board

· All necessary mic stands for performances

· All necessary XLR cables for microphones

· Drum Kit

· Instruments

· Amplification and Effects

We are simply seeking monetary contributions or applicable donations. While we appreciate good intentions, we are not looking for the urine-stained, frat couch as we are striving to create THE professional, premier, aesthetically pleasing and comfortable environment to operate within. With that said and after a detailed cost analysis, we have set a goal of raising $4,000. Of course, in the spirit of transparency, a full disclosure of our fundraising progress and allocation of funds will be provided.

Like any good fundraising project, we have put together a list sliding scale of perks tied to specific dollar amounts for donations/contributions provided. Perk price points are as follows:

# 1 - $20 Contribution = RADIO ENEMY-SESSIONS Vinyl Sticker

# 2 - $35 Contribution = RADIO ENEMY-SESSIONS T-Shirt

# 3 - $50 Contribution = RADIO ENEMY-SESSIONS T-Shirt & Vinyl Sticker

# 4 - $100 Contribution = Private lunch with the crew, T-Shirt & Vinyl Sticker

# 5 - $250 Contribution = Private lunch, a tour of the newly renovated SESSIONS Studio, 3 song intimate jam session, T-Shirt & Vinyl Sticker

# 6 - $500 contribution = Be a guest on your choice of 3 SESSIONS episodes to represent whatever it is you may do in life. You have the option to forfeit your SESSIONS appearance in place of a friend that may have something special to share.

In closing, the entire Radio Enemy crew would like to truly thank you for taking a moment to watch our video proposal. We believe that RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS will be a great way for members of our community to get their word out and stay up to date with what is going on in our local scene. While we realize not every individual is ready or willing to contribute to our goal, we simply ask that you help us get the word out by sharing our proposal.

Again, thank you for your time and consideration, and don’t forget to stay tuned for RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS!
story_txt:
Radio Enemy is a multi-genre band
based in Denver, Colorado. While Radio Enemy has only a few years under its
belt, our members have been active in the Colorado music scene for a combined
40 + years. 
Through our collective experience, the
members of Radio Enemy have identified the need for an unbiased communal
platform for music, one that unifies the Colorado music scene in our continued
efforts to grow and thrive. While healthy competition is always good, The Radio
Enemy vision is one of cooperation; a synergistic effort to accomplish our
goals as well as the goals of all our fellow local musicians. We want to take any
of the backstabbing and trash talking out of the equation as we all have
something valuable to contribute to our community. In Addition, we personally don't
want our "local" radio stations (owned & operated by a large
corporate conglomerate), who claim to have their fingers on the pulse, defining
what is the Colorado music scene and the culture surrounding. The way we
figure, who better to define the pulse than the pulse itself? And it doesn’t stop there – we want to celebrate and help
promote all aspects of Colorado culture whether it be filmmakers, artists, photographers,
comedians, apparel designers, restauranteurs, business owners, etc. That
is how the RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS idea was conceived.
What exactly is RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS?
RE Sessions will be a podcast supported by video content. For those who do not
know what a podcast is, the traditional podcast is a digital audio file made
available on the Internet for downloading to a computer or portable media
player, typically available as a series, new installments of which can be
received by subscribers automatically. Podcasts have the capability to reach an
endless number of people and have become one of the best outlets for
entertainment and information sourcing. RE Sessions will be an audio/visual platform
showcasing the diverse Colorado local music scene and beyond. Though the emphasis
will be on the music, our all-inclusive platform serves anything Colorado. 
Our format will be
simple. Similar to a late night talk show, we aspire to bring in local
talent, entrepreneurs, and any Players in whatever game it is that you
play. We want to interview and give YOU the opportunity to provide a
comprehensive description of what makes you, your product, or business venture
unique. We'll sit down with you, vibe, and have some uncensored fun. Our studio
will be equipped for top-notch audio/visual transmission and as a result, every
podcast will include a jam session featuring RADIO ENEMY or whichever Colorado
artist(s) that may want to come through and throw down. All RE Sessions installments
will be available via YouTube and/or the Radio Enemy Sessions website for guests
and fellow Coloradans to view and share. 
The good news is, we already have a
prime time spot, located right in the heart of downtown Denver and the majority
of audio and computer equipment required. The bad news is, we need some
renovations to make this all come to fruition and actually realize our
vision. We already have the meat and potatoes, what we need now is the
dressing and dessert. This is where we need you! The following is a list of the
equipment we will need to make RADIO ENEMY SESSIONS vision a reality:
· Drum
mics
· Subs
& Speakers
· Podcast
Mics (x4)
· Table
Mic Stands
·Headphones
· 10 Go
Pro Cameras
· Desk
· Chairs

seat

story:
Who Are We?

We're Catalina Shortwave. A straight-up, no nonsense Rock n' Roll band from Southwestern Connecticut. Five guys- Dave Rizzo (Vocals), Marty Stauffer (Guitars), Keith Morey (Guitars), Roy Scaturro (Bass) and John Garvey (Drums) who are living their life's dream of playing and recording killer original rock. We've been together since late 2013, and have released three albums- ">>REPEATER>>", "RADIO VOODOO: SONGS FROM THE DARK END OF THE DIAL" and "WAX EX-STATIC". All of our music is available wherever you stream or buy digital music through a worldwide distribution network. Our music has garnered high praise from reviewers all over the world as well- the U.K., every country in Western Europe, China, Brazil, South Africa and of course the United States.  

  Since we started gigging in the summer of '14, we have played nearly 60 shows- from New London to New Rochelle, New Haven to Boston, Newburgh to Philadelphia. Although we consider NYC, Brooklyn and Queens our home turf, we have enjoyed a one-year residency at The Lumberyard in Georgetown, CT., where we bring NYC-style showcase rock shows once a month. With our high-energy shows featuring all original music from our catalogue, we have become a force in the independent rock community. We are in high demand at some of the most high-profile venues around.

  We recorded our first album, >>REPEATER>>, in a cold, wet New England basement on a computer that was so old it forgot to die. But the album gave us material to start playing live shows. We did it on a budget of zero. We did it ourselves. It had a very lo-fi vibe which we played up. 

  For our second album, "RADIO VOODOO", we were ready to start turning pro. We had gained enough attention and traction with the first album that the time and expense was justified to really do it right. We secured an outstanding recording facility with a top-shelf engineer, then we WENT TO THE PEOPLE. OUR FANS. We ran an online crowdfunding campaign that was extremely successful, and we were able to release "RADIO VOODOO" in September '15. And it took off like a shot.

  Now we had some momentum which we capitalized on by following up with a 5 song EP, "WAX- EX-STATIC", less than five months after the release of "RADIO VOODOO". We were on a roll. And we paid for "WAX EX-STATIC" ourselves, using the same recording facility and engineer. We felt we owed it to our fans to give them another record straight away, without any outside contributions. And the fans are eating it up.

  Which brings us to today.

  Even as "WAX EX-STATIC" was in post-production, we were already writing songs for the next, as-yet untitled, full length fourth album. Even though we have negotiated very reasonable fees with the studio, we need help. FROM THE PEOPLE. OUR FANS. YOU. This album has the potential to be our breakout album. We have some influential people in the industry who are watching us; to see what we can do next. We know what we have is really, really good. Some might call it epic. And in order to deliver what will be our best album to date, we need some financial support. You can be a part of a great thing. You can say, "I helped them when they asked for help; look at them now".   

  What do we need and where will it go?

  Our goal is to raise a substantial amount of the funding necessary to cover post-production costs. What are those? Post-production includes the mixing engineers' fees to properly mix all the songs on the album; our engineer uses state-of-the-art software and hardware to accomplish this. Also included in post-production are the costs incurred by the Mastering engineer to make the album radio-ready. We use a Mastering engineer in Chicago who has done work for some of the biggest bands in the world. The quality of his work is second to none. Lastly, the manufacturing of CD's as well as fees for distribution across all delivery platforms such as iTunes, CDBaby, Amazon and others. 

  Along with dedication to our craft, high-quality recordings and explosive live performances, momentum is absolutely critical to success. We have to stay on the radar constantly in order to maximize the kinetic energy we have developed. Keep playing as many live shows as possible, utilize social media extensively (we have almost 14k "likes" on Facebook and around 4k "followers" on Twitter, and are actively investigating other platforms and professional marketing strategies ), and keep the flow of great new music fast and furious. 

  Catalina Shortwave is not a "Hobby" band. Not by a long shot. We love what we do with unequaled passion, and are deadly serious about doing it right and taking it as far as we can. With your help, dreams can become reality.

story:
What's Up With Frontier Jazz?

My name is Jacqui Sutton, and I am the lead vocalist and bandleader for the Houston-based Frontier Jazz Orchestra. 

I don't buy the conventional wisdom from last year's election that said: "rural and urban America don't understand each other, therefore we are doomed!" I don't buy it because I have been combining those parts of America in my music for the past 7 years by blending jazz and bluegrass. Not only do we enjoy performing this mashup of sound, but audiences love it.

Thanks to the Houston Arts Alliance, I am stretching myself as a songwriter and as a producer. Instead of covering songs written by other writers, I'm now composing my own Frontier Jazz works, and this process has been life-changing. As a producer, I'm challenged with manifesting this vision as an immersive audience experience on our largest scale to date.

The work I've done over the last year will culminate in the debut of "Un-Cross Talk" this March 16-17 at the MATCH in midtown Houston. "Un-Cross Talk" puts the urban and the rural together through music and audiovisual textures. Am I terrified? Yes! I've never presented original works in such a large venue before. But I am also excited because I know I am working with amazing musicians, who have trusted me these many years to keep jazz and bluegrass in conversation.

The Download

My biggest line item is musician fees. In order to pull off this Frontier Jazz orchestral sound, I am working with nine (9) professional jazz and classical musicians. I believe in paying musicians a fair wage for their rehearsals and performances, because as someone once said: "Exposure can't be banked or pay the light bills". So, here's what I still need:

  • Rehearsal and Performance Fees: $7,800
  • Live Audio and Video Recording: $2,500
  • Venue Fees (includes licensing, insurance and technical labor): $3,600
  • Ticket Subsidies for Financial Need: $1,500

That last item is important to me. I want to offer free tickets to community members for whom $20 admission is still a burden.

My Values

I've always been an adventurous person, and I come from a multi-cultural family. I believe that given the current climate, we should find as many ways as possible to bring people and cultures together. The argument over "what is American" is to me, a false one. In music, jazz and bluegrass are uniquely American art forms, though they hail from different parts of this country. I thought: "Why should I have to choose one style? I love them both. Why can't I just combine them?" Well, I did! 

My hope is that in some way, listening to, and supporting the mission of Frontier Jazz will be one of many steps on the path to remembering what is truly American: Our strength together. This is the message of "Un-Cross Talk": Instead of talking across and past each other, let's slow down, unfold our angry arms, and hear each other.

A New Role For Me

My main concern right now is ensuring that 700 people attend this event. This is the first time I've produced something on this scale. The venue space at MATCH has 350 seats, and we will perform (and record live) across two days. To help fill those seats, I'm relying on my deep ties in the Houston community.

  • I am working with leaders in Houston's Third Ward (which is where Frontier Jazz was created), to spread the word
  • I am partnering with local organizations such as Inprint House, where we had a combined sneak preview and literary reading to generate buzz
  • The Frontier Jazz Orchestra is encouraged by local jazz presenters to keep up its mission. To that end, Da Camera of Houston has engaged us to perform at Discovery Green in April as part of Jazz Appreciation Month

The Frontier Jazz Orchestra has a track record of staging high quality performances for the Houston Community and nationally. "Un-Cross Talk" marks a significant step up in scale and vision, and I'm working like the dickens to ensure that 700 people know about and buy tickets to this concert.

All Support Is Gratefully Received

Many of you likely don't live in the Houston area, and won't be able to attend "Un-Cross Talk", or maybe you do live in the area, but are strapped financially. I get it! Word of mouth is valuable, and I would consider any shout-outs and nudges as heartfelt gifts. 

So, if you can only support by clicking a "share" button through Indiegogo tools, I will thank you heartily.

Haven't heard my music before? My SoundCloud account has lots for you to listen to. I recommend getting your feet wet with "Summertime".

Yours in music,

~Jacqui

story:
Greetings! My name is Emily Lewis. I am a singer, songwriter living in the foothills of the Santa Cruz mountains.

Music has played such a huge role in shaping who I am and how I relate to the world. 

I feel more strongly NOW than ever that it is time to bring my songs & music out and into the world! If I could impact one person’s experience like music has done for me than I feel I have accomplished my destiny’s thread.

Last year I released an album with Naia Graham under our duo project Sweet Medicine. We ran two successful crowd-funding campaigns and with YOUR help we released our debut self-titled album (under the artist name: Emily Lewis and Naia Graham). I am now super excited to start sharing some of my solo music that I have been writing for MANY years and it all starts with this 5 song EP! If you donated to Sweet Medicine's fundraising campaign and you enjoyed our album I urge you to consider donating to this campaign! The songs are going to be really magical I promise! 

There are some amazing guest musicians on the album including Orion Freeman who contributes his mad guitar skills and is the primary recording engineer, Todd Boston (composer, guitarist/multi instrumentalist and producer), Kevin Dinoto (an amazing drummer and percussionist) and more! I will be doing the rest of the recording and mixing in a local Santa Cruz studio (more info on this tbd).   

In order to complete the recording process I am reaching out to you: my fans, friends and family to contribute to make the project possible!

Financial Breakdown

Your donations will help offset the following costs:

  • $2500 for studio time, recording, and musician fees
  • $1500 for mixing and mastering, CD duplication, digital distribution, legal registration fees & reward mailing costs

Even if I don't reach my funding goal ALL contributions will be put towards the album costs and I will contribute my own resources in order to complete the project!   

Current Status of the Project:

All the vocals, harmonies and guitar parts are recorded at this point BUT I still need funding to record the additional instrumentation & for mixing, mastering, production, distribution and licensing costs.

The goal is to complete recording of the instrumentation in the spring of 2018 and have the album be made available by June 2018! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share my campaign on your facebook page and through Indiegogo
  • Invite your friends and family to check out my music  

With Infinite Gratitude, 

Emily Lewis

story:
Luke is a singer songwriter, worship leader and missionary from London UK. He takes his music to both conferences and churches in the UK and refugee camps and developing nations.

As Jesus died and rose again, he overcame death, sin and sickness. We believe this truth can and will change the world. The title track of this album is a declaration of the gospel and the whole album is a call for the nations to know the truth of the gospel and live in the freedom it brings.

Luke and his wife Ellie are full time missionaries, volunteering their time in refugee camps and third world nations. They're travelling a lot and have no full time income. Your money will firstly go towards recording and releasing an album that glorifies Jesus. But secondly, will be a part of funding the work they do.

P R E   P R O D U C T I O N  &   S T U D I O   T I M E : £1650

B A N D   P A Y M E N T : £1200

P O S T   P R O D U C T I O N : £650

D I G I T A L   D I S T R I B U T I O N   &   M E D I A : £500

- Please S H A R E  the campaign on all forms of social media etc.

- T E L L  everyone you know

- P R A Y ! We would love your support in prayer.

I N S T A G R A M : https://www.instagram.com/lukehodgin/ 

F A C E B O O K : https://m.facebook.com/lukeandellie.hodgin9

Y O U T U B E : https://m.youtube.com/user/LukeHodginMusic
story_txt: Luke is a singer songwriter, worship leader and missionary from London UK. He takes his music to both conferences and churches in the UK and refugee camps and developing nations.As Jesus died and rose again, he overcame death, sin and sickness. We believe this truth can and will change the world. The title track of this album is a declaration of the gospel and the whole album is a call for the nations to know the truth of the gospel and live in the freedom it brings.Luke and his wife Ellie are full time missionaries, volunteering their time in refugee camps and third world nations. They're travelling a lot and have no full time income. Your money will firstly go towards recording and releasing an album that glorifies Jesus. But secondly, will be a part of funding the work they do.P R E   P R O D U C T I O N  &   S T U D I O   T I M E : £1650B A N D   P A Y M E N T : £1200P O S T   P R O D U C T I O N : £650D I G I T A L   D I S T R I B U T I O N   &   M E D I A : £500- Please S H A R E  the campaign on all forms of social media etc.- T E L L  everyone you know- P R A Y !
