story:
The Mindz EuroTrip

After years of growth in serving the community we love, we're ready to ask for some help again.  Our members have grown into leaders in the city through their performance, classes, and participation in programs across the different communities of Austin and the world. Our work puts us around the next generation everyday as well as in the eye of those before us, and our music is the story teller that bridges the gap. Here's why we're leaving this time and what we need your help with.

  • This is our second major opportunity to hit Europe with acceptance into a festival in France. In addition the organizers have lined up shows in the week before and the week after the week long festival.
  • With helping us raise this funding you'll help MDK and Flobama reach the next major step in taking our musical endeavors to a career level, and with that give us the freedom to create greater opportunities for the youth in the developmental programs we find just as much passion in.

This trip is a major jump off point and already has so many people ready to see MDK and crew arrive overseas! This is the point in the process when you'll really start to see what the full potential of the Mindz could be and already is.

"They are the voice of the streets, the soundtrack to a revolution that will not be televised and, with an outstanding full-length debut, “Foursight,” they’re ready to blast onto a national stage." - My Statesman

What We Need & What You Get

To give it to you straight forward and in a bit more detail:

  • We're asking for $10,000 to assist with travel($3,500), merchandising/marketing($2,500), and lodging($4,000).

  •  $3500 to purchase 6 plane tickets at just under $550, 4 mcs, 1 dj, and 1 photographer/social media mangager.

  • $2,500 gets us merchandise and marketing. $500 to new pins and hats, $500 to 2 new shirt designs (+screen), $1000 to creating marketing content, $500 to printing and shipping.

  • $4000 is a safety cushion for at home and oversea stay while we're gone the month of September, 2 weeks of lodging is already taken care of overseas. 

  • Yeeeooo and the perks tho. Range!  Could be a pin or a hat, a cameo in the next MDK video release, your name on the list at shows for a year, or all of that. That's all for you to decide, and if it aint there, ask about it.
  • IF we don't reach our goal, and we're still able to afford all of our plane tickets we're still going, and it's just gonna be a bit more grassroots. IF that can't happen then we'll move the money to fund our next project to record an album with the men inside of San Quentin and their children in the area, then perform it on the yard. We've had 4 performances with the men on the yard so far, still haven't cut an album, yet, so this is already in the works.

The Impact

This isn't just a huge opportunity for MDK it's a big move for ATX hip hop as a whole and is a major step in showing the how a city can build a group with love and send them out to be great. 

  • With your help we'll be traveling to meet with two other local music acts, and if the tour is fully confirmed we may bring a few Cali legends with us to hype the vibe and continue into October.
  • We've started recording with two French producers as of May, from the region we'll be touring in and they've aligned several shows through their network with their fanbase ready to show up. They've also received a grant to take care of our stay there for at least 2 weeks in a single house in a central location.
  • We're reaching out to a few different companies for sponsorship like Bragi headphone (translates 8 languages in your ear, really hoping for that one), and we'd love to connect to some local clothing lines and  different retailers to form some beneficial partnerships we can both grow with to bring it back to our home city, and we welcome all serious inquiries. 

Risks & Challenges

The real risks are upfront in us just not trying to get there because we don't have the money right now. We know we have a lot of love for our folk, and it comes back when we ask for it. We've made it into San Quentin, and we've made it to Kenya with y'all's help. This is the leap to no looking back for a while, cause we know our people are running with us. For any unexpected challenges that may pop we've got a network of associates and mentors ready to help get us past them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this post and get the word out, make some noise with MDK about whats happening, tell your friends! Tell ya mama, ya papa, ya grandmama, and all them!  .
  • BUMP MDK in your car, at your office, anywhere you can expose new ears to the groove.
  • Like MDK across social platforms.
  • Try to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for checking it out and we hope to see you somewhere dope the next time we do!

story:
My Story

Hi I'm Lisa Yaeger, a Bistro Award Winner and MAC Award Nominated Cabaret Singer and performer based in New York City. To learn more about me check me out at www.lisayaeger.com.

On June 2, 2017 I debuted my brand new show JERSEY GIRL, at the acclaimed NYC night club, The Metropolitan Room. JERSEY GIRL is a tribute show celebrating the musical legends who grew up in my home state of New Jersey.  My show ran through 2017 to rave reviews. I won a 2018 Bistro Award for Outstanding Vocalist and was nominated for a 2017 Broadway World Award for Best Show. After each show, audience members would ask to purchase my CD of my show, and I sadly had to tell them, I didn't have one.. YET! That's why I am here, I am ready to get into the recording studio to record this beautiful music. 

The music we are going to record, consists of some incredible performers, singer-songwriters and even arrangers who ALL grew up in New Jersey. Frank Sinatra, Connie Francis, Bruce Springsteen, Dionne Warwick, Count Basie, Janis Ian and so many more! My ASCAP and award winning Musical Director, Rick Jensen has created some incredible arrangements. You are in for a treat!

 

 

What We Need

The fundraising goal for this project is $17,000.

The money raised here will pay for:

Studio time

The Engineer

Mixing

Mastering

The Band; Guitar, Bass and my Musical Director/Pianist

CD manufacturing

CD artwork

Royalties for all songs

 

THANK YOU!

I want to thank you for checking out my campaign. Please make sure you take a look at these great perks on this site. I hope my story will move you to contribute to this project. We cannot do this without YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Every single dollar raised in this campaign is so important! So if you can only give $5, I am just as grateful as if you contributed $1000. 

If you are unable to monetarily support this campaign, there are so many other ways to help. Please help spread the word on social media, through email, in person, hey even snail mail! Any form of communication to help get the word out will be greatly appreciated. I am truly grateful.

From the bottom of my heart, I thank you for your support and contributions!

-Lisa

story:
Rock On & Raise The Global Vibration

Bob Marley, John Lennon, The Beatles, Miles Davis, Michael Jackson, Stevie Wonder, Bobby McFerrin, Victor Wooten,  Mono Neon, Jacob Collier, Esparanza Spalding, Snarky Puppy, Nai Palm, just to name a few... 

These are the artists who we believe rise above, and give true meaning with the art of music.

Music has the power to lead the world in a positive direction and artists have used that power to evolve our consciousness throughout history. 

Authentic art is needed, and has always been a form of media that brings us to love. That is exactly what we are creating here with this campaign, as Two Cities One World, and as individuals inside our lives every day!

We Are One

Hello there! We are Jared and Anna of the band Two Cities One World. (Jared is from St. Louis, USA and Anna is from Sofia, Bulgaria, hence the name ... Two Cities One World!)

We want you to know that when we created this band in 2012, we committed to creating powerful, authentic and artful music...

...to inspire all people of the world to rise to their highest potential and live their dreams. 

This is our purpose, and that includes YOU! 

Two Cities One World is for all people in this world. All cultures, all races, all religions, everyone and everything! We care equally for all forms of life and our music reflects that.

 

While this is "our" campaign for a new studio album, it's not about us...

This is about you. It's about everyone. Our brothers and sisters of the world.

If you're reading this, you are obviously a human being who wants to join and share the REVOLUTION OF TRUTH AND LOVE in our rapidly evolving world... so we ask for you to get involved right now!

This year, we committed to going all the way into our dreams and only spend time doing the things we truly love; and that is the name of this new album - "The Things We Love"! 

We wish the same for you. Life on earth is short ... let's just do what we love! Dig?

By you supporting this album, you are making a conscious commitment to yourself… to do more and more of the things you really love. We want this to represent your commitment to yourself to rising to your highest potential and also supporting others on their journey as well!

The Law of Vibration Is Alive...

We believe that when a person follows their natural desires in life they are taking the call of their true destiny. If you ignore that, however, you put a stop to the natural flow of life.

Here is a beautiful example:a bee follows its natural desire to enjoy the nectar of flowers… Yet the bee doesn’t realize that it’s pollinating our planet on the way back to the hive and our whole world grows as a result of that…

So when you follow your dreams and simply do the things you love, you make the universe evolve in a positive way that you may never comprehend.

Do The Things You Love

You must follow your natural desires! Live your dreams! That is what we are all meant to do. 

By supporting us in creating this album, you are committing to yourself and committing to supporting others in doing the things they love as well. 

Thanks so much for contributing to this campaign, which remember -- is more than a campaign...

It’s a revolution!

 

What We Need & What You Get

$7,777 is our basic goal to cover - recording, production, mixing and mastering.

(Dear supporter: If you also happen to be a musician, you know that it actually will cost us more than that basic amount to produce the album ... we are not looking to "get rich" with this campaign ... and we truly love this lucky number (7777) and are happy to fund more out of pocket as needed. 

Again, this isn't about us ... it's about coming together as a global community and creating authentic messaging and vibrations fueled by creative music!

When we surpass our initial goal of $7,777, we will use the additional funding to create powerful, purposeful and artful music videos to inspire and uplift society!

 

Fun Perks

We have selected fun perks with good discounts for all of you who believe in us and are excited to join the party! Check them out and please contact us if you have any questions or special requests! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Honestly, if you're not in a position to contribute financially, that's ok! We love you and are grateful that you are here anyway! Here are a few non-monetary ways you can help us:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You can do this by emailing and sharing our campaign on social platforms as much as possible. It makes a HUGE difference to us. (P.S. Indiegogo has great sharing tools btw!)
     
  • Join our mailing list and be part of our growing community of music lovers!
     
  • Come out to see us live! Support other live music as well! (<---- That's a BIG one, we need you!!)

And that's all there is to it. WE love you and we are so grateful that you exist. Thank you.

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You can do this by emailing and sharing our campaign on social platforms as much as possible. It makes a HUGE difference to us. (P.S. Indiegogo has great sharing tools btw!) 
Join our mailing list and be part of our growing community of music lovers! 
Come out to see us live! Support other live music as well! (<---- That's a BIG one, we need you!!)

story:
Hello, we're The Herron Brothers

As you can see, we are actually brothers, it's not just a clever name, and we've been making music for longer than we'd care to talk about. 

The Album

Although we've put out a load of EP's and an album (as well as several albums in our last band 'The Sons') we consider this to be our debut. The Album has been recorded in 4 separate studios with a whole host of different Drummers, Bass players, Keyboard players, percussionists etc. They're all brilliant, Thanks everyone!

YOU ARE NOT PAYING FOR THE ALBUM. Oh no no no!! We don't need money for studio time, or for session musicians, it's all done, and we've spent our hard earned time and money over the past few years to ensure it's the best thing EVER!! (Seriously, it's really really good)

 

We need £20,000 (Yes it is a lot of money)

Whaaaaaat?!?!? I hear you shout, ok then, lets not mess about, here's how the money will be spent:

  • PR - This is where the majority of the funds will go, in the past we've spent a few hundred pounds on mini PR campaigns and to be honest the results varied from average to underwhelming. We will work with Lander PR who will put together a custom promo campaign involving careful placement of our music and our brand in all the right places, radio, print press, online, TV etc.... We're really excited to work with Lander, their track record is phenomenal and they've worked with some truly great artists at a truly global level. Working with them we will release 2 or 3 singles and then the album will come out, the campaign will run in conjunction with....
  • The Tour - We will be embarking on a UK tour, the scale of which we have never had the money to do before, some of the funds that you will help us raise will go towards transport, accommodation, paying our musicians and most importantly working with a reputable booking agent who can book us into the right places. Of course you can't go on tour if you have nothing to sell after the show, which brings us nicely onto....
  • Merchandise - the remainder of the funds will be spend on the good stuff, namely CD's, Digital Distribution, Vinyl and T-shirts.
  • Videos - We will work with Sam Jordan films to produce at least 2 TV quality promotional videos. Sam Is flipping brilliant at what he does, here's a link to a video we did with him a few years ago with The Sons https://youtu.be/c3sE1fM7P68

THE RATIONALE

It really is quite simple, we've done a lot of great music in the past, and we've never ever had the funds to get it out to as many people as we think it deserves, so for once we're gonna do things properly, and that means money. If you believe in what you do, why would you settle for anything less than the best?

GET IN TOUCH, LISTEN, WATCH, ASK, SHARE

We REALLY want this to be an interactive experience, not only will be be putting up regular updates on this page, but we will be hosting live 'Webathon's on our Facebook page. We also encourage you to ask us questions, make suggestions, give us compliments or insult us.

Here's a list of links, have a little click why don't you.

SPOTIFY : https://open.spotify.com/artist/1WdCV4IP99owzGprl4V826?si=r60AFWNzRU6aKrsMITwqHA

FACEBOOK : https://www.facebook.com/HerronBrothers/

YOUTUBE : https://www.youtube.com/TheHerronBrothers

BANDCAMP : https://theherronbrothers.bandcamp.com/

TWITTER: https://twitter.com/Herronbrothers

Ok, thats it from us for the minute

WE CANNOT DO THIS WITHOUT YOU.

THANKYOU, The HB

#HB2018

We're really excited to work with Lander, their track record is phenomenal and they've worked with some truly great artists at a truly global level. The Tour - We will be embarking on a UK tour, the scale of which we have never had the money to do before, some of the funds that you will help us raise will go towards transport, accommodation, paying our musicians and most importantly working with a reputable booking agent who can book us into the right places. Of course you can't go on tour if you have nothing to sell after the show, which brings us nicely onto....

Merchandise - the remainder of the funds will be spend on the good stuff, namely CD's, Digital Distribution, Vinyl and T-shirts.


Videos - We will work with Sam Jordan films to produce at least 2 TV quality promotional videos. Sam Is flipping brilliant at what he does, here's a link to a video we did with him a few years ago with The Sons https://youtu.be/c3sE1fM7P68



THE RATIONALE
It really is quite simple, we've done a lot of great music in the past, and we've never ever had the funds to get it out to as many people as we think it deserves, so for once we're gonna do things properly, and that means money. If you believe in what you do, why would you settle for anything less than the best?
GET IN TOUCH, LISTEN, WATCH, ASK, SHARE
We REALLY want this to be an interactive experience, not only will be be putting up regular updates on this page, but we will be hosting live 'Webathon's on our Facebook page. We also encourage you to ask us questions, make suggestions, give us compliments or insult us.
Here's a list of links, have a little click why don't you.
SPOTIFY : https://open.spotify.com/artist/1WdCV4IP99owzGprl4V826?si=r60AFWNzRU6aKrsMITwqHA
FACEBOOK : https://www.facebook.com/HerronBrothers/
YOUTUBE : https://www.youtube.com/TheHerronBrothers
BANDCAMP : https://theherronbrothers.bandcamp.com/
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/Herronbrothers
Ok, thats it from us for the minute
WE CANNOT DO THIS WITHOUT YOU.
THANKYOU, The HB
#HB2018

story:
Who we are:

We are An Artist’s Depiction - a hybrid, indie-punk rock band from Watkins Glen, NY. We have been playing actively in the area for years now and truly appreciate the friends and fans we’ve met along the way.

Recently, our two-piece band became four. Our overall instrumentation and style has molded into a new sound that we are super excited about. We can’t wait to share our new musical ideas with you.

Rather than do another DIY home record we’ve decided to take our ideas into a professional studio. Anyone who is familiar with the recording process knows that it can get pretty expensive to record and produce a full length album. This is where we could use all of the help we can get.

How you can help:

There is a lot of work that goes into producing a solid album; there are also a lot of costs. Some of the studio expenses include...

  • Studio Rental in Time Blocks
  • Engineer Labor
  • A Mixing Fee
  • A Mastering Fee
  • CD Duplication

With your help, we can cover most of these expenses.

Where does the money go?

We will use all of what we raise for band needs. Below is our list of priorities. Every dime will go toward covering the cost of these things in this exact order.

  • Studio/Album Expenses
  • New Merchandise
  • New Gear

The more donations we get, the more of these things we can afford.

We plan on updating you every step of the way. You'll get to see how your contribtions help us first hand.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are short on funds and are unable to donate we understand, but you can still help. Anyone can spread the word and help us get our campaign in front of as many eyes as possible. Between sharing the campaign online, and telling you friends in person, you can help us move one step closer to reaching our funding goal.

Thank you so much for finding interest in our campaign, and helping us with any contributions you make.

story:
We are 4 emerging Costa Rican composers based abroad who were chosen to write new original works for an upcoming July concert by the Orquesta Sinfónica de Heredia. Since it is rare in Costa Rica to have a concert showcasing the music of young composers, we want to take this opportunity to professionally film and record it – our goal is to encourage the current establishment of concert music in Costa Rica to entrust a new generation of composers with more opportunities to have our music performed.

We need your financial support  to cover expenses for video/audio recording, traveling to Costa Rica for the rehearsals, mixing & mastering, album art design, and CD production, among other things. Usually these expenses are covered by state funds (the private sector's help in art is almost non-existent in Costa Rica), but shrinking budgets in times of economic austerity have made it difficult to find the financial assistance we need.

We agreed to write these works for free because we believe in the value that creating new art has in the shaping of culture. We are simply hoping to cover the expenses associated with producing a top-notch audiovisual recording and making it available for online streaming, as well as having a hard copy that we can share with our contacts. Scroll down to get to know who we are!

Event Details

Mostly comprised by young musicians, the Orquesta Sinfónica de Heredia is an orchestra that focuses on new and unexplored music from Latin America. Under the leadership of Latin Grammy winner composer and conductor Eddie Mora, it has risen to a prominent role in Costa Rican culture, performing works by Latin American composers and recording several albums during the last few years. For its fourth concert of the 2018 season, Eddie decided to yield the baton to a young Costa Rican conductor based in South Dakota, Luis A. Viquez, and let him premiere 4 new works by 4 emerging composers who live outside of Costa Rica: Pablo Chin (who lives in NYC), Jose Mora Jimenez (who lives in the Netherlands), Guido Sanchez (who lives in Illinois, USA) and Andrés Soto (who lives in New Jersey, USA)

Two concerts are scheduled:

July 21st, Parroquia Inmaculada Concepción, Heredia, Costa Rica. (8pm)

July 22nd, Eugene O'Neill Theater, San José, Costa Rica. (11am)

Carlos "Pipo" Chaves, a Latin Grammy-winning sound engineer, has offered to record the concert for us for a reduced fee, so we are hoping to produce a first-rate audiovisual recording that shows a new generation of Costa Rican musicians coming into their own with the help of two established figures.

What We Need 

We need a total of $5250, to cover the following expenses:

  • $2000 for audio/visual live recording expenses for the orchestra concert + mixing/mastering.
  • $1600 for traveling expenses to Costa Rica for 2 composers, 2 weeks (Soto and Chin)
  • $1000 for CD-production expenses (printing, editing, streaming fees, etc)
  • $400 for album cover artwork design*
  • IndieGogo charges 5% of our crowdfunding total ($250)

*We want to comission a young Costa Rican artist (TBA) to design the cover art for our album. 

If we don't reach the goal, whatever we get will go towards recording and traveling expenses. Keep in mind IndieGogo charges 5% of our crowdfunding campaign!

Check the perks we offer!

The Impact

With your generous donation, you would be supporting the development of Costa Rica's next generation of composers and contributing towards having a stronger presence in the Latin American concert music scene. We plan to share this album around the world so we can inspire younger composers to continue to strive in their quest for obtaining commissions, while also hoping to encourage other institutions (both in the U.S., Europe, and Latin America) to support Hispanic composers by commissioning their music more often. Last year, the National Symphony of Costa Rica actually won a Latin Grammy for the first time with an album of works by Costa Rican composers from previous generations (which was, incidentally, produced by Eddie Mora and Carlos "Pipo" Chaves). With their help, we plan to submit this CD to try to compete in the same category next year.

We thank you for your generous donation, and please remember to share this campaign on your social media platforms!

 

Meet the Composers

 

Pablo Santiago Chin


Having just relocated from Chicago to New York, Pablo Chin is an adjunct professor of electronic music at Drew University. Recent works by Chin draw inspiration from the narratives of film and literature, phonetic structures in text, and the use of idiosyncratic transcription methods that enable imaginative exploration of pre-existent musical sources.
His music has been performed in South, Central and North America; in Israel, Asia and in Europe. Chin is co-founder and artistic director of the Fonema Consort, a Chicago-based ensemble dedicated to commissioning and fostering works that explore the capabilities of the human voice in the context of late 20th and 21st centuries.
Website: http://www.pablochin.com/


Jose Mora-Jimenez

Jose Mora-Jimenez resides in the Netherlands since 2006 and completed his composition studies at the Royal Conservatory in The Hague under Gilius van Bergeijk and Cornelis de Bondt. He has received several awards, including the International Timo Korhonen Composition Competition, the 4th Calefax Reed Quintet Competition, 50th anniversary award of the "Vrienden van het Lied" association. A multitalented man, he also is an active composer for video games and has a Masters degree in Cultural Economics and Entrepeneurship from the Erasmus University in Rotterdam. His music is performed in different countries around the world and is published by Berben Edizioni Musicali in Italy and Les Productions D’OZ in Canada.
Website: http://www.josemorajimenez.com/

 

Guido Sanchez Portuguez

An active performer, educator and composer based in Illinois, Guido is one of the most talented guitarists to come out of Costa Rica, having obtained a full scholarship to study guitar at the University of Indiana, where he completed his doctorate in 2012. He has recorded 5 albums with Costa Rican guitar orchestras, and has produced and arranged albums for Grammy winner Sylvia McNair and the Latin American Popular Music Ensemble of the Jacobs School of Music. 
He is currently professor of classical guitar at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

Website: https://www.guidoguitar.com/

 

Andrés Soto Marín

Based in New York City, Andrés Soto is an active composer of both film music and concert music. He obtained a scholarship from the National Hispanic Foundation for the Arts to study at New York University, where he obtained a masters degree in 2011. Recently, his Suite No.1 from "La Rosa y el Niño", was premiered at the Palau de les Arts Reina Sofia in Valencia, Spain, where it was well received. The National Symphony of Costa Rica has commissioned him with large-scale works in two occasions, in 2015 and 2016. Incidentally, the Orquesta Sinfónica de Heredia was the first ensemble to ever commission a piece from him, in 2012. Recent film scores include "Buscando a Marcos Ramirez" and "He Matado a mi Marido", as well as the video game "Guns of Icarus: Alliance." His music is published by Abundant Silence.

Website: www.andres-soto.net / www.facebook.com/andres.soto.composer

 

Meet the Conductor

Luis A. Viquez

Luis A. Viquez is a Costa Rican native who enjoys an international career both as a clarinetist and as an orchestral, opera and wind band conductor. As Director of Orchestral Activities at the University of South Dakota (USA) Víquez is the Music Director of the University of South Dakota Symphony Orchestra. Víquez has performed and conducted throughout the United States, Costa Rica, Panama, Colombia, Guatemala, Honduras, England and Taiwan. As a guest conductor, Víquez has led the orchestras of the University of Missouri, the Cartago Symphony Orchestra, the Midwest Chamber Ensemble of Kansas City, the Truman Symphony Orchestra, the Truman State University Wind Symphony and Concert Band, and the National Symphonic Band of San Jose. He has been a featured conductor at the 2013 Music Teachers National Association Conference in Anaheim, California, and recently performed as a guest soloist at the 2016 Missouri Music Educators Conference and  at the 2016 NACUSA National Composers USA Conference in Knoxville, TN. Opera conducting appearances include Menotti's "The Old Maid and the Thief" with the Truman Opera Theater in 2013, Mozart's "Die Zauberflote" and Britten's "The Turn of the Screw" with the UMKC Opera Theater in 2015 and 2016; and "Die Fledermaus" wiith the University of South Dakota Opera in 2017. 


Guest Soloist - Marcela Alfaro, mezzo soprano

Marcela Alfaro is a Costa Rican mezzo soprano with an active international career, having performed in festivals and recitals in Mexico, Spain, Colombia, Cuba, and Central America. She’s the lead mezzo soprano of Syntagma Musicum, a chamber ensemble that won the National Music Award in 2013. In 2007 she won the Young Soloists Competition in Costa Rica. Recent performances include featured soloist in Handel’s Messiah at the Teatro Ruben Dario in Nicaragua, and in Beethoven’s 9th at the National Theater of Costa Rica. She is also an active educator at the University of Costa Rica (her alma mater) and the Innova Music School.

 

Some photos related to the people involved in this campaign:

Carlos "Pipo" Chaves receiving the Latin Grammy for Best Classical Album, as producer of the National Symphony of Costa Rica's "Musica de Compositores Costarricenses, Vol.2". He will produce our album too!

 

Eddie Mora, artistic director of the OSH, being interviewed on CNN en Español.

 
La Jove Orquestra de la UMA performing Suite No.1 from La Rosa y el Niño, by Andrés Soto, in Valencia, Spain. Conducted by Enric Parreño at the Palau de les Arts Reina Sofia.
 

"Mobile #3: Schizo", by Jose Mora Jimenez, performed at the 8th CALEFAN Festival in Amsterdam, Netherlands.

 

"Ausencia", for Guitar Quartet, by Guido Sanchez Portuguez, performed in The Hague, Netherlands.

"In the Form of a Shell", by Pablo Chin, in a coreographed setting at Scripps College in Claremont, California.

 
 

Luis Viquez conducting the University of North Dakota Symphony Orchestra. 
A personal message from Maestro Viquez:

 

The Orquesta Sinfónica de Heredia performing Andres Soto's "Tio Conejo", a symphonic tale for narrator and orchestra. Rodolfo Gonzalez, narrator. Eddie Mora, conductor. Story by Carmen Lyra.

story:
Resumen

Summary

La Orquesta de Flautas Illawara (OFI) nace en el año 2014 al interior de la cátedra de Flauta Traversa del Prof. Wilson Padilla, en el Departamento de Música de la Facultad de Artes de la Universidad de Chile y a lo largo de este período se ha conseguido tener un espacio importante dentro de la escena musical en nuestra casa de estudios y fuera de ella, donde muchos compositores vigentes al interior del cuerpo de profesores y estudiantes de nuestra institución se han motivado a realizar trabajos junto a nosotros.

The Illawara Flute Orchestra (IFO) started in 2014 from the Professor Wilson Padilla cathedra of the Traverse Flute, in the Music Department of the Faculty of Arts of the University of Chile and during this period had managed to have an important space within the musical scene in University and outside of it, where many current composers within the body of professors and students of our institution have been motivated to perform works with ILLAWARA.

 

En el devenir de estos años, la orquesta ha ido creciendo y ya somos 35 los músicos la que la conformamos quienes ejecutamos diversos tipos de flauta que van desde el flautín hasta la flauta baja en do, permitiendo un amplio registro y otorgando una sonoridad muy especial y característica a la única agrupación que tiene esta conformación en nuestro país.


In the course of these years, the orchestra has been growing and we are already 35 musicians that make it up who play different types of flute ranging from the flute to the flute low in C, allowing a broad record and giving a very special sonority and characteristic to the only group that has this conformation in our country.

 

Como consecuencia natural de la evolución de la OFI y considerando el nivel de ejecución que tiene nuestros músicos, es que nos animamos a postular a la 46a Convención Anual de Flautas y fuimos seleccionados este año entre 500 propuestas del mundo como la agrupación que dará el Concierto de Pre-gala en Orlando, EEUU. a desarrollarse entre el 9 y 12 de agosto del presente año.

As a natural consequence of the evolution of the Orchestra, and considering the level of execution that our musicians have, we are encouraged to apply for the 46th Annual Flute Convention and we were selected this year among 500 proposals from the world as the group that will give the Concert of Pre-gala in Orlando, USA. to be developed between August 9 and 12 of this year.

 

Esta oportunidad es única e inédita para la historia de la flauta chilena, ya que por una parte avala el  interesante trabajo que se ha realizado; muestra una evolución de nuestra agrupación y considera el gran nivel de ejecución que tienen nuestros músicos y las horas de estudio que le hemos dedicado  para lograr un nivel de excelencia en la interpretación de las distintas piezas que ejecutamos. Es también una oportunidad histórica de representar a Chile -y por primera vez- en un formato de orquesta totalmente único y original en el país, interpretando un repertorio de creaciones musicales de la región latinoamericana, atractivo y cautivador: Violeta Parra, Astor Piazzola junto a otros compositores resonarán con sus melodías y ritmos característicos desde los Andes Australes al hemisferio norte.

This opportunity is unique and unprecedented for the history of the Chilean flute, since on the one hand it supports the interesting work ILLAWARA has been done; shows an evolution of our group and considers the high level of execution that our musicians have and the hours of study that we have dedicated to achieve a level of excellence in the interpretation of the different pieces we play. It is also a historic opportunity to represent Chile - and for the first time - in a totally unique and original orchestra format in the country, performing a repertoire of musical creations from the Latin American region, attractive and captivating: Violeta Parra, Astor Piazzola with other composers will resonate with their melodies and characteristic rhythms from the Southern Andes to the northern hemisphere.

 

Este proyecto se presenta en esta plataforma ya que necesitamos contar con los fondos y lograr materializar nuestra presentación en esta convención, lo que nos brindará la posibilidad de continuar en la senda del desarrollo musical y profesional de nuestros jóvenes intérpretes y a la vez nos abrirá las puertas para representar a nuestra Universidad y a nuestro país en escenarios internacionales como es el caso que presentamos hoy.

This project is presented on this platform as we need to have the funds and materialize our presentation at this convention, which will give us the possibility to continue on the path of musical and professional development of our young interpreters and at the same time open the doors to represent our University and our country in international scenarios, as is the case we present today.

 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

What we need and what you get

 

La OFI - para 35 músicos que están comprometidos en esta ocasión - necesita la suma aproximada total  de US$65,000.-, la cual cubre los gastos de pasajes aéreos, alojamiento, Alimentación, inscripción en la NFA, traslados de la agrupación de aeropuerto a hotel y v/v, entre otros. 

The IFO - for 35 musicians who are engaged on this occasion - needs the approximate total amount of US $ 65,000.-, which covers the costs of air tickets, accommodation, food, registration in the NFA, transfers from the airport to the hotel. and v / v, among others.

 

Como agrupación agradecemos desde ya toda la ayuda que recibiremos y quisiéramos compartirles que estaremos felices de poder llevarles a sus lugares de trabajo lo que sabemos hacer: tocar nuestra música.

As a group, we are grateful for all the help we will receive and we would like to share with you that we will be happy to be able to take to your work places what we know how to do: play our music.

 

Es por ésto, que les ofrecemos de manera exclusiva a los mayores donantes una interesante recompensa...

This is why we offer an interesting reward to the biggest donors exclusively ...

 

En caso de no conseguir los fondos necesarios - desde esta plataforma junto a otras gestiones ya comenzadas - devolveremos el dinero íntegramente a todos los que generosamente colaboraron. 

In case of not obtaining the necessary funds - from this platform together with other efforts already begun - we will return the money in full to all those who generously collaborated.

 

      

El impacto

The impact

 

Esta campaña que busca conseguir ayuda monetaria hará posible por una parte, que los estudiantes vivan una experiencia única fuera del ámbito curricular oficial de sus planes de estudios y que los hará experimentar en esta etapa de sus estudios, vivencias profesionales que muy pocos estudiantes chilenos pueden tener. La motivación será un motor impulsor único en sus vidas desde la oportunidad de estar en tierras extranjeras empaparse de y con otras culturas, otras experiencias, junto con abrirles el mundo en su vocación. Por otro lado, a los profesores nos permitirá cruzar las fronteras y poder mostrar, compartir e intercambiar repertorio actual, experiencias pedagógicas, entre otras, con flautistas de todo el mundo.

This campaign that seeks monetary help will make it possible on the one hand for students to live a unique experience outside the official curricular scope of their study plans and that will make them experience at this stage of their studies, professional experiences that very few Chilean students can to have. The motivation will be a driving force unique in their lives from the opportunity to be in foreign lands experience and with other cultures, other experiences, along with opening the world to their vocation. On the other hand, teachers will allow us to cross borders and show, share and exchange current repertoire, pedagogical experiences, among others, with flutists from around the world.

 

Los profesores de cátedra Sr. Wilson Padilla Véliz y Sra. Carolina La Rivera Llombart han experimentado en el desarrollo de sus carreras presentar y representar dentro y fuera de Chile lo que se ha hecho a nivel de aulas universitarias creaciones musicales de compositores nacionales mayoritariamente, tomando como base la herencia, el patrimonio siendo ampliamente reconocida una identidad propia, local y riquísima.

The professors Mr. Wilson Padilla Véliz and Mrs. Carolina La Rivera Llombart have experienced in the development of their careers to present and represent in and out of Chile what has been done at university level, musical creations of national composers mostly, taking as a base the inheritance, the heritage being widely recognized an own, local and very rich identity.

 

Riesgos y desafíos

Risks and challenges

 

Sabemos que el gran riesgo de nuestra cruzada es no llegar a conseguir  los fondos suficientes y tener que suspender nuestra intervención en la Convención, lo cuál sería negativo y lamentable pero estamos muy ciertos que el mayor desafío es jugárnosla por nuestro gran sueño; es poder mostrarnos en esta plataforma y buscar ideas creativas para poder ir juntando un monto de dinero que pudiese contemplar el tener que complementar en un bajo porcentaje lo no donado por la vía de este crowdfunding.


We know that the great risk of our crusade is not getting enough funds and having to suspend our intervention in the Convention, which would be negative and regrettable but we are very certain that the biggest challenge is to gamble on our great dream; is to be able to show us on this platform and look for creative ideas to be able to collect a sum of money that could contemplate having to complement in a low percentage what was not donated through this crowdfunding.

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Other ways you can help
 

Agradecemos nos puedan ayudar a difundir esta campaña pues es la manera que tenemos de llegar a otras personas o instancias que no están en nuestras redes personales y de equipo. La manera más fácil y rápida es hacerlo a través de las herramientas para compartir que tiene esta plataforma, las cuales están a mano.

Desde ya,  ¡¡muchas gracias!!

 

We appreciate you can help us spread this campaign because it is the way we have to reach other people or instances that are not in our personal and team networks. The easiest and fastest way is to do it through the tools to share that this platform has, which are at hand.

We really appreciate all your help!!  thank you very much!!

ILLAWARA FLUTE ORCHESTRA
story_txt:
Resumen
Summary
La Orquesta de Flautas Illawara (OFI) nace en el año 2014 al interior de la cátedra de Flauta Traversa del Prof. Wilson Padilla, en el Departamento de Música de la Facultad de Artes de la Universidad de Chile y a lo largo de este período se ha conseguido tener un espacio importante dentro de la escena musical en nuestra casa de estudios y fuera de ella, donde muchos compositores vigentes al interior del cuerpo de profesores y estudiantes de nuestra institución se han motivado a realizar trabajos junto a nosotros.
The Illawara Flute Orchestra (IFO) started in 2014 from the Professor Wilson Padilla cathedra of the Traverse Flute, in the Music Department of the Faculty of Arts of the University of Chile and during this period had managed to have an important space within the musical scene in University and outside of it, where many current composers within the body of professors and students of our institution have been motivated to perform works with ILLAWARA.
 
En el devenir de estos años, la orquesta ha ido creciendo y ya somos 35 los músicos la que la conformamos quienes ejecutamos diversos tipos de flauta que van desde el flautín hasta la flauta baja en do, permitiendo un amplio registro y otorgando una sonoridad muy especial y característica a la única agrupación que tiene esta conformación en nuestro país.
In the course of these years, the orchestra has been growing and we are already 35 musicians that make it up who play different types of flute ranging from the flute to the flute low in C, allowing a broad record and giving a very special sonority and characteristic to the only group that has this conformation in our country.
 
Como consecuencia natural de la evolución de la OFI y considerando el nivel de ejecución que tiene nuestros músicos, es que nos animamos a postular a la 46a Convención Anual de Flautas y fuimos seleccionados este año entre 500 propuestas del mundo como la agrupación que dará el Concierto de Pre-gala en Orlando, EEUU. a desarrollarse entre el 9 y 12 de agosto del presente año.
As a natural consequence of the evolution of the Orchestra, and considering the level of execution that our musicians have, we are encouraged to apply for the 46th Annual Flute Convention and we were selected this year among 500 proposals from the world as the group that will give the Concert of Pre-gala in Orlando, USA. to be developed between August 9 and 12 of this year.
 
Esta oportunidad es única e inédita para la historia de la flauta chilena, ya que por una parte avala el  interesante trabajo que se ha realizado; muestra una evolución de nuestra agrupación y considera el gran nivel de ejecución que tienen nuestros músicos y las horas de estudio que le hemos dedicado  para lograr un nivel de excelencia en la interpretación de las distintas piezas que ejecutamos. Es también una oportunidad histórica de representar a Chile -y por primera vez- en un formato de orquesta totalmente único y original en el país, interpretando un repertorio de creaciones musicales de la región latinoamericana, atractivo y cautivador: Violeta Parra, Astor Piazzola junto a otros compositores resonarán con sus melodías y ritmos característicos desde los Andes Australes al hemisferio norte.
This opportunity is unique and unprecedented for the history of the Chilean flute, since on the one hand it supports the interesting work ILLAWARA has been done; shows an evolution of our group and considers the high level of execution that our musicians have and the hours of study that we have dedicated to achieve a level of excellence in the interpretation of the different pieces we play. It is also a historic opportunity to represent Chile - and for the first time - in a totally unique and original orchestra format in the country, performing a repertoire of musical creations from the Latin American region, attractive and captivating: Violeta Parra, Astor Piazzola with other composers will resonate with their melodies and characteristic rhythms from the Southern Andes to the northern hemisphere.
 
Este proyecto se presenta en esta plataforma ya que necesitamos contar con los fondos y lograr materializar nuestra presentación en esta convención, lo que nos brindará la posibilidad de continuar en la senda del desarrollo musical y profesional de nuestros jóvenes intérpretes y a la vez nos abrirá las puertas para representar a nuestra Universidad y a nuestro país en escenarios internacionales como es el caso que presentamos hoy.
This project is presented on this platform as we need to have the funds and materialize our presentation at this convention, which will give us the possibility to continue on the path of musical and professional development of our young interpreters and at the same time open the doors to represent our University and our country in international scenarios, as is the case we present today.
 
 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
What we need and what you get La OFI - para 35 músicos que están comprometidos en esta ocasión - necesita la suma aproximada total  de US$65,000.-, la cual cubre los gastos de pasajes aéreos, alojamiento, Alimentación, inscripción en la NFA, traslados de la agrupación de aeropuerto a hotel y v/v, entre otros. 
The IFO - for 35 musicians who are engaged on this occasion - needs the approximate total amount of US $ 65,000.-, which covers the costs of air tickets, accommodation, food, registration in the NFA, transfers from the airport to the hotel. and v / v, among others.
 
Como agrupación agradecemos desde ya toda la ayuda que recibiremos y quisiéramos compartirles que estaremos felices de poder llevarles a sus lugares de trabajo lo que sabemos hacer: tocar nuestra música.
As a group, we are grateful for all the help we will receive and we would like to share with you that we will be happy to be able to take to your work places what we know how to do: play our music. 
Es por ésto, que les ofrecemos de manera exclusiva a los mayores donantes una interesante recompensa...
This is why we offer an interesting reward to the biggest donors exclusively ... 
En caso de no conseguir los fondos necesarios - desde esta plataforma junto a otras gestiones ya comenzadas - devolveremos el dinero íntegramente a todos los que generosamente colaboraron. 
In case of not obtaining the necessary funds - from this platform together with other efforts already begun - we will return the money in full to all those who generously collaborated.

Por otro lado, a los profesores nos permitirá cruzar las fronteras y poder mostrar, compartir e intercambiar repertorio actual, experiencias pedagógicas, entre otras, con flautistas de todo el mundo.
This campaign that seeks monetary help will make it possible on the one hand for students to live a unique experience outside the official curricular scope of their study plans and that will make them experience at this stage of their studies, professional experiences that very few Chilean students can to have. story:
Thank you so much for being part of our cause! We at Eva Under Fire can’t tell you how much we appreciate your amazing support. This indiegogo campaign is built with a purpose! We want to encourage, inspire, and REACH every soul we can with the NEW MUSIC we’ve written for you!

We’ve been busy writing, recording, filming, and touring trying to get to each and every fan we can. This is the next step of our journey and we NEED YOUR HELP! We’re beyond excited for our new material. The new music is almost ready and it deserves the BIGGEST push we can manage. We have successfully completed phase 1 with your enthusiasm. We’ve seen SO MANY OF YOU at our shows, wearing EVA swag and screaming the songs back to us <3 With your continued support, we can successfully complete phase 2: Realize our dream of playing and singing to every single fan, taking our music farther across the USA! There are several states that are currently rocking our music and requesting performances but they’re outside our current reach. With your help in this campaign, we’re aiming to close the gap and FINALLY come meet you all!

Your generosity will help us with the following expenses: Promotion, touring cost, recording cost, replenishment of merchandise, filming cost and MORE!! We, as an independent band, have a lot to put in to make this work <3 There are no outside lenders, funding options, financial backers, or big-time labels behind this project. Simply us five people and our amazing fans. #DIY #indybands #EvaNation

Any amount helps! We encourage you to include your name so we can properly acknowledge your gift! (although you may choose to remain anonymous) For those interested in getting your hands on some exclusive Eva Under Fire offers, we have listed several items for your consideration! See all the fun PERKS we have listed :) It’s us against the world my friends, and you are helping us conquer!

XOXO EVA

story:
Mass-Rhythm: Music Festival
A union of traditions from across the globe 


About Mass-Rhythm & our Vision:

In October, 2016 we will be bringing together leading musicians and artists, whose styles are often not showcased as one, to create a never-before heard Live Music Festival, Mass-Rhythm. Audiences will get to witness cultures colliding through live-improvisation and experience new traditions and musical styles not yet known. This festival will be held in the Greater Boston Area, featuring up-to seven musicians and traditions at a time. 

Driven by the desire to bring preeminent artists from across the world to you, we are asking you to be a part of the dream to connect cultures through the powerful art of music. The hope is to create a dialogue amongst artists that will help to unite and elevate their respective traditions. Simultaneously our desire is to contribute to the cultural fabric of our society by sharing musical traditions rarely seen in the United States.  


About the Festival Director, Amit Kavthekar:
As a professional percussionist with over 25 years of experience, I have connected with leading musicians from South Africa to Chile from Japan to Italy in concert. I seek to unite these world class artists in a thrilling cross-cultural collaboration between Indian classical music and various other musical traditions.  


Our artist collective:
  • Mike Rivard: Bass
  • Boubacar Diabate: Vocalist
  • Amit Kavthekar: Tabla
  • Kunal Gunjal: Santoor
  • Max ZT: Hammered Dulcimer
  • Darlene Dhillon: Kathak dance
  • Fabio Pirozzolo: Percussion
  • Dean Johnston: Drums



About the funds:
All of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly to pay for Artist fees, travel, lodging and other expenses detailed below:

Festival Operating Costs: $9,400 
  • Artist fees
  • Venue rental
  • Artist lodging, travel, and per diem
  • Professional sound engineer
  • Audio equipment rental
  • Advertising and marketing costs
  • Photography and videography
  • Instrument and backline rental
  • International work-permit fees for artists from abroad
  • Ticketing and other miscellaneous production costs 

Thank you!
A big heart felt thank you to our friends, family, fans, and supporters. There is no contribution too small. We sincerely appreciate your support to make this dream a reality. Please spread the word and thank you for supporting the arts. Let's do this!

story:
Short Summary:

Hi!  My name is Bernadette Hunter. I’ve been a practicing psychotherapist for 29 years… and a singer since I can remember! In helping people heal from emotional and psychological wounds, I’ve learned just how powerful music can be in this process. Music is the perfect vessel for emotion. And to my surprise, music is rarely used in therapy to help those in need.   I have recorded 11 songs to help people connect with their feelings;  feelings that provide essential cues as to what we  need, to point toward our next step.  My sincere hope is that this music touches your heart.  Click here to listen to a sample!


The Impact:

My album, titled “Take My Breath Away," is intended to honor the spectrum of our emotions. Whether it’s the joy of holding a newborn for the first time, the grief of losing a true love, the awe of an indescribable sunrise, or the confusion and angst that life brings, music allows us to embrace and hold these emotions close to our hearts. 

I have long wanted to create this particular vocal collection to sooth and comfort, and to help us celebrate our joy, courage, and resilience.


The Songs:      

You Take My Breath Away

Bridge Over Troubled Water

Gone Too Soon

Over The Rainbow

Fields of Gold

How Can I Keep From Singing

Song of Bernadette

Why Walk When You Can Fly

This Little Light of Mine

True Colors

Arms of the Angel           


Early Comments:     

~  Bernadette, you have the voice of an angel.  I literally got chills.

~  Your song was heavenly.  Brought gentle tears of comfort and gave me such peace.    

~  I played a couple of your songs to my 18-month old son.  He began smiling and then went to sleep!

~  Beautiful.  I can’t wait to hear more!


What We Need & What You Get:

Here is an idea of where the money goes. 

TOTAL BUDGET:  $18,550

Recording, Mixing, Mastering: $13,500

Copyright Fees: $550

Artwork, Graphics, Photography: $2000

Duplication of CD: $1,000

Professional Services: $1,500

Promotion, Marketing, PR: Everything we raise over the budget goes towards this! 

If we do not reach our goal, all funds raised will go toward the completion of this project. 

To help raise these funds, I've put together some fun incentives for you, my friends and community -  from Skype calls to digital singing telegrams, and bonus tracks!


Other Ways You Can Help:

On a personal level, this has been a deeply moving experience for me and a labor of love. My biggest desire is that this music can heal and bring enjoyment to you, your loved ones, and friends and strangers we’ve yet to meet. I would love for you to help me reach this goal.  I'm grateful and excited that with your help this music will blossom! May it speak to your heart and “Take Your Breath Away” in the most personal and meaningful of ways!

-Please help me spread the word by sharing the video and the link to this page 

-Through emails to your friends.

-Post them on FB, Twitter, Instagram, Google+ and google group, and other social media.

-Use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out.


Thank you so much for taking the time to support this project!  You’ve made a statement to the world about something that is important to you, and your voice will be heard.  Much love to you!   Bernadette

story:
We Eat Rhythm - the story of The Prodigy Part 1

A few questions answered:

Q. Who is Martin James? (for those who don't know)

I've known the band for over 20 years and have been the band’s official campaign biographer for the last five albums, including acclaimed studio sets Always Outnumbered Never Outgunned, Invaders Must Die and The Day is My Enemy. I also provided the album essay for the compilation Their Law. 

We Eat Rhythm takes my previous book length biography of the band as a starting point and explores with greater depth information that has come to light in the intervening years. It will include previously unpublished interviews with Liam Howlett as well as numerous people involved with the band.

Finally published as I’d always intended We Eat Rhythm  is totally unofficial but written with full cooperation of the band and their management. It.will be the definitive version of my biography of The Prodigy.

Q. You’ve been talking about a new book for years now. What happened?

It took me some while to regain the rights to the book from the previous publishers. When they sold their catalogue to a new company this rights reversion wasn’t made clear and the new publishers thought they owned the rights to the book. After this was sorted I signed a new book deal but the publishers stitched me up and it took a while to get released from that contract. Which is why I’m self publishing this now. Independent and underground – like The Prodigy

More recently I suspended work on the books at the request of the band’s management. They were deeply involved in the campaign and tours for The Day is My Enemy and this book could have posed a distraction. I have always enjoyed a close working relationship with everyone involved with the band and count many as my friends, so I happily complied with their wishes.

Q. Why publish a third version of the book?

The previous editions of the biography were published according to the outlines presented by publishing companies. As a result I was forced to compromise in key areas. This version will be as I’d wanted it to be with far more contributions from The Prodigy family, wider industry and fans.

Q. You’ve divided the story into two books. Are you just trying to double your money and take advantage of the fans?

First of all I should make it clear that I have yet to make a single penny of profit from either of the previous books. Once the shops had negotiated cheaper rates and publishers had taken their cuts neither Adventures with the Voodoo Crew nor The Prodigy recouped their costs, which meant no royalties for the author (me!).  I did receive small advances but in each case these covered less than a month’s income – so they were largely written out of love and respect for the band!

I decided to divide the story into two books because I felt the full story couldn’t be told otherwise. It would have become a hugely edited version of events and go nowhere near to doing the band justice.Both books together as full versions would number 220,000 words which would be extremely expensive as one book. So this way works better for those of us who like detail.

Finally, it was agreed with the band's management that the story would be published in two parts in order to work with their own future plans. 

Q. Why should we buy this book when it’s not official?

As ever I’ve worked closely with band and management to fit with their campaigns and to present something they will also be proud of. It’s my perception of events and will act as the perfect accompaniment to any autobiographies the band, or its individual members might produce in the future. 

Q. Will there be a regular paperback or digital edition?

Yes. After the second instalment of the biography (We Live for Beats Prestige Edition) of the biography there will be a version with both books compiled and edited. This will be called We Eat Rhythm We Live for Beats . This version will be the one that is sold into shops and will not include as many photos, illustrations etc.

Digital versions will be available through the Kindle store. We Eat Rhythm will be available early 2017.

What We Need & What You Get

The prestige edition We Eat Rhythm will come as a never-to-be-repeated, individually numbered, limited edition hardback run of only 1,000. It will not be published again in this format.

The minimum requirement of £5,000 will guarantee all initial backers copies of the book and will enable me to finish work on it by covering expenses etc. This is a minimum target which means pledges will continue to be accepted until the edition run of 1,000 is reached. After this no more pledges will be accepted.

Everyone who pledges will receive the book and an automatic 10% discount off We Live for Beats – The story of The Prodigy Part 2 (to be published in 2018 - according to the band's wishes).

Book costs will include payment for expenses, images, design, printing and distribution. 

A percentage of any profits will go to a charity of the band’s choice.

Risks & Challenges

This will be the tenth book I've published so I am well used to dealing with every stage of book production. However the main risks would be with publication deadlines which could be effected by production processes. In addition such unforeseen occurrences as paper shortage or distribution issues (postal strikes etc) may have a negative impact. In this case the book will be delivered as soon as possible after the initial due date.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want tis project to happen (whether you can afford to pledge or not) it's important that this campaign gets out there. So you could help by sharing on social media and helping to create a buzz.

I really need your support with this - so anything you can do to help would be great.

story:
Raymond & Kim... Who are they and what are they doing?

We are Raymond & Kim, founders of Real Love Music! Our motto is 'Bringing FUN back to LOVE through music and entertainment.' 

We began our journey with friendship, in 2005 with music and then 2006 with MARRIAGE! For over 10 years (yes...that long), we have been learning and continuing to develop our craft of performing as a duo group for many different audiences. In our genre of 'Christian Love', we perform original and non-original love songs. We have released 2 singles and 1 full album so far and can't wait to do more!

Our MEDIA Campaign will be a way for you to help us cover costs for music video production, studio recording, CD manufacturing, marketing and Real Love Music concerts/events.

In observation of what's happening in the world today, it is apparent that genuine love needs to be reignited among us all... So, if LOVE in relationships is important to you as it is to us, your donation will give us the momentum to display how VITAL it is and how FUN it should be! 


It's a WIN/WIN situation!

Our goal is to raise $5,000 to help cover costs such as:

  • Music Video Production - Professional Director/Videographer, lighting, actors/actresses, location (including travel/lodging expenses).
  • Studio Recording - Producing, engineering, mixing-mastering, studio musician(s) if applicable.
  • CD/Digital Manufacturing - Disc Makers, download cards, CD/DVD design, replication, packaging, shipping.
  • Marketing - Media Outlets (i.e. radio, TV, social media, magazines, newspapers, etc.), marketing materials (i.e. posters, flyers, banners, etc.), purchase items (i.e. t-shirts, hats, keychains, etc.)
  • Concerts- Other Events - *Real Love Music* Venue rentals, sound engineer/equipment, band, ticket printing, décor, catering (if applicable).

SO... WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

We have some FANTASTIC PERKS as our way of saying thanks for contributing to our MEDIA Campaign! Everything from autographed 'Thank You' posters, Exclusive Campaign T-Shirts, our 'Love Defined' CD, Dinner for 2 and a private LIVE Concert are being offered as some of the rewards for you being a part of our vision!

Should we not reach our goal, the funds collected will be used to satisfy as much of the costs for each area needed as possible.


The Impact and The BIG Picture!

FLASHBACK MOMENT:

In 2012, we launched an Indie GoGo Campaign and it was because of some great folks that we were able to raise enough funds to plan and execute our first CD Release Party successfully that same year!

FLASH FORWARD:

Since 2012, our audience has vastly grown! We believe your contribution will help to expand our Real Love Music brand and provide a consistent connection with potential supporters/followers, various business networks and most importantly all others we can encourage and be a blessing to through our music and message.

Our Goals

In 2016, our goal is to accomplish 2 music videos, 3+ music singles, 1 NEW full album, 3 concerts (Real Love Music) and 2 photo shoots!

We are confident that your donation can help us achieve all these things!

No One Left Behind...

We all are at different points in life and we understand not everyone can contribute financially to our MEDIA Campaign.

If that's you, don't worry... YOU CAN STILL SUPPORT!

HOW?... Help SPREAD THE WORD about us and what we are trying to do this year!

KEEP IN MIND: If you are planning to post our Campaign on social media, make sure you use the 'share' tools on our Campaign site... WE NEED YOU!

--------

We sincerely thank you for your time and attention. We are excited of what the future holds for Real Love Music because of YOU!

Grace, Love & Peace.

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! We are a Christian Rock band called We Were Once from Fayetteville, NC that consists of Courtney Sapp, Cliff Gore, and siblings Erin and Zach Burkhart . We have been together for two years now and each of us play in the worship team at our home church, Bethany Church of God. In just the short amount of time we have been together we have opened for acts such as Newsboys, Family Force 5, RED, Emery, Norma Jean, Disciple, and Decyfer Down, just to name a few. We have an EP and music video under our belt and now we are ready to go out and reach others with our music and message through touring- BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP!! 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need at least $5k to make this possible as we are NOT getting paid for shows on this tour. Your generous donations go towards equipment needed for the tour such as a trailer, sound equipment, gas, food, etc. Any amount we do not use on tour will go towards our new album to release THIS FALL! We have some cool perks available with your donation from recording a cover for you personally to doing a house show...so GO CHECK IT OUT!! :)

The Impact

We will be able to reach hundreds of people on the road, establish more connections and you will be able to be a part of our team and ministry by helping fund it and starting a change in the lives of our generation. 

Risks & Challenges

If we said there were no risks involved with this then we would be lying. A few of us are walking away from jobs either permanently or temporarily to go out on the road and do what we have always dreamed to do and share what God has laid on our hearts. This will be our first tour and we are beyond excited! Could there be bumps in the road- figuratively and literally- yes, but we have faith that with the help from people like you and God on our side...we can do this together. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE! We can't say that enough. 

Thank you guys so much for taking your time to read this. And thank you in advance for your love & support.

-Courtney, Cliff, Erin & Zach

story:
Why, hello! Thank you for stopping in to check out my Indiegogo campaign to support the production, duplication and national promotion of my brand new, fourth CD for kids and families, "Wonderful YOU!" 

My name is Vanessa Trien and I have been dedicating my career to writing, performing and teaching music since the nineties, first in New York City and then in Boston.  Coinciding with the birth of my first child, I finally took a leap in 2005 to record and release my first album of family music, entitled "Hot Air Balloon," which included songs I had written over years of music teaching and writing songs with my students. I began presenting family shows with fellow musicians I had met from years of performing acoustic folk.  Audiences quickly grew, crowding in, filling rooms, toy stores and then theaters and outdoor venues to capacity.  Since then I released two more CDs - "Carnival Day" (coinciding with the birth of my second child while also moving into a new house during a Boston blizzard!) and "Bubble Ride" (no births this time!) - winning Parents' Choice Awards for all three, and developing a strong and loyal fan base in the greater Boston area and throughout the Northeast where we perform.

Since 2005, I have balanced being a mom to two wonderful kids along with teaching many weekly parent/child and pre-school music classes and keeping an active performing schedule with my awesome band of musicians, The Jumping Monkeys (Adam Rothberg, Fabio Pirozzolo, Paul Kochanski, Richard Gates).  Because of this rather wacky and sometimes crazy-making life balance, it takes me a while to sit down, write songs and turn them into an album, but with the incredible help of my dear friend and fellow Jumping Monkey, Adam Michael Rothberg, we are finally doing just that!  And, quite honestly, I'm really proud of what it has turned into!

This album, which I am calling "Wonderful YOU," includes 10 original acoustic folk and folk-pop-world songs aimed for young audiences, plus two covers I love (All Together Now by The Beatles, and Willie and the Hand Jive by Johnny Otis), all tied together by an overarching theme of celebrating YOU, along with your community of friends, family and neighbors coming together to play, work, live, and of course, sing and dance. I am joined on the songs by my awesome Jumping Monkeys band members. And to further the theme of celebrating community, I invited some of my favorite musician friends from my own folk and kindie music communities to join us for this album: Alastair Moock, Rani Arbo, Barbara Brousal, Mister G and other fantastic music friends.

Making an album as a celebration of YOU, the listener, and of our relationships with family, friends and community has been on my mind for a long while. Along with my own two kids, I fall in love with every student I teach and every young audience member with whom I speak. They always have fantastic ideas to share, and it’s inspiring to see their personalities already so strong and vibrant. I wanted to make an album honoring each and every one of those kids I’ve been fortunate enough to meet, along with all the kids and families listening to the album.

But making an album is EXPENSIVE.  In relation to what I bring in with my teaching and performing income, it is REALLY EXPENSIVE.  REALLY REALLY EXPENSIVE. My passion is to record and perform music for kids and families so I dived in head-first to make this fourth album and am thrilled I have, but I am definitely feeling the burden of the costs, including the recording, mixing and mastering fees, paying musicians, the graphic design, photography, and duplicating of the CD, hefty award application fees, and a three-month national promotion campaign by one of the best publicists for children's music in the country.  I intended to run a crowdunding campaign for my last CD, "Bubble Ride," but at the last minute I chickened out. Perhaps fear of failure. Or fear of success. Or not wanting to burden my friends, family and fans with a request such as this.  I was nearly ready to chicken out this time around too, but with the encouragement of my community, I'm going forward, confident in the incentives I can offer, confident in the product "Wonderful YOU" is becoming, and confident in YOU - my friends, family, fans, and the broader community of people who support quality independent music for families.  Your financial support in this campaign before the October 14 national release of "Wonderful YOU" will be TREMENDOUS for me, helping me cover all the biggest costs now rolling in, including the very beginning of the three-month national publicity campaign.  Whether you are able to contribute a small or large amount, or would like to contribute in other ways such as spreading the word about this campaign to friends, it all will make a giant difference for me. THANK YOU, WONDERFUL YOU!  I hope you'll read on  for more details on how your generous contributions would be used, and what incentives might entice you to contribute! 

What We Need & What You Get

Ok, $18,000 sounds like a lot of smackeroos and does it really cost that much to put out this album?  The answers is, yes, it's a lot of smackeroos and yes, it costs that much!  I'll break it down a bit here:

Approximately $6,500 for recording, mixing and mastering fees, and payments to musician performing on the album

Over $3,000 to duplicate and ship CDs (ie. make the actual CDs you get in your hands)

Over $1,600 for designing the CD artwork, stickers and other design work related to the CD and promotion.

$1,000 for professional photography

About $7,000 for the national promotional campaign by one of the best publicists for kindie music in the country

Approximately $750 in national award application fees for the CD

So that's almost $20,000 right there, which doesn't include the upcoming expected costs of mailing CDs; long overdue website, banner, baseball cap and T-shirt design, plus the making of video content, all to support the album and the furthering of my musical endeavors and dreams.  Yikes.  I'll certainly work hard to do my part to cover all I can and need to, but having your generous support will be crucial in my efforts to put these songs out in the world, make this album as successful as it can be, and set the stage for me to be able to record again in the very near future rather than working for years to pay off my debts from this project. If I don't reach my entire Indiegogo goal, I will be deeply grateful to use what I do bring in to pay off the costs of recording, mixing, mastering and duplicating the CD while I cover the additional costs.

And guess what, I've got some great PERKS for you!

There's a whole pile of fun incentives to fit any budget, including autographed CDs, "Wonderful YOU" baseball caps, personalized videos of songs you request, thanks on our website and social media, as well as special concerts or private parties for you and your community. I hope you'll check out our list of perks and see what fits best for you!

The Impact

So, what drives me to write songs for kids, then record and perform them?  It's the glove that fits me best in this world. I LOVE what I do. I love teaching early childhood music in the classroom, I love getting on stage with my band and presenting interactive shows that kids and families can actively participate in together. I love writing songs that I think connects with the imaginations, emotions and energy of young listeners. And I'm lucky to be joined by dear musician friends in the Jumping Monkeys as well as special musical guests who lift the songs up to a level of musicianship in our recordings and shows that parents seem to appreciate and really get jazzed about.  

And why should you support this album while so many people seem to be putting out albums for kids these days?  Because I can confidently say that I believe this is a GREAT album with heart and integrity that you and your family will really enjoy. It's a celebration of YOU and your community. It is my personal, particular folk/pop/world take on the world of kindie music.  As this is my FOURTH album for kids and families, I have a successful track record for putting out albums that parents and kids have loved for many years.  I have also won three Parents' Choice Awards for the last three albums, so far so good!  And I feel that of all my CDs, this latest recording is the one that best reflects my current songwriting style and how we sound live as a band. And with such fantastic special musical guests, it really sounds like a musical community of family and friends having fun making music in your living room.

Risks & Challenges

This being my very first crowd funding campaign, I'm aware that I may not reach my goal of $18,000.  I will pray to the crowd funding spirits that I do, but if I don't, every dollar you donate will still be fundamental to helping me get through this project without breaking the bank and allowing me to bring this CD project to fruition and presenting it on a national stage.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel that you just can't contribute right now but you want to help in some way, I'd love to ask you to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign and the upcoming "Wonderful YOU" CD!  There are easy Indiegogo share tools you can click on to forward the campaign to friends. THANK YOU from the very bottom of my heart for all of your support!  Any way you can help is greatly appreciated!

YOU are WONDERFUL!

Many many thanks,

Vanessa
