About CRIMSON HIGHWAY and what we are doing.
 
OUR STORY
CRIMSON HIGHWAY is Chris Kelley (vocals), Bill Sargent (guitar), Mike Mancini (drums) & Tim Walsh (bass). This is THE band that all four of us have always wanted to be in, but were never able to work it out. In 2016 Mike, Bill & Tim started getting together to write some songs and it was magical. Never had any of us experienced playing in a band that everyone liked and heard the music that we were writing the same way. After we had written a handful of songs, it was obvious that we needed a singer/lyricist. As we sat down and wrote a long list of qualifications that we were looking for, it seemed like a nearly impossible task to find the perfect guy, but then Tim thought about his lifelong friend and he knew immediately that Chris filled every one of the items on our list, but there was one problem. Chris had decided a few years before to stop performing and just focus on writing songs and he was happy doing so.
Tim decided to give Chris a call anyway and convinced him to come out and check the songs out and although Chris was 100% sure that he had no interest and would not be joining us, he came out anyway as a favor to Tim. When he arrived, he was blown away by both the song writing and the chemistry. Once again, the magic was in the room and at an even higher level. It immediately felt like putting on your favorite pair of worn out jeans. It felt like family and home and we knew we had to share this music that we are so proud of with you and when we performed it live you gave us an overwhelmingly positive response. That brings us here, to 2017, we are CRIMSON HIGHWAY.
As is the case with all things in life: if something is worth doing, it's worth doing right! So, we spent a lot of time determining the best way to make our album. We knew that it was important to keep the magic and chemistry going in every element of this band so we knew that we had to have Ashley Peacock produce the album at Soul Foundry Studios, in Flint Michigan.
WHY FLINT, MI IS IMPORTANT TO US
It is extremely important to us to record in downtown Flint, as it is the city that we all call home. You see, Flint has a unique and beautiful heritage and even though it would seem to outsiders that only see the headlines that Flint is a tragic place to be due to everything from the closing of factories and the loss of jobs to the more recent Flint Water Crisis.
We know that Flint is also a beautiful place, with a heritage that spans many amazing historic accomplishments like being the birthplace of General Motors, the display of unity in the SIT-DOWN STRIKE, producing tanks for our armed forces during WWII. We also have the musical heritage of being the birthplace of one of the biggest Rock n Roll bands of their era, GRAND FUNK RAILROAD.
Decades later, the media paints a bleak picture of Flint, but what we have is the most resilient city in America. We are overcoming factory closures and job loss. Despite the current water crisis, Flint is still fighting as it is home to one of America's elite engineering schools, Kettering University. It is also home to a large University of Michigan campus along with Michigan State University, Baker College and Mott Community College. Flint is a city where art is starting to take a foothold and the city is once again beginning to embrace its artists.
So as Flint fights the odds and is discovering what it takes to have its revival, CRIMSON HIGHWAY is proud of our home and is committed to standing and fighting with our city.
 
DETAILS OF CRIMSON HIGHWAY'S PLANS (People & things that need to get paid)THE STUDIO & RECORDING   • Studio - The Soul Foundry
   • Producer - Ashley Peacock
   • Mastering - Grammy Award winner Richard Dodd
   • Studio Assistant & Engineering - Torri LawrencePACKAGING   • Artwork - Alicia Music
   • Pressing CD's - WBD
   • Deluxe USB & Packaging – Factory Two
   • Release to all digital download & streaming services
Marketing & Promotion   • Press Release
   • International Press Release
   • Advertising in industry publications
PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE help us make some noise with our campaign. We are now dependent on you, that you enjoy our music enough to help us share it with the world. YOUR WORLD. Just like when you ask your friend if they have heard your latest favorite song and if not, you can’t wait to share it with them, please do that with CRIMSON HIGHWAY.

story:
Summary

My name is Chad Galactic. Some of you may recognize me from my work behind the scenes in the music world.  I spend most of my time helping some really great west coast bands and nationally touring acts.  When I am not doing that I spend my time writing and recently published a book of my poetry. A  few years ago I came up with a category of music called FoodRaps.  I have been writing songs about food and realized that I had a bunch of them that go together beautifully.  I want to put these on an album called Truffle Hunter.

By contributing to this campaign, not only will you receive Truffle Hunter  (on digital, compact disc, or vinyl) along with other potential goodies, but you are directly helping with the funding of the recording, production and marketing of the  record!

Note: Artwork displayed is not actual artwork.

The Lowdown

I'm looking to raise $20,000 to help fund the recording sessions, musician and engineering payments, cd and record manufacturing, and videos.

For $10 you can get a download of the new record before it is officially released plus all exclusives & updates through this Indiegogo page. If you can support more than that, there are many exciting offerings as thanks to repay you for your faith and support in the album.  

Even if you can’t afford to pledge monetarily, your help is still very much needed and appreciated. Please talk about and share the link to this page everywhere you can. Post it to your Twitter, Facebook or share it in an email blast. This will only work if we can get the word out organically and through trusted sources. 

Laughter is so important especially in the world that we are all living in.  The day we can no longer laugh is the day we have lost.

story:
NB NEDERLANDERS - SCROLL NAAR "WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET" VOOR BETALING MET OVERSCHRIJVING OF PAYPALL

Since i was young i was already making music and singing. So music has always played a major part in my life. But i couldn’t imagined i would become a solo singer later in life. Before my solocareer i was musical leader and bandleader in our church; and pianist and flute player and vocalist on multiple events. I sang in bands,  and worked as backing vocalist. I did multiple projects for studio’s and artists and later i  also followed the education of master teacher in Estill voice training to complete my vocal education and be able to teach others to help them develop their voice and singing and express their emotion in music. Cause music is emotion, and it’s like a first language for me where i can express myself, be myself, get to rest or get exited when i need that. It refreshes my soul, and inspires me. Music helped me get through my toughest moments.

Most of you know that i’ve been very ill multiple times, and had many big stomach operations. We’ve had experienced at least 4 times that it wasn’t sure if i would make it. But last year i can say, was the hardest time of our lifes.

In November 2016, between two surgereys my body gave up and doctors didn’t know what to do. They did an emergency surgery it wasn’t sure if i would survive. Realizing the situation i was in, i was talking to God all the time and i He was by my side. I was really calm just talking to Him. Then suddenly I heard His voice and Lord asked me in person: “Kirsten, where do you wanna sing? In heaven before My throne, or still on earth before My throne?” The only reason i’m still on earth is that i chose last. I couldn’t leave my husband and children yet, and i told the Lord that i knew i could reach many more people with my music and by sharing my story. I recovered, but got another hard time with my illness this summer and again i found myself fighting for my life. But also this time, the Lord was near. In those hardest moments of my life, He brought comfort and inspiration to write the most personal songs of my life.  We knew at that time that we had to make a second album and tell the world my story by writing an autobiography. Cause my story isn’t about the hardships, but it is a personal story about Gods faithfullnes and hope which He’ll use to touch people’s hearts.

This is why i am so passionate and driven to make this album. To comfort and strenghten people including you as my listener, using my music, and by telling my story and testimony. Cause God wants to weave gold in everyone’s story. No matter how hopeless the situation may seem.

THE RECORDING

The recording will be a 13 songs album, with a great mix of country and southern gospel. The songs are about comfort in hard times, hope, the love of God and how He is there for you. He wants you to not only overcome your situation, but arise high above! These are songs written by the experiences and learnings we had in our hardest times.

I am not making this album alone. Gordon Mote will be producing, playing and do vocals on the album. And next to him we’ll have a great team lined up with Nashville’s finest and respected musicians. so we garantee you that you'll don't be dissappointed when you get the album! Gordon is a well respected musician and producer and has produced albums for many great artist/groups like the Gaither Vocal band, Voices of Lee, the Martins, and many more. He has played for music’s biggest names, including Brad Paisley, Blake Shelton, Martina McBride, Bob Seger, Alan Jackson, Rascal Flatts, Carrie Underwood, Lionel Richie, Josh Turner, Darius Rucker, and Alison Krauss—to name a few. His unmatched studio prowess has earned him two Academy of Country Music Awards for top piano/keyboard player as well as two Music Row Magazine Instrumentalist of the Year Awards (2009, 2011) for playing on the most top ten albums. Gordon is honored and humbled by the artists and producers who place their trust in him, but He stays always humble and says “I always try to bring my creativity and do the very best I can.”

Finally, I hope that you, as a listener, will find Hope, love & strenght and be encouraged to go fight the fight and make your own golden life story.

Many of you have asked for this recording, and it is finally about to become a reality! But I can only do it with your help & support...

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Making a full album as an independent artist is a very expencive project. We can not do it without your help. The cost for this project will be a minimum of around €35000.

This includes :

€ 3000 Producer

€ 3000 vocals recording

€ 3000 sound studio and technicians

€ 12000 musicians (piano, ac. Guitar, el. Guitar, bass, drums, organ, peddle steel, steel guitar, mandolin, banjo, violins, backing vocals)

€ 2500 mixing everything

€ 1000,00 for mastering the album - final touches

€ 2000,00 for the printing of the CD’s, artwork, Mechanical Rights

€ 5000,00 travel expences for 2 persons (flights amsterdam nashville, accomodation)

€ 3000,00 Indiegogo/payment fees/21% VAT on CD sales

€ 500,00 Additional perks/promo video

Have a look at the perks!

I would love to perform my music live - just by myself or in combination with other musicians and artists. Of course I will pay the artists playing with me. So the perk includes their fee and won't go directly towards the project.

I also would love to meet and talk to you… there are a few options to meet us and talk about whatever you wanna talk about.

And if you have always wanted to ask me questions about my singing, songwriting or whatever else you can think of - this is your chance! Book a private Skype session and I will try to answer your questions as well as I can.

If you would like to contribute an additional amount without a perk, just press on “BACK IT” and you will be able to donate any amount. If you'd like to help but don't have the finances to donate, you can still help by sharing this project and tell as many people about this. Thank you so much for your support!

As you partner with me for this project, I will give you regular updates, behind-the-screen videos of the recordings and special insights into the process. I really want everyone to feel that they are part of the project, not just giving money!

NB for Dutch people only: Voor MENSEN UIT NEDERLAND die geen creditcard hebben maar via een overschrijving of via paypall willen betalen: dat kan! Stuur een email naar info@kristymusics.com met je email adres en de gewenste perk, dan stuur ik de verdere gegevens. Bedankt!

WHAT IF I SURPASS THE GOAL?

If there comes in extra money that we don’t need for the album and proces, we will use this for another future new album or donate this to Mercy Ships, the organisation i am ambassador of. You can find more information about Mercy Ships on www.mercyships.org

IF I DON'T MAKE IT?

I am determined to make this album become a reality. If I don't make the financial goal, we will look where we can cut te costs to still realize the album. And if the finances are way to less to make an album, we’ll ask the Lord which way He wants us to go then, and refund all donations.

IN THE MEANTIME...

I hope you will enjoy the two songs we already recorded and will be on the album. It's enough and Do it afraid.  You can find these songs in the gallery tab.

It’s enough is been written, cause in the past i had a struggle seeing myself in the mirror and the devil gladly wants us to believe that we are not good enough, not beautiful enough and aren’t loved. But we need to learn to see how Jesus looks at us. His reflection tells us otherwise.

Do it afraid is a song about how God sometimes calls us, but we are so scared or afraid that we don’t listen to His call. But sometimes we just have to step out and do it afraid and just trust Him.

story:
Why I Need Your Help

I've been playing guitar professionally for over 10 years. The past few years I've refocussed on my original passion: songwriting and original music. I've written over 60 songs in the past 3 years and feel that 12 of those belong on an album that I can be proud to share with you.

There are many studios in Minneapolis but I've had the pleasure of working with Chris Mara of Welcome to 1979 Studios in Nashville, TN a couple of times and feel that his tastefulness, expertise, and studio are best suited for the sound I'm hoping to get on this album. After 3 years of preparation I want to make the best damn album I can. This is not the cheapest option but I truly believe it's the best.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Total Budget = $7061
    • Recording -  $3000
    • Mixing - $3000
    • Duplication - $1100
    • Digital Distribution - $80
    • Band Travel Expenses - $440
    • Indie GoGo Fees - $921
  • There are a slew of options available, from pre-ordering the album, t-shirts, private house shows, hell...I'll even paint your fence, but most importantly you'll be helping me achieve a dream that I just can't do without financial backing.
  • I will absolutely record this album no matter how much money is raised. If we don't reach the entire goal there are studios in the immediate area that are more economical, or I'll even record it myself if I have to. It would take me a lifetime to save the money needed to have a true studio setup and the skill of a great sound engineer is invaluable.

The Impact

The studio and engineer are as much, or even more, a part of the final sound than the musicians themselves. I'm asking for financial support to work with someone that I feel shares a vision with what I think music should sound like: simple, direct, & warm. 

I am fully a independent musician. I do all the booking, tour routing, songwriting, promo, rehearse the band, etc. There are many opportunities that I am immediately looked past because I don't have an album available to the public. I will continue to play open mics, songwriter nights, and every show that I can but hoping for the right person to walk in the door and offer me a record deal is a beautiful Hollywood story but generally not real. I plan to keep going regardless and this is the next step. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even a few dollars multiplied by many people helps a ton but if you aren't able to give I completely understand - if you've read this far you're pretty amazing in my eyes. Please consider sharing this campaign on social media, sharing links to my website/music, or just talking about this campaign to people - you know...like in real life. Weird, I know. ;) There's a ton of statistics about when a campaign is funded and the following success. It helps a ton to give early. 

 

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! There are a ton of places you could be putting money and effort toward. I am humbled and deeply thankful you would even consider helping me make this happen.

story:
Who we are

  • Hailing from several rural suburbs outside of Rochester, NY. Wyatt Coin consists of Jordan Schilling (vocals), Lael Dylag (drums), Dewey Richbar (guitar), Daryl Redding (bass), and Taylor Lamitina (Mandolin/Banjo). Since our debut in November 2014, we have toured many stages across Western NY including a stop this year on Warped Tour. We have received local recognition for our unique sound which has been categorized as "Cow Punk" and compared to the likes of Gaslight Anthem, Flogging Molly, and Mischief Brew.

    Career highlights include our debut self titled EP, on air appearances on Alt Buffalo 107.7 and Under the Skin podcast, as well as rave reviews in the Rochester City Newspaper by Frank de Blase and Rochester Insomniac by Ricky Rotton. We're also proud to have our single "Guff Speaking Work Slackers" appear in the indie horror film Back Road (2018) as well as "Lights Out! Kill the Noise!" featured on a new VR video game called "Astro Karts" that released in 2017. 

 

We Need Your Help

  • We need $5,000 to cover the costs of recording, mixing, producing, and mastering our first full length album.
  • We have several perks for backing this project including:
    • Singing on our album
    • A private performance for you and all your friends
    • The ability to own the banner we have displayed at all of our shows
    • The ability to own Lael's kick drum cover that he has used at all of our shows
    • Exclusive goodies such as posters and buttons created only for this campaign

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't donate, please spread the word.

We want to thank you in advance for supporting us and for sharing our campaign with your friends and loved ones.  Fans like you are one of the biggest reasons we love making music.

Thank you for appreciating the passion and hard work of independent musicians!

Dewey, Jordan, Lael, Taylor, and Daryl
Wyatt Coin

We need $5,000 to cover the costs of recording, mixing, producing, and mastering our first full length album.
We have several perks for backing this project including:
Singing on our album
A private performance for you and all your friends
The ability to own the banner we have displayed at all of our shows
The ability to own Lael's kick drum cover that he has used at all of our shows
Exclusive goodies such as posters and buttons created only for this campaign



Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't donate, please spread the word.
We want to thank you in advance for supporting us and for sharing our campaign with your friends and loved ones.  Fans like you are one of the biggest reasons we love making music.
Thank you for appreciating the passion and hard work of independent musicians!
Dewey, Jordan, Lael, Taylor, and DarylWyatt Coin

story:
Who We Are and What We Hope

Moons In Bloom are Kellen Hunt and Eric Brostrom. We are a band from Arizona that draws from a plethora of influences. Past and Present. Progressive and Classic. Digital and Analog. This album represents our ultimate passion project. Our lives have been shaped by the strength of music, and the inherent power it yields helped us express years of experiences and an emotional journey that brought us to this point today. We hope to ultimately reflect those experiences back into the musical community. In doing so, we will be able to continue sharing music that is personal and meaningful, as well as allowing the independent music community to thrive. With your contributions, we will be able to:

  • Secure the physical and digital release of our debut album.
  • Offer basic merchandise options for listeners.
  • Provide a foundation for future work.

 

Ways You Can Help

Financial support is functional, but true support is personal and essential. Here are some ways you can help us out:

  • Spread the word! Whether it's social media or actual social gatherings, keeping us in mind and part of the conversation gives us the chance to reach new people every day!
  • Check our website at www.moonsinbloom.com or like our Facebook page for updates from the band!
  • After the release, look for our album on multiple platforms and experience our music at a personal level. Share your story with us on Facebook, or contact us at moonsinbloom@gmail.com.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Whats It All About

I am a soul singer, born and raised in South Africa, educated in the world!

I'm currently recording my debut EP with a genius producer from London, Mr. Russell Nash. I have written songs and featured for many other artists but have yet to release my own material. It's taken me a long time to get to this point..a rollercoaster adventure of finding my sound, finding myself and the right producer.

I now have the opportunity and the magic man!

All we need is a little bit of help from you to complete the project!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funds for studio time and musicians to complete the recording process
  • You get to be my record label !! Essentially advancing me the money to finish the album.
  • Pick a perk level and get involved with the process - we'll have live studio updates, behind the scenes, q&a 's and of course, a digital download of the EP once its completed!

The Aim

  • The world's gone mad, its true, and we're all feeling a little lost. More than ever, I feel the need to authentically connect with people...to help myself and to help others to feel less alone, to feel better and like we're all in this together. The best way for me to do this has always been through MUSIC! 

 The Team

  • Candy has had a professional singing career for over a decade. She's travelled the world singing in bands, duos and most recently, theatre productions on the high seas. Candy has songwriting credits on 3 radio singles and numerous features for various artists. 
  • Russell Nash is an artist, songwriter, multi- instrumentalist and producer from London. Find  out more about him here:  http://www.nashmusic.biz/russell-nash/
  • Check out their duo Candy Stone and Nash here :  https://www.facebook.com/candystoneandnash/

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't contribute financially..

Please like or share my campaign or just send good vibes..any of your support is so appreciated!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! We're Rand and Erin Bellavia, a husband and wife who recently started writing and performing songs together. You may know Rand as one of the singer/songwriter/guitarers of the Pegasus and Logan Award winning filk/nerd rock band Ookla the Mok. If you're unfamiliar with filk, it's commonly defined as the music of the science fiction and fantasy community. (Wikipedia can tell you more, if you're interested!) If you are familiar with filk you may have seen us perform together at FilKONtario, GAFilk, Marcon, Windycon or Balticon, or heard our Pegasus-award nominated song "Cliffs of Insanity" at OVFF in 2016.

At any rate, we're releasing our first album, and we hope you're willing to help us deliver the nerd rock album of 2018!   To encourage you, we've assembled perks designed to appeal to curious musicians, fans, and nerds of all stripes, including:

  • Non-Album tracks -- otherwise unavailable "b-sides," or completed songs that will not appear on the CD or MP3 versions of the album
  • An otherwise unavailable Seanan McGuire short story, featuring Erin and Rand as characters
  • Access to the demos, tempo maps, and alternative versions used to create the album
  • Custom made calligraphy bookmarks and matted songs/poems
  • ...and More!

We're very excited to be working with producer Jeff Thomas (Ookla fans might recognize him as the producer of the 2003 album Oh Okay LA).  Jeff is once again lending his production talents, but is also an integral part of the band, providing the drum loops as well as the guitar and keyboard parts that sound too good to have been played by Rand.  We are also joined by Mike Mallory, whose amazing bass guitar playing is Via Bella's not so secret weapon.

This album will also feature some very special guests, including Seanan McGuire, Urban Tapestry, Vixy & Tony, Maya Bohnhoff, Doug White, Mike Brunacini, Brenda Sutton, and Amy McNally!

The album (currently in search of a title) will consist of the following tracks:

  • Fight Like a Girl -- we open with a perfect little slice of powerpop.  If you've seen us live you've heard this one.  "I’ll stand up for every person in the world who’s ever heard someone say, 'You’re not a fighter, you’re just a girl'”
  • The Face of God -- a funk/disco track about social responsibility.  Yeah, you read that right.  "We’ve all got despair to spare"
  • Fighting the Black Thing -- a folk/rock song based on Madeleine L'Engle's A Wrinkle in Time.  This is the song we're most excited about.  "Engage the world with head and hand and heart"
  • How to Grow a Soul -- a very short song adapting a Kurt Vonnegut quote.  "Write a poem for a friend"
  • Do As Peggy Says -- a powerpop track honoring Agent Peggy Carter, co-written by Rand's Ookla the Mok song-writing partner Adam English!  "Support your friends, always offer to help, know your value, and stand up for yourself"
  • She Persisted -- a feminist ballad inspired by Susan B. Anthony, Ruby Bridges, Bree Newsome, and Elizabeth Warren.  "The police said she’d not be released or have a moment’s peace til she ceased and desisted"
  • Dear Seanan -- a parody of Seanan McGuire's "Dear Gina" sung in the voice of October Daye. "If ever I escape this book I’ll find a way to make you pay"
  • Orphan Black -- a prog rock adaptation of the text of the Orphan Black season five trailer. "But they could not break us"
  • The Princess Who Saved Herself -- a cover of the criminally underappreciated Jonathan Coulton song.
  • Westworld -- Dolores and Maeve sing in counterpoint, and in 9/8!  "I imagined a different kind of story"
  • Nasty -- a Celtic-rock celebration of being on the right side of history. "We are the daughters of the witches your fathers failed to burn"

What We Need & What You Get

Here's our "shoot the moon" budget:

  • $2,400 -- Production (recording/mixing/mastering)
  • $2,600 -- Duplication (compact discs, packaging, distribution, shipping)
  • $ 500 -- Graphic Design

Rand has been recording and releasing albums for over 20 years.  He's worked with elaborate budgets and he's done albums on the cheap.  The budget for this album lies somewhere in the middle.  As producer Jeff Thomas once said, "If you want your album to sound like a million bucks, you need to spend at least fifteen thousand dollars."

If we reach our goal, we'll be able to record and package the CD of our dreams. The closer we get to that goal, the more fancy we can get with the quality of production (more elaborate arrangements, layering, re-recordings, multiples mixes, etc.) and packaging (including a lyric booklet, a professional photo shoot, etc.) 

But regardless of how much money we raise, this project is happening, and anyone who pledges will receive a finished record and any/all accompanying perks -- see side bar for all available perks, including an otherwise unavailable Seanan McGuire short story featuring Erin and Rand as characters!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Talk us up! Help get the word out by sharing our campaign on social media!
  • Indiegogo's share tools make spreading the word super convenient! You can just copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update, or click on the share icons to share through your social media networks.

The closer we get to that goal, the more fancy we can get with the quality of production (more elaborate arrangements, layering, re-recordings, multiples mixes, etc.) and packaging (including a lyric booklet, a professional photo shoot, etc.) 
But regardless of how much money we raise, this project is happening, and anyone who pledges will receive a finished record and any/all accompanying perks -- see side bar for all available perks, including an otherwise unavailable Seanan McGuire short story featuring Erin and Rand as characters!

Can't contribute right now? That doesn't mean you can't help:

Talk us up! Help get the word out by sharing our campaign on social media!
Indiegogo's share tools make spreading the word super convenient! You can just copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update, or click on the share icons to share through your social media networks.

story:
About this project

The songs are written. The musicians are ready. The studio is booked. Now we just need your help to make this project happen!

Darklighter is a new band founded by Cleveland musician and songwriter Britton Roberts (formerly of State Fair). The debut EP is an exploration of the dynamism of faith between the presence and the absence, the otherness and the nearness, the collision of the dark and the light creating the experience of transcendent mystery. Sound intriguing? Well, it can't exist without your support!

Music is a shared, communal experience - from the Sunday morning pew to the Saturday night pub. The success of any artist and their work is rooted in the soil of a supportive community. While most listeners are mere consumers, music lovers are active participants in the creative process. Without you we are just a clanging cymbal - an empty sound reverberating in the abyss of nothingness. Sad!

Please consider supporting this project, not with a handout but with an investment to help fund us on the front end and receive from a wide range of killer rewards in return.

Funding goes towards: Studio costs, musicians, mixing and mastering with platinum record producer Michael Seifert, graphic design, printing and online distribution. Most studio projects can cost upwards of $10,000 or more. We are doing this at a fraction of the cost while still guaranteeing a quality product.

Risks and challenges

Studio work can be grueling and time consuming. The last thing an artist wants is to rush their work out to the public before it is ready. If we are pushed off schedule it could add another month or so to our production schedule which could delay your rewards.

Additionally our date for the release party might not be able to accommodate everyone based on their availability. We will select and promote the date at least a month in advance so you can plan accordingly, but we cannot change the date based upon your preference. We can however accommodate dates for any house show, full band concerts, or lessons.

story:
My Biggest & Best Album Yet!

Over the last two years, I have been recording and producing a full-length album that features an all-star band of musicians from the Pioneer Valley in Massachusetts, complete with horn sections, string trio arrangements, and more.

I now have the opportunity to finish it with producer/engineer D. James Goodwin

...but I need your help.

What's Left To Do?

Although I have completed 99% of the recording, these final steps need funding in order to finish this album. Here is how the $5000 goal breaks down:

  • $1000 towards RECORDING STRING SECTIONS with DAVID NAGLER

You have heard David's arrangements on my past albums. His work has been essential to my productions, and will add another layer of depth to these songs.

  • $2400 towards MIXING with D. JAMES GOODWIN at THE ISOKON 

D. James is an incredible producer/engineer who recently completed Bob Weir of The Grateful Dead's new solo album. His magic touch will take this album to new heights!

  • $1400 towards MASTERING with JEFF LIPTON at PEERLESS MASTERING

Mastering is the elusive, but essential, process that gives an album a final polish and sense of cohesion. Jeff Lipton's musical and technological alchemy is the only I trust!

  • The remaining $200 goes towards fees related to running this campaign

What Do You Get?

By backing this project, you get an advance copy of the album, along with the option for many other perks, like...

  1. An autographed collection of all my past releases
  2. Credit as a Producer in the liner notes
  3. A private house concert

...and more! Check out all of the perks on the right --->

The Musicians...

Ryan Hommel (Electric Guitar, Pedal Steel, Backing Vocals), Zack Cross (Piano, Rhodes, Organ), Colin Jalbert (Drums), Reed Sutherland (Bass), Rhees Williams (Bass), Andy Wrba (Upright Bass), Kat Rapacki (Trombone), Nick Borges (Trumpet), Linda Worster (Backing Vocals), Robert Oakes (Backing Vocals), Katherine Oakes (Backing Vocals), Noah Hoffeld (Cello), Eric Martin (Violin & Viola), Brian Adler (Tabla) David Nagler (Horn and String Arranger)

story:
Disco: Volver a Empezar

Para donar solo dale click al boton que dice "Back it"

  • Despise de 12 años vuelvo a las cabinas para grabar una producción nueva.
  • Vivir de la musica en el Peru no es imposible, pero si es super difícil.  Uno tiene que hacer mil cosas para poder vivir.  Enseñar, tocar, grabar, hacer música publicitaria, etc... Grabar un disco es aun mas difícil, ya que es caro, por mas que uno sea músico, el alquiler de salas de grabación de altos estándares no son accesibles, es por eso que los músicos nos vemos obligados a hacer este tipo de campañas pro fondos.  Hoy en día existen estas plataformas de crowdfunding, pero también tenemos que hacer eventos pro fondos, conciertos, etc... muy a parte de trabajar para vivir.
  • Este disco es un sueño para mi.  Hay canciones que me han salido desde lo mas profundo del alma, de etapas de depresión, otras canciones como "Volver a Empezar" que habla sobre lo difícil que es volver a empezar... no podemos ofrecer lo que no tenemos.  Canciones llenas de amor, donde cada palabra sale desde el corazón. "Alma" es una canción que me describe perfectamente... " pongo el alma antes del cuerpo, nunca me arrepiento... y doy el alma en cada paso, fuerza para seguir cantando, alma, para seguir soñando, para regalarte mi alma..." De repente vienen a mi "Fotos y recuerdos"... "Si la vida se hubiera quedado igual, los amantes no se hubieran dejado de amar, si el recuerdo no doliera tanto, si nadie hiciera daño, si supiéramos todo lo que tenemos, antes de perderlo... si cada camino me llevara a ti, correría, para volver allí...."

 

Lo que necesitamos: 

  • Necesitamos US$7,500 dolares para el proyecto.  Este dinero va destinado a la grabación del disco, a la elaboración del arte del disco, fotos, un primer tiraje de 1000 discos, 300 tarjetas de descarga (vienen con un código, entran a la web, ingresan el código y descargan el disco), merchandising y campaña de prensa.

  • Se preguntarán porque no suena música de bandas nuevas peruanas en las radios... la respuesta es muy sencilla.  Para sonar en medios, uno tiene que tener un presupuesto a parte para eso.  Para la difusión se necesita invertir. es por eso que dentro del presupuesto para la grabación del disco he asignado un presupuesto para prensa y difusión.

Lo que recibes por tu contribución:

  • Por $20 Dolares recibes 1 CD y 1 entrada doble al lanzamiento del disco.
  • Por $50 Dolares recibes 1 CD, 1 entrada doble al lanzamiento del disco y un kit de merchandising.
  • Por $100 Dolares recibes 1 CD, 2 entradas dobles VIP al lanzamiento del disco, un kit de merchandising y una invitación doble a un concierto privado.

Otras formas de ayudar:

  • Si quieres ayudar y no tienes dinero para donar, podrías ayudar con tu talento.  Si eres fotógrafo, productor, diseñador, etc... podrías ayudarnos con tu trabajo. 
  • También nos puedes ayudar difundiendo esta campaña.

MUCHAS GRACIAS DE ANTEMANO!

" pongo el alma antes del cuerpo, nunca me arrepiento... y doy el alma en cada paso, fuerza para seguir cantando, alma, para seguir soñando, para regalarte mi alma..." De repente vienen a mi "Fotos y recuerdos"... "Si la vida se hubiera quedado igual, los amantes no se hubieran dejado de amar, si el recuerdo no doliera tanto, si nadie hiciera daño, si supiéramos todo lo que tenemos, antes de perderlo... si cada camino me llevara a ti, correría, para volver allí...."

 
Lo que necesitamos: 


Necesitamos US$7,500 dolares para el proyecto.  Este dinero va destinado a la grabación del disco, a la elaboración del arte del disco, fotos, un primer tiraje de 1000 discos, 300 tarjetas de descarga (vienen con un código, entran a la web, ingresan el código y descargan el disco), merchandising y campaña de prensa.
Se preguntarán porque no suena música de bandas nuevas peruanas en las radios... la respuesta es muy sencilla.  Para sonar en medios, uno tiene que tener un presupuesto a parte para eso.  Para la difusión se necesita invertir. es por eso que dentro del presupuesto para la grabación del disco he asignado un presupuesto para prensa y difusión.

Lo que recibes por tu contribución:

Por $20 Dolares recibes 1 CD y 1 entrada doble al lanzamiento del disco.
Por $50 Dolares recibes 1 CD, 1 entrada doble al lanzamiento del disco y un kit de merchandising.
Por $100 Dolares recibes 1 CD, 2 entradas dobles VIP al lanzamiento del disco, un kit de merchandising y una invitación doble a un concierto privado.

Otras formas de ayudar:

Si quieres ayudar y no tienes dinero para donar, podrías ayudar con tu talento.  Si eres fotógrafo, productor, diseñador, etc... podrías ayudarnos con tu trabajo. 
También nos puedes ayudar difundiendo esta campaña.

MUCHAS GRACIAS DE ANTEMANO!

story:
An unsere treuen Fans,

wir laden euch ein Teil unseres nächsten CDs Abenteuers zu werden!

Es ist uns eine Ehre, euch endlich die Musikstücke vorstellen zu können, an der wir die letzten paar Jahre gearbeitet haben. Euch erwartet eine Auswahl von inspirierenden Liedern über die Hoffnung und Tradition des Weihnachtsfestes weltweit.

Um das zu bewerkstelligen, brauchen wir eure Hilfe. Womit ihr uns helfen wollt, könnt ihr natürlich selber entscheiden. Sicher ist, dass euch als Dank besondere Preise erwarten. Und ihr seid herzlich dazu eingeladen die CD Veröffentlichung mit uns zu feiern, am 24.11.18 um 15:00 Uhr in der Nordhäuser Marktpassage. Dies ist auch der Beginn unserer Advent Konzert Serie. Die folgenden Termine dafür sind am:

 

09.12.18 Cyriaci Kapelle, Nordhausen

16.12.18 Cruciskirche, Sondershausen

 

Wir werden euch mit Posts zum Aufnahmeprozess auf dem Laufenden halten.

Vielen, vielen Dank schon im Voraus für eure Hilfe!

Eure Fellas

 

To our dearest Fans,

come be a part of our next CD adventure!

We're excited to share the music we've been working on for the past few years with a CD full of hope, inspiration, and traditional Christmas tunes from around the world.

We are grateful for any amount, large or small, and we'll have a series of special rewards for our super fans! We'll have a Release Party on Nov. 24, 2018 in the Nordhausen Marktpassage at 15:00 in addition to an Advent concert series:

 

09.12.18 Cyriaci Kapelle, Nordhausen

16.12.18 Cruciskirche, Sondershausen

 

We will continue to post updates throughout the recording process.

Thank so much for your help!

Sincerely,

Your Fellas

story:
Starting the new trend in entertainment:

The Concerts!

 

StageWood Consortium  is following the path of a “Sharing Economy”, aiming to disrupt the current status of the Live Entertainment Industry by creating: “An innovative, original and unique network that connects performing artists, event Producers, Fans and entertainment enterprises with software development professionals, in an integrated platform, capitalizing the advances in Blockchain technology to secure honest, ethical relationships and eliminate unnecessary intermediaries and scalpers.”

StageWood provides a trusted platform where a collaborative community of Fans, Artists, and Producers operate in a mutually beneficial environment.  Fans who underwrite our concerts can take ownership pride as they may be involved in important tasks, including selecting performers and coordinating unique experiences.  By crowdfunding these events, Fans have the opportunity to enjoy a unique VIP experience and become exclusive members of our community.

The community strategic approach to disrupting the entertainment business focus on two distinctive efforts:

  • Virtual business platform development:  our "soon to be released" social media outlet, TyKet; a value exchange instrument, TykCoin; and our virtual exchange application, Tykwood.  These tools will help coordinate art events around the world providing a stage for seasoned and emerging artist to connect with their fans.
  • StageWood Franchise: a network of physical locations designed to include a performance stage escorted by eight award-winning chef food tasting kitchens, a mixology bar, and eight landmark micro-theaters.

 

A Sponsorship Packet = A Memorable Event

A line up of prime artists is eager to perform at a StageWood Concert.  A budget proforma of these events has been carefully reviewed to determine the necessary resources to bring the event to life.  The financial resources required are divided into 50 crowdfunding packages.  These limited number of packages allows for an adequate coverage of coordinating expenses as well as appropriate management of rewards.

Crowdfunding Fans are treated with:

  • Involvement in the selection of featured artist, unless already determined.
  • Exclusive invitations (4) to Pre/Post Event Party with featured Artists Meet and Greet.
  • Premium tickets to the event (4)
  • VIP Access to the event, including red carpet elite entrance and backstage lounge access.
  • Package of 20 tickets to either balcony suite (when available) or midtier section.
  • Opportunity to use tickets and VIP facilities to celebrate a special occasion with friends. 
  • Opportunity to release package tickets for resale by the event promoter.
  • Memorabilia of the Event (when available).

Events coordination will initiate once developing costs have been raised, selected artist/performer has agreed to perform at the event, and the venue is secured.  In case of failure of any of these, funds will be returned to crowdfunding fans.

 

The Impact

Your support will help coordinate an amazing event that you will enjoy.  Furthermore, it will empower the growth of the community and the development of our virtual platform that will coordinate future events, integrating the security of Smart Contracts and Blockchain Technology to deliver guaranteed performances.

Our mobile social media application, Tyket will facilitate coordination of Fan interests with performer talents to further generate targeted crowdfunding events.  The direct connections between fans, producers, and artists will eliminate intermediaries, uberizing the entertainment industry.

Risks & Challenges

Besides the risk of not raising enough funds to cover the coordinating expenses for a concert, other hurdles may prevent our planned events.  To help minimize risks and improve our chances of delivering an outstanding performance we have arranged for the following:

  • Return of Investment if appropriate funds are not raised.
  • Event cancellation insurance policy to cover expenses and allow for the refund of crowdfunding investment or exchange to an alternative event. 
  • A lack of expected general public demand may drive ticket prices down, creating the risk of lower return than expected when Crowdfunders decide to sell their tickets.  There is no guarantee that placing Crowdfund package tickets back on the market will generate equal or higher return on investment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can contribute with the StageWood Community besides crowdfunding one of our events:

  • Learn about the Stagewood Community at our website www.stagewood.com and register in our newsletter. 
  • Look out for the release of our social media application Tyket.  Be one of our beta testing Fans and make Tyket the app You want!
  • You may event built a StageWood franchise in the city of your choice. Under the guidance of the StageWood Corporation, each facility will operate as an independent enterprise, either fully owned by the StageWood Corporation, or as licensee/franchisee of the corporation. They will complement the StageWood community by providing physical, dedicated stages for Performers to display their talents.

Learn more about our exciting projects by visiting our website

www.stagewood.com

story:
Lana Love’s musical journey began at the age of 4, when she plunked out Phantom of the Opera on the living room piano. Fast forward, the Southern Belle moved to NYC destined for Broadway. Since then, she has performed/dance captained several Nat’l and InterNat’l tours in over 20 countries. She has worked with Disney, Warner Bros, Marvel, Nickelodeon, HBO, Discovery Ch. and many more. Shortly after tour, Ms. Love began choreographing and writing lyrics Spanish Pop-icon, Nacho Cano (Mecano). From there she rediscovered her passion for writing— catapulting her into creating her own material. Lana Love is stepping into her own, in light of that little girl tinkering around on the piano.

Since the launch of her Pop Music career, Love has worked with several award-winning producers who’ve worked with the likes of Houston, Spears, Aguilera, Pink, Del Rey among many other power-house female vocalists. She has accumulated over 300k streams, performed in Times Square, headlined packed houses in NYC + Vegas and reached #3 on the Reverb Nation Pop/EDM Charts.
One thing she knows for sure...everything— absolutely everything— is LOVE.

A note from The Love Tribe: "We believe more people want to live their passion and just need some inspiration and the mindset to do it. We don’t need brave soldiers when the war is over, but those who fought with us in the trenches will bask in the glory of our victory." - World Artists United (WAU)

Website: LanaLoveOfficial.com
IG: @lanalovemusic

story:
Hello!  

My name is Kirsten and I’m the songwriter for Kirsten and the Pretty People.  We are a punk/soul band based in Brooklyn.

I’ve been a singer and a writer all of my life.  It has been my dream to record a live album since 2014.  The Pretty People is my mission to collaborate with as many different artists as possible.  The band is always evolving and rotating musicians to explore the music's full potential.  We’ve played 19 shows with 38 artists over the past five months.

Currently, our music is only available live.  We have a few stripped down demos online:

  • https://soundcloud.com/kirstenandtheprettypeople
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jE-rGhsiP6Q

Tons of people have been asking where they can find our music...we are ready to take the next step to make our music available!  We want to record five songs on my birthday, May 2nd.

What’s it about?

My writing is deeply introspective.  This is my opportunity to begin to heal my toxic relationship with myself, speak openly about sexual assault for the first time, and to claim my own narrative.  I want to examine the darkest parts of my past so that I can learn to communicate honestly through my music. We are going to record it on my birthday as a big celebration of life and bravery!

Why a live album?

Great question!  We want to record the music organically, in the way that we present it live.  We want to provide a unique and personal listening experience by closely capturing the emotion of these stories.  Also, doesn’t it just sound fun??

What do you need?

Our goal will cover the costs of one ten-hour day in a studio with 14 musicians, the producer fee, post-production on the EP, and distribution.  

What do I get?

In supporting this project, you’ll be included along the journey.  We’ll be sending exclusive behind-the-scenes footage, updates, and early download links to singles/music videos.  We’re also offering the chance to come and visit the studio, CDs, individual songs/poetry, streaming access for live shows if you're out of town, music lessons, and lots more fun stuff!

The Impact

"The communicative act of bearing witness to traumatic events not only transforms traumatic memories into narratives that can then be integrated into the survivor's sense of self and view of the world, but it also reintegrates the survivor into a community, reestablishing bonds of trust and faith in others." - Susan J. Brison, Aftermath

"Human nature is kindness and large-heartedness, compassion and respect.  But human nature is also vile and cruel, selfish and entitled...we make choices about how we treat each other, and too often the choice is to violate, to tear down and not build up...Does rape come from some primal instinct, or is it an inevitable outgrowth of the way we learn to relate to one another? No matter what the answer is, we certainly won't find it if we don't talk to each other."  Sohaila Abdulali, What We Talk About When We Talk About Rape 

Deciding to tell this story has been a rollercoaster.  I've been researching organizations that support sexual assault survivors in their attempts to claim their own narratives, and I have found some amazing resources.  Knowing that other people feel the same doubts and fears has given me so much strength.  Being able to connect with people that share a similar story has been invaluable. 

We are partnering with Project Consent, an organization that works tirelessly to educate on consent, to dismantle rape culture, and to support survivors.  They encourage community building, and offer tools to host healing workshops.  After the album is completed, a portion of the proceeds will be donated to Project Consent.

https://www.projectconsent.com/

We are partnering with Believe Me, a female-owned hat company.  The first 5 people to claim the $25 perk will receive a 20% discount code! They are an amazing organization that features anti-sexual violence and pro-consent messaging on their hats to empower people and start a dialogue.  They're also really cute:

https://www.believemeofficial.com/

What if I can’t donate?

If you’re unable to make a donation at this time, not to worry!  There are plenty of other ways to be a resource to someone in need.

Here are some other amazing organizations that benefit survivors of sexual assault.  These websites provide excellent educational resources:

  • https://www.nsvrc.org/
  • https://www.d2l.org/
  • https://www.rainn.org/

Finally, we ask that you please share the campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!  It truly means the world to me. I can’t wait to see what we can create.

story:
Welcome to the Remiso crowdfunding campaign. 

We are a newly formed musical project currently based in London, and we've been working on a record inspired by our favourite music genres, such as post-rock, jazz, and electronica, to create something we considered to be unique and relevant. 

Formed by Goldsmiths University music student Ahkok Wong and Patrick Evans in 2017, with addition of drummer Ben Sayeed from Patrick’s previous post-rock sensation 52 Commercial Road, the London trio Remiso delivers a unique blend of guitar riff driven composition with wide range of jazz, soul, electronica, ambient, and experimental influences.

Completed with the contribution of the phenomenal saxophonist Oli Arlotto, the splendid trumpeter Kevin Davy, fabulous flautist Guy Harries, and young vocal talent of Yasmin Harrosh, the album is a celebration of a multi music cultural collision which evokes an ever thriving imagination for new sound.

The album was recorded in Goldsmiths Music Studio, University of East London, and with additional sound captured in our home studio. Its just began the mixing process, but we need to ask for your help on this vital last step to make this album release possible.

If you could support us by pledging this Indiegogo campaign, it would help us in finishing the mixing and mastering process, and enable us to promote these materials further. Please choose a "perk" from the list, besides album and merch, you’ll also get production updates and all album teasers as we head towards the official release.

We are truly grateful for your support, and we assure you will enjoy the final result. 

First DIY music video:

 
Follow Remiso: 
Website: http://www.remisotheband.com/
Bandcamp: remisotheband.bandcamp.com/
YouTube: www.youtube.com/channel/UCCZij_qHHYNXyw...
Facebook: www.facebook.com/remisotheband/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/Remiso_London/

story:
LEGACY AT PLAY

  • Initiated by Dani W, indie artist and songwriter, Team Legacy was created to champion unity and community improvement through partnerships with local organizations, musicians and business.  
  • In the last two years, through select partnerships, Dani has teamed up with dream team creative leaders to make the Official "LEGACY" music video, to perform the original song "LEGACY" live at major events, and to assist and help commemorate fundraising over $1MM toward college education, entreprenuership skills and career placement for women.
  • Now Dani's excited to give back to the creative team who created the official music video which inspires love, freedom and multiculturalism!!  
  • At the end of 30 days, "LEGACY" The Official Music Video Launches Worldwide!!!

The Impact​

  • HELP US GIVE BACK TO OUR CREATIVE LEADERS Joining the dream team helps us reach our goal of giving back to three very talented creative leaders who put forth their time and gifts to create the Legacy Music Video in support of creating art first!  Special thanks goes to our Director Derek Jennings, Co-Producer Christian Brown and Dancer Suhalia Madison who volunteered their time and talent upfront.  They each went above and beyond in their specific roles to diligently plan, rehearse, execute and deliver the official music video.   
  • Every single person who donates, shares the links and participates in the Legacy campaign matters and makes a significant difference to spreading our team mission and supports the creativity of our Legacy Leaders.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $12,500 toward our creative leaders mentioned above, who fronted their time and talent.  This includes the Direction, Production and Dance team leaders who fronted over hundreds of hours of labor to make this video come to life.  
    • We are raising $9,000 toward the Direction and Production of the official "LEGACY" music video.  A scope of work clocking in at 100 hours.  Creative work includes building the film treatment (imagery, mood, tone, location and story line), scouting and recruiting each member of the dream team,  an operations and talent leadership crew of over 10, casting talent, location scouting, booking, scheduling, filming each scene at two main locations, directing the talent, coordinating logistics, coordinating dance rehearsals, administration and more.
    • We are raising $1,000 toward the co-production of the official music video; working closely with director and production team work.
    • We are raising $500 for the professional dancer fees and rehearsal time.
    • We are raising $2,000 for overhead costs including location use, equipment, on-set operating costs, makeup, wardrobe, crew's meals and film/tech gear to be paid back.

Raising over goal gets the band in rehearsals and back on the road, touring live music from Dani W's album in and around your hometown!  We're coming for you!

PERKS!

  • In 30 days, we send the official music video link directly to your email inbox.  You get VIP first look access!  Be sure to add music@daniellewcarter.com as a contact in your inbox.
  • As part of the team, during the 30 day celebration, you get special access to: 
    • Behind the scenes on-set pictures,
    • Feature photos and video clips from the major charity event performances,
    • In the recording studio images, and more...
  • Get VIP seating and gift bag at the live show on Aug 4th.  Dani performs "Legacy" and new music for you at finale party in person!  SAVE THE DATE!!  
    •  Bar Lubitsch, 7702 SANTA MONICA BLVD. WEST HOLLYWOOD, CA  
    •  Date:  August 4, 2018
    •  Showtime: 8PM

What we may leave behind...

As the song and music video grows wings, we can't wait to see what impact the lyrics have in more homes and how the message will live on in hearts across the globe.  Come around the world with us and let's see what can happen together!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Watch the "Behind the Scenes" video and then click share!
  • Use the indiegogo tool to share this campaign with a friend!
  • Enjoy the campaign party content!  
  • Join the mailing list at the official website danielleWcarter.com 
  • Attend the live music show on Aug 4th at Bar Lubitsch at 8PM!

Thank you.  It truly takes a village and we love having you on the dream team!

 

***CREATIVE TEAM LEGACY LEADERS***

"Legacy" the official music video is a beautiful journey of the heart about fighting through adversity, in the climb to triumph. It's not just a song, it's a movement." 

 

DREAM TEAM BIOS

We are proud to highlight an award-winning cast and crew starring:

Danielle W Carter (Dani W) is a multi-cultural performing artist and lyricist as heard on TV networks like E! and Oxygen.

Dani W is an Afro-Asian Tribal-Pop, Soul and Funk recording artist and songwriter based in Los Angeles, as heard on Keeping Up with The Kardashians, Kourtney and Khloé Take The Hamptons, Bad Girls Club, etc....  

Dani was invited to New York to perform her original song "Legacy" for the President of Georgetown University and leaders of CEO of Fortune 500 Companies who came together to commemorate their mission and help raise over a million dollars toward student education.  

Recently, Dani W and her band partnered had the honor of partnering with a wonderful Pasadena charity The Junior League of Pasadena at their annual fundraising event to help raise awareness and funds and commemorate JLP's five year mission to empower women through providing career resources and entrepreneurship skills.

Dani has performed along side Wayne Brady and Judith Hill from Michael Jackson’s This Is It and The Voice finalist, to help successfully place foster children in loving homes. 

Recently, as Vocal Director of GEMA Rocks VII, Dani worked with a talented cast of hit writers and talented artists including Nashville's hit songwriter Jim McCormick and recording artist Greta Gaines, Sirius XM's sweetheart band Tigers Are Bad For Horses, and Tate Tucker (who toured with Big Sean and opened for Lupe Fiasco), to put on an incredible music showcase at The Gonda Theater in Washington, DC. 

When not on stage, Dani works on new collections for her jewelry line ONYX xoxo. ONYX Styling champions women to own their innate grace and power. Being of mixed heritage, her mission is to collaborate with local talent, entrepreneurs and schools to empower a greater multi-cultural global community through The Dani W Project.

The Award-winning Choreographer Chuck Maldonado of Chuck Maldonado Entertainment and his incredible team of Assistant Choreographers Patrick LeShore Todd and Solice Surles. 

Chuck Maldonado has worked with artists such as; Chris Brown, P. Diddy, Neyo, Fergie, Omarion, Missy Elliot, Kanye West, Usher, Ludacriss, and Pink. Honored at the 2008 "Choreographers Media Honors Awards" for his work on 2007 Chris Brown Performance at the Grammy's, 2007 NAACP Image Awards for Artistic Direction, and Choreography, Brighthouse Network Commercial, and Best Movie in 2007 "Stomp The Yard". 

In TV and film, Chuck Maldonado choreographed the opening ceremony in Atlanta for the Centennial Olympic Games; utilizing 400 Steppers. He has also choreographed for MTV's “America's Best Dance Crew,” Fox’s “So You think You Can Dance,” ABC’s “Dancing with the Stars,” and HGTV's “Design On A Dime.” Additionally, Chuck has Choreographed Children’s Shows on Nickelodeon and Disney, namely, “Just Jordan,” “The Fresh Beat Band,” “That's So Raven,” “Victorious,” and “Big Time Rush.

The Director/Producer Derek Jennings of Apotheosis Entertainment. 

Being the eldest son of a professional actor and actress and the older brother of an eventual professional actor, it is safe to say that Derek Jennings literally grew up in a ‘house full of drama!’ Jennings was raised in incubators of creative thought and expression such as studio sets and theater houses throughout the Greater Los Angeles area by two, eclectic, headstrong individuals who instilled creative confidence in him at a young age. Without question, this led Jennings on an insatiable quest to empower people through the art of storytelling- as expressed throughout its various mediums. It is Derek's hope that you associate Apotheosis Entertainment with quality content that emboldens viewers to achieve the highest point in the development of themselves.

Most recently, Jennings produced season one of TBS's reality sitcom "Meet the Smiths" starring the "NBA on TNT's" Kenny "The Jet" Smith, produced a global, web, commercial campaign for IKEA, produced multiple branded content campaigns for the international design firm, frog Design, produced season two of INE Entertainment's "Hatched" (Hulu), and produced season one of Go 90's (Verizon) new digital docu-series "Top Grier," featuring Social Media Star Hayes Grier (CAA). Currently, Jennings is developing a docu-series he is directing and co- executive producing centered around S.T.E.A.M. (Science Technology Engineering Art Math) education.

Co-Producers/DP/Editor Siri Borgen and Tennyson Turner of Turner Family Productions

Siri Borgen had an interest in Art & Design from a very young age. She studied film at the Rhode Island School of Design and is now working with the company as a Producer, Director, Art Director and Editor, having worked in these roles with many clients on various types of projects (Feature Films, Short Films, Music Videos, Commercials, Documentaries, Live Events, Conferences, etc.). Siri also specializes in Art & Design and helps clients with a myriad of projects - from Photo Murals to Logo and Branding Design, Website Design, etc. In everything she does, she challenges herself and her collaborators to push boundaries and discover new ideas, new techniques, and new ways of thinking. 

Tennyson Turner is a film maker, inventor, and entrepreneur born and raised in Los Angeles. He has been making independent films for over 8 years. He has worked on and helmed sets of various sizes, and know that the energy that exists on set, will show in the final product. He attacks every project and subsequent problems with confidence and a smile, and aims keep his crew and partners in great spirits. Most recently Tennyson is directing and editing Music Videos, Documentaries, Pilots, Feature Films etc. with a myriad of personal projects in the works. He is an avid writer, simultaneously working on numerous scripts. Filmmaking is just the tip of the iceberg for him. Ultimately, Tennyson plans to revolutionize the way humans enjoy entertainment as a whole. 

Co-Producer Christian Najee Brown

NajeeBrown93 f.k.a. Christian Najee Brown is a Los Angeles native who finds joy in being versatile and taking on new talents.  Whether it's photography, acting, directing, music producing, or video editing; he wants and will do it all. Receiving praise for his work from multiple seasoned photographers and directors such as Matt Alonzo who directed music videos featuring artist like Kendrick Lamar and Chris Brown; photographer Michele Laurita who has done photography for Magazines such as GQ and Rolling Stone; and photographer Jean-Francois Campos who has shot for Louis Vuitton and Dior. This not only reflects the quality of Najee's work but also his keen eye for great art. 

Aside from photography, Najee is also half of the Hip Hop Duo Abstract New Sense in which he Produces music and direct/edits music videos. Najee is A firm believer in the saying, " Quality over Quantity" and with the recent launch of his online portfolio NajeeBrown93.com you can now experience just that. While showcasing his work across multiple mediums you will be able to experience a range of Najee's artistry. 

Featuring Leading Performers: Dancer and Choreographer Joe Brown and Fitness Trainer and Dancer Suhalia Madison

Joe Brown works as a professional dancer, choreographer, instructor, and creative director. His professional credits include America's Got Talent, The Streamy Awards (OMI, Sir-Mix-Alot), Samsung (Rihanna), Dawn Richard (of MTV's Danity Kane), French Montana, Nicki Minaj, Daddy Yankee and more!  At the community level, he teaches non-profit fundraiser workshops and helps teach inner-city youth with the performance group Step Masters Step x Step (Arsenio Hall Show, BET Experience). He is currently represented by MSA Talent Agency, one of the premier talent agencies in the nation.  Joe Brown recently performed on stage at Coachella with the Queen B Beyonce!  Congrats Joe!

Suhalia Madison is a Vietnamese, Chinese, Cambodian-American raised in the inner city of Chicago’s Northwest side. Her name means “gentle star”. Ever since she was a little girl all she did was perform and flip around like Nadia Comaneci. Singing, dancing and acting were her past times and she has continued to live her life making her vocation her vacation. She sang in various gospel choirs and was active in many sports and performing arts activities at a local park district called Pulaski Park. Her musical and sports related endeavors all began there. Competition experience stems back to various beauty pageants such as the Miss American Teen, Miss Divine and Miss Star pageants in Chicago. She was a competitive gymnast for the United Stated Gymnastics Federation Elite Team. She competed on national level until tearing her ACL, thereafter; her dreams were put on hold, after she still continued to pursue other goals in high school like playing volleyball and writing for school publication. She danced for the Fischer Dance Center, was a UCA Cheerleader and took part in Teen Street Theater Company’s Production of BoOom that traveled to Germany to perform. You can say that this young woman had passion, but her greatest love was just simply to perform and have a wonderful time doing all the things that god gave her grace to do.  Newly married, she lives with the love of her life in Chicago and is attending business school.  Congrats!!
 

Lead Wardrobe and Styling by: Rashante Lee of ReSeL Fashion 

For for the classy, elegant, creative and sophisticated contemporary woman that truly exudes femininity. ReSeL is a new and innovative start-up manufacturer and retailer of fashionable and contemporary apparel and accessory items

Styling and Wardrobe features ONYX xoxo designs created by Dani W to empower women to live boldly by design.

...plus, we can't do this without YOU!!!

Thank you for joining our team!

Love,

Dani & Team Legacy

LEGACY AT PLAY

Initiated by Dani W, indie artist and songwriter, Team Legacy was created to champion unity and community improvement through partnerships with local organizations, musicians and business.  
In the last two years, through select partnerships, Dani has teamed up with dream team creative leaders to make the Official "LEGACY" music video, to perform the original song "LEGACY" live at major events, and to assist and help commemorate fundraising over $1MM toward college education, entreprenuership skills and career placement for women.

Now Dani's excited to give back to the creative team who created the official music video which inspires love, freedom and multiculturalism!!  
At the end of 30 days, "LEGACY" The Official Music Video Launches Worldwide!!!
