story:
Erdbeer!

 

“Ich glaub, ich hab mich verhört!”

Wir konnten es kaum glauben, als uns das Wiener Start Up "erdbeerwoche" auf einen gleichnamigen Song im Netz aufmerksam gemacht hat:


Im November 2017 ging ein neuer Rap-Song des deutschen Chartstürmers KC Rebell online. Der Name des Songs ist „Erdbeerwoche“ und die Klicks auf Youtube haben die 4 Millionen Grenze bereits überschritten. Warum?

Gemeinsam mit Summer Cem und Elias, zwei weiteren angesagten deutschen Rappern, lässt sich KC Rebell ungehemmt über sein Problem mit dem Menstruationszyklus aus und beschimpft eine fiktive (oder womöglich im echten Leben existente) „Bitch“, dass sie doch bitte abhauen soll, wenn sie ihn beim ersten Date „ein bisschen geil macht, und dann erwartet dass er sich's alleine macht“. Ein starkes, obercooles Role-Model für junge Burschen und Männer kann eben nicht „abwarten und Tee trinken“, denn (Zitat!) „wenn´s vorne nicht geht, dann geht´s hinten, wenn´s hinten nicht geht, dann geht´s oben. Es gibt eine Million Methoden!“

Die Bitch wird heimgeschickt und KC Rebells Herz ist gebrochen. Unsere Herzen auch, denn wir können nach viereinhalb Minuten Prolo-Reimen nicht fassen, wie sehr die Frau, die weibliche Sexualität und der Menstruationszyklus hier ins Lächerliche gezogen werden. Irgendwie haben wir bis zum Ende des Songs gehofft, dass es eine Wendung gibt – vielleicht war ja alles nur ein schlechter Scherz? Ein sehr schlechter … Aber das passiert nicht. KC Rebell´s letzte Worte sind und bleiben: „Ich hoff du findest hier raus“, womit er hunderttausenden von jungen Mädchen das Gefühl gibt, dass sie gefälligst gefügig zu sein haben, egal, wie sie sich gerade fühlen. Die Botschaft ist unmissverständlich die, dass, wenn der Mann es haben will, er es auch bekommen soll. Ein Nein zählt nicht. Und die Menstruation ist sowieso nur eine schwache Ausrede einer „ehrenlosen, arroganten“ Schlampe.

Wir suchen im Netz nach pro-feministischen Antworten und finden … Katja Krasavice. Sie singt – spärlich bekleidet – „Gib’s mir doggy, gib’s mir doggy, gib’s mir doggy …“

 

Aufgeklärt...ähm... wie jetzt?

Im Gespräch mit  sexualpädagogisch tätigen Teams wird VAGINAS IM DIRNDL schnell klar, dass die Popkultur Jugendliche stark beeinflusst und in Fällen wie solchen auch sehr verunsichert. Vor allem für junge Mädchen werden solche Videos zu gefährlichen Manipulationsmitteln. Auch wenn sie lustig gemeint sind (was wir nicht finden), knabbern sie auf einer unterbewussten Ebene am Selbstwert junger Mädchen und Frauen und bewerben Sexualität als Leistungssport oder Performance, zu der man (frau) immer bereit sein sollte, damit der (männliche) andere zufrieden ist.

Was passiert da gerade mit unserer aufgeklärten Gesellschaft? Welche Frauenbilder werden da verbreitet? Und wollen wir einfach so zusehen?

 

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

 

Crowdfunding... wieso?

Ja, VAGINAS IM DIRNDL haben um öffentliche Födergelder bei Fraueneinrichtungen angesucht. Nein, sie haben sie nicht bekommen. Das hier ist Plan B.

B wie Backtriebmittel.

Unser finanzielles Ziel bei dieser Kampagne sind 5000 EUR, mit denen wir Produktionskosten wie KünstlerInnengagen, Soundstudio, Technisches Equipment, Kostüme, Ausstattung, Transport und Verpflegung bezahlen werden. Wir sind bemüht, unsere Kosten so gering wie möglich zu halten und gleichzeitig streben wir eine qualitativ hochwertige künstlerische Gesamtleistung an.

Der Produktionszeitraum beläuft sich auf mehr als zwei Monate, in denen Lyrics geschrieben, Sounds gesampelt, Musik komponiert, gemischt, gemastert, genäht, gedreht, geschnitten, organisiert, parodiert, geschminkt, kostümiert, frisiert und gebacken wird. Daran sind viele Menschen beteiligt, die an unser Projekt glauben und uns mit ihrer Tatkraft und Expertise unterstützen.  Mit eurer Unterstützung können wir das noch besser tun.

Als unsere UnterstützerInnen bekommt ihr speziell für diesen Zweck zugeschnittene "Perks" von "Erdbeerwoche" Fanartikeln bis hin zur einmaligen Chance, bei unserer Videopräsentation im Herbst 2018 als Special Guests mit dabei zu sein.

Und was passiert, wenn VAGINAS IM DIRNDL ihr Ziel von 5000 EUR nicht erreichen?

Wir produzieren unser Video trotzdem und setzen uns damit jedenfalls für intime Gerechtigkeit ein. Vielleicht wird unsere Torte etwas kleiner... aber wir glauben an dieses Projekt und werden uns nicht davon abhalten lassen, damit eine offene Gesprächskultur zu provozieren.

 

 

Unser Ziel

 

Ziel unseres Projektes ERDBEERWOCHE ist die Realisation eines pro-feministischen, provokanten Musikvideos bestehend aus Rap-Elementen vermischt mit typisch alpenländischem Sound, in dem wir eine Antwort auf KC Rebell´s vorvorgestriges Weltbild geben. Unsere Antwort ist friedlich, lustvoll und frech. Und wird hoffentlich ein Ohrwurm. Krieg wollen wir keinen – vielmehr wollen wir eine Diskussionsplattform schaffen, wo Stimmen aller Beteiligten hörbar werden. Und wir wollen zeigen, dass Feminismus auch humorvoll sein kann und Spaß machen darf. Junge Mädchen und Frauen sollen durch den neuen ERDBEERWOCHE Song dazu inspiriert werden, auf sich und ihren Körper zu hören und selbstbewusst mit jenem umzugehen. Wir wollen in unserem Song betonen, dass es bei einem ersten Date eben nicht zwingend zu Sex kommen muss – auch wenn KC rebelliert – und dass gegenseitiges Verständnis, Entscheidungsfreiheit und gute, wertschätzende Kommunikation das Um und Auf für eine erfüllende sexuelle Begegnung sind.

Das Musikvideo für die ERDBEERWOCHE bietet uns auf visueller Ebene noch einmal mehr die Chance, auf althergebrachte Role-Model Bilder einzugehen und diese auf die Schippe zu nehmen. Unsere Story beginnt da, wo KC Rebell´s Geduld endet. Unsere Version der ERDBEERWOCHE zeigt drei brave Hausfrauen beim Backen einer Erdbeertorte – so wie früher – rückschrittig sozusagen. Wobei schnell klar wird, dass wir den Schritt nach vorne wagen. Blut wird dabei nie fließen, unsere Erdbeeren sind sinnlich und rot genug! Housewive Dreams der 60ies, süßes Schlagobers und schwarze Dirndln im Gangsterlook erzeugen einen parodistischen Remix von stereotypen Bildern und neuen, starken Frauen-Stimmen. Unsere Version der ERDBEERWOCHE ist eine neue, innovative Rezeptur für Geschlechtergerechtigkeit. Wir backen gemeinsam einen Kuchen. Und teilen ihn gerne im Netz.

 

Risiken & Herausforderungen

 

VID spielt mit der Kombination von "Vagina" und "Dirndl". Ein anatomischer Begriff und ein Kleidungsstück, oder eine bayrisch-österreichsiche Bezeichnung für "Mädchen". An sich nichts Schlimmes. Die Tatsache, dass wir ein Musikkabarett zum Thema spielen, lässt aber doch bei vielen Menschen die Alarmglocken läuten: Immer noch trauen sich viele nicht, das Wort "Vagina" laut auszusprechen. Und die Erwähnung der "Vagina" in einem Atemzug mit einem althergebrachten, anständigen, traditionellen, alpenländischen Kleidungsstück geht dann schon gar nicht.

VID machen hier einen Spagat zwischen längst überfälliger Aufklärungsarbeit mit einem Programm, das sich viele VeranstalterInnen oder FördergeberInnen nicht zu unterstützen trauen. Die Herausforderung besteht darin, qualitativ hochwertige Kunst zu machen, mit der wir wichtige Diskussionsthemen ansprechen, die auch in der modernen Gesellschaft noch oft tabuisiert werden und das gleichzeitig ohne öffentliche Fördergelder zu schaffen.

Das gelingt uns einerseits durch sehr viel ehrenamtliche Arbeit und die Unterstützung vieler KollegInnen, die mit uns diese Vision teilen. Und andererseits mit eurer Hilfe!

Wir glauben, dass wir etwas verändern können.
 

 

Andere Wege, wie man VID unterstützen kann

 

Falls du uns finanziell nicht unterstützen kannst, aber trotzdem etwas zur Musikvideoproduktion der "Erdbeerwoche" beitragen möchtest, kannst du dich beim Dreh unserer Massen-Szene in Wien beteiligen. Der Call geht an menstruierende und nicht menstruierende Frauen*, die sich mit uns für Gleichberechtigung und intime Gerechtigkeit einsetzen wollen. Mehr darüber findet ihr ab Mitte Juni auf unserer Website:
www.vaginasimdirndl.com
oder ab Mitte Juni auf unserer Facebook Fansite:
www.facebook.com/vidirndl

 

DANKE, dass ihr an uns glaubt!

 

Eure

Sina, Anna und Ursula
a.k.a. VAGINAS IM DIRNDL

 

Diese Kampagne wird freundlich unterstützt von der erdbeerwoche GmbH Wien, die sich seit mittlerweile mehr als 7 Jahren für die Enttabuisierung des Themas "Menstruation" einsetzt. DANKE!
www.erdbeerwoche.com
story_txt:
Erdbeer!
 
“Ich glaub, ich hab mich verhört!”
Wir konnten es kaum glauben, als uns das Wiener Start Up "erdbeerwoche" auf einen gleichnamigen Song im Netz aufmerksam gemacht hat:
Im November 2017 ging ein neuer Rap-Song des deutschen Chartstürmers KC Rebell online. Der Name des Songs ist „Erdbeerwoche“ und die Klicks auf Youtube haben die 4 Millionen Grenze bereits überschritten. Warum?
Gemeinsam mit Summer Cem und Elias, zwei weiteren angesagten deutschen Rappern, lässt sich KC Rebell ungehemmt über sein Problem mit dem Menstruationszyklus aus und beschimpft eine fiktive (oder womöglich im echten Leben existente) „Bitch“, dass sie doch bitte abhauen soll, wenn sie ihn beim ersten Date „ein bisschen geil macht, und dann erwartet dass er sich's alleine macht“. Ein starkes, obercooles Role-Model für junge Burschen und Männer kann eben nicht „abwarten und Tee trinken“, denn (Zitat!) „wenn´s vorne nicht geht, dann geht´s hinten, wenn´s hinten nicht geht, dann geht´s oben. Es gibt eine Million Methoden!“
Die Bitch wird heimgeschickt und KC Rebells Herz ist gebrochen. Unsere Herzen auch, denn wir können nach viereinhalb Minuten Prolo-Reimen nicht fassen, wie sehr die Frau, die weibliche Sexualität und der Menstruationszyklus hier ins Lächerliche gezogen werden. Irgendwie haben wir bis zum Ende des Songs gehofft, dass es eine Wendung gibt – vielleicht war ja alles nur ein schlechter Scherz? Ein sehr schlechter … Aber das passiert nicht. KC Rebell´s letzte Worte sind und bleiben: „Ich hoff du findest hier raus“, womit er hunderttausenden von jungen Mädchen das Gefühl gibt, dass sie gefälligst gefügig zu sein haben, egal, wie sie sich gerade fühlen. Die Botschaft ist unmissverständlich die, dass, wenn der Mann es haben will, er es auch bekommen soll. Ein Nein zählt nicht. Und die Menstruation ist sowieso nur eine schwache Ausrede einer „ehrenlosen, arroganten“ Schlampe.
Wir suchen im Netz nach pro-feministischen Antworten und finden … Katja Krasavice. Sie singt – spärlich bekleidet – „Gib’s mir doggy, gib’s mir doggy, gib’s mir doggy …“
 
Aufgeklärt...ähm... wie jetzt?
Im Gespräch mit  sexualpädagogisch tätigen Teams wird VAGINAS IM DIRNDL schnell klar, dass die Popkultur Jugendliche stark beeinflusst und in Fällen wie solchen auch sehr verunsichert. Vor allem für junge Mädchen werden solche Videos zu gefährlichen Manipulationsmitteln. Auch wenn sie lustig gemeint sind (was wir nicht finden), knabbern sie auf einer unterbewussten Ebene am Selbstwert junger Mädchen und Frauen und bewerben Sexualität als Leistungssport oder Performance, zu der man (frau) immer bereit sein sollte, damit der (männliche) andere zufrieden ist.
Was passiert da gerade mit unserer aufgeklärten Gesellschaft? Welche Frauenbilder werden da verbreitet? Und wollen wir einfach so zusehen?

 Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst
 
Crowdfunding... wieso?
Ja, VAGINAS IM DIRNDL haben um öffentliche Födergelder bei Fraueneinrichtungen angesucht. Nein, sie haben sie nicht bekommen. Das hier ist Plan B.
B wie Backtriebmittel.
Unser finanzielles Ziel bei dieser Kampagne sind 5000 EUR, mit denen wir Produktionskosten wie KünstlerInnengagen, Soundstudio, Technisches Equipment, Kostüme, Ausstattung, Transport und Verpflegung bezahlen werden. Wir sind bemüht, unsere Kosten so gering wie möglich zu halten und gleichzeitig streben wir eine qualitativ hochwertige künstlerische Gesamtleistung an.
Der Produktionszeitraum beläuft sich auf mehr als zwei Monate, in denen Lyrics geschrieben, Sounds gesampelt, Musik komponiert, gemischt, gemastert, genäht, gedreht, geschnitten, organisiert, parodiert, geschminkt, kostümiert, frisiert und gebacken wird. Daran sind viele Menschen beteiligt, die an unser Projekt glauben und uns mit ihrer Tatkraft und Expertise unterstützen.  Mit eurer Unterstützung können wir das noch besser tun.

story: Thank you Familia!
story_txt: Thank you Familia!

story:
Big Possum Stringband's Debut Album

Greetings, oldtime music lovers and condoners! Your favorite young and rowdy trad musicians are putting out their first CD! Big Possum Stringband, winners of the 2018 Clifftop band contest, is taking our favorite old-time and bluegrass tunes and songs and recording them so you can listen and enjoy them whenever you want. Pre-ordering our CD will help us cover the many costs of recording and producing an album! It will also guarantee you a copy of the CD as soon as it's released in July.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Breakdown: Recording a CD is Expensive

$2000 - Recording, producing and ordering CD's

$350 - Copyright Fees

$200 - Art and Design

$300 - Misc. Merch

 

We’ve practiced, we’ve put new strings on the instruments, we’ve booked our studio time, and the only thing we’re missing is money to pay for it all! …on a more serious note, we are asking for your help to fund our inaugural album. We’ve got some cool perks to thank you for doing so; in addition to ordering our CD, you can get decked out in some Big Possum swag, or order a bunch of stickers to plaster on your friends' vehicles and cases. Have a favorite song? Want to hear Big Possum's take on it? Support us with the Cover Song perk! Want to host a house show and invite all of your friends and family to a private Big Possum show? Support us with the Big Possum Live perk! Want to improve your own playing or learn a new tune? Take a lesson with Big Possum with our Lesson perk! Options available for everyone.

 

The Impact

The individual musicians in Big Possum have all put in years of dedication to the old-time Appalachian music traditions in their respective regions, and now we're trying to do that as a band. Learning, playing, performing and teaching this music around the US and other parts of the world (Australia this August!) all plays a direct role in informing people of its existence and continuing the traditions that we've worked hard to keep alive. Recording this CD will give us another medium, possible the most useful medium, to share and educate people about what we do as a band. Your support of this campaign will directly support our mission to do that.

story:
"But what's the problem? There's always live music everywhere in Barcelona"

Each song you hear in Spotify or iTunes requires a Producer, a Recording Studio, Mastering and a Marketing Team so that the song gets discovered, played and shared-- and thus benefits the musician. That overall cost is often overlooked.

Pursuing any career is a challenge, but for musicians in Barcelona it has become exceptionally hard. It doesn’t matter if you are a local Catalan singer-songwriter or an expat British band, the perception here has started to be that buying drinks in a bar or music venue means live music comes with a drink (and that the musicians get paid well).  People willingly pay 15-20 euros on a DJ who plays other people’s music, and 40-50 on a night out, but often hesitate to pay as little as 5 euros to see a live band. 
 

Where does the money go?

  • We will be producing Spanish and Catalan versions of the website frontpagenewsbcn.com as well as spending on marketing costs for marketing in the local languages.  
     
  • We will be recording and mastering songs by three artists featured in this Indiegogo page, who are part of our Spring Campaign. We have events and artists booked for our Autumn and Winter events. This Playlist is refreshed weekly: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify


 

You can help four artists (and more) take their next steps in advancing their careers. You can also help enliven local audiences to be part of a thriving artist community.


Meet Barcelona Artists we love and believe in...

Each musician and band we have met is at a different point of their evolution as Artists: Zaq Squares is new to Barcelona but certainly not to epic singing and beautiful songwriting. There is always that unmistakable pause in a conversation (or thought) when Zaq bellows something raw in a song about pain, hope or some other melancholic moment. It's a voice that must be discovered.

Click here to find him in Spotify, YouTube and all the usual places. 
Be part of his next album.

​

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Meet Zaq Squares

Your contribution today will help him record his next EP. 
As a gift back to you he will call out to you in all the social media circles and also give you his next single before the rest of the world hears it.

He is the most easygoing yet professional collaborator we've met this season, and we hope you get to be part of his ongoing journey with artists and music bellowed out from his heart and soul.
More Zaq here: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify
...
...

Meet Liam Cloud

Liam Cloud is a young singer-songwriter who can be seen hosting live music nights around Barcelona. He released an album called "I Came from Pluto" in 2016, the single got an honourable mention in the International Songwriters Competition (out of 16,000 entries around the world).  Liam is working on his next releases now. He was most recently seen performing with his band Jezebel Lies in Independence Day celebrations in Barcelona, attended by 1,300+ locals.

He is part of a very active "Kalayaan" community that heralds culture, art and family ties in Barcelona and is set to mentor younger musicians to take the next step in their artistic lives.

Click here to find him in Spotify, YouTube and all the usual places. 
Be part of his next album. Your contribution will help him release his next album which has been in production for over a year.
...
More Liam Cloud here: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify
...

Meet Adeline


Adeline is a French singer-songwriter with a British soul, based in Barcelona for over 12 years. Her voice is far more amazing live and we wish for her recorded music to reflect that. Her current repertoire includes acoustic rock/pop/folk covers as well as some original songs, in the lines of artists such as Alanis Morissette and Tracy Chapman, with a mixture of English & French songs. You'll be surprised by the unusual combination of a strong and powerful voice with the tenderness, passion and energy she exudes.

Adeline is a teacher as well as musician. She will sing a dedicated song to all her supporters if you choose that perk.

Click here to find her in Spotify, YouTube and all the usual places. 
Be part of her next recorded video production
...
More Adeline here: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify
...

Meet The Monkey Men


The Monkey Men have been singing, gigging and jiving together for just over 3 years. Just like any artist in Barcelona, they love what they do-- often using day jobs to finance their passion projects.  They make huge sacrifices to do what they do.

Their shows get packed all over Spain; from people of all backgrounds and persuasions; and now it’s time for them to level up. Each member of the band brings their unique set of influences which have helped them create a sound which is part Delta Blues, a sprinkle of Swing and a dose of Rock. Help them to record a song that accurately represents their live sets.

While their music tends to be appreciated by a niche audience, we are all always surprised how packed their events get, with everyone from 16 to 80 year olds; hipsters and hippies; and even grown adults with monkey suits dancing away!

BUT it's a brave new world out there, and we can brave it together and make something beautiful.


How the money will help each artist specifically
 

  • We need €7,000 to record songs and create professional videos worthy of international stages and festivals 

    With the interest Zaq Squares, Liam Cloud, Adeline and The Monkey Men already get from festivals right now, this will help nail it for artists in 2020...we have professional videographers and photographers to record them before and after a live set in Front Page News concerts which they can use to promote themselves...and you will be an integral AMAZING part of that spring board to success.

    For recorded songs to sound like an artist's live music requires the right kind of studio and producer. If we met our target, we would be able to record up to 2 singles per artist in this campaign and also a video. 
     

  • ZAQ SQUARES writes almost every day and is one of the most hardworking artists we know. He is prepared to hit the Studio tomorrow, collaborating with local Barcelona artists.
    Listen to his Spotify and the Playlist we curated for him and in our website.
    He has so much more where that has come from.
    Your contribution will go towards helping him record and master his next releases.
    We are confident he can record two songs in just half a day's recording.

     
  • ADELINE is amazing when she sings live. The radio stations who host her LOVE having her in an intimate setting where her voice elicits emotions whether sung in French or English. 
    We would love for her recorded songs to match the feeling of her live performances!
    Your contribution will go towards helping her record and master a song recorded live with a new video.
     
  • LIAM CLOUD has at least 14 songs yet unrecorded and has been asked to perform in small venues around the States this year and next. Your contribution will go towards him finishing a release he has been working on for over a year, and perform that in venues and festivals in the US and in the UK in 2020.

    He is also committed to do mentoring sessions for younger Barcelona locals and your contribution will help towards expenses for rehearsal studios and expenses.
     
  • A SONG WITH A FULL BAND OF 8
    Recording a full horn section is a bigger challenge than many people would think. The Monkey Men have 2 formats: 5-piece band or 8-piece band. It is time for their full horn section to be recorded professionally where each sound is as distinct and beautiful as their live set. We watch them every Saturday we can - watch out for the next video we post!
     
  • A PRODUCER 
    We have found a beautiful producer we have a lot of respect for (more about them in our next update). He has David Gray and Josh Groban in his discography of artists he has worked with directly. He has always wanted to be part of a project that has a full horn section! What are the odds, right?! This however is a personal relationship between Artist & Producer -- we will let THEM share the story of their music relationship as it unfolds.
     
  • EPIC VIDEO
    Every band needs at least 1 awesome video. This requires a Director, Production Crew, Camera Operator, Lighting People, Grips, Gaffs, Sound AND editing time. This may involve a drone or projection mapping. Creative discussions are underway. We have a few people waiting to make this happen for us; in fact one of them is currently working with the Metallica World Tour Crew (more about them in our next update also!)
     
  • MARKETING
    We realise that for every artist-- juggling The Zaq Squares, Liam Cloud, Adeline or The Monkey Men artist thing PLUS marketing themselves as artists-- can be extremely difficult. This is exactly how Front Page News Team started and is just one of the reasons everyone in our team are completely behind these artists to help the local Barcelona Scene -- They need better instagramming campaigns and YouTube marketing and all the essential marketing and content machine stuff hat musicians need today. So it's a win-win for us to be part of this passion project.
     
  • WRITERS & STORY TELLERS
    We need people to have conversations about Front Page News and the artists we love  while we're busy recording, writing new songs and putting on great events. This too takes time, and fortunately we have a number of journalists and excellent music writers who will create and share great stories for us.


We will thank each and every one of you in social media platforms and even live onstage and in the radio stations that host us, and just basically holler out to the universe from a rooftop how awesome YOU are.


Have a look at the perks.

It goes without saying that we will talk more about this in the days to come. Here we are, pressing the proverbial red button...We look forward to this journey with you!!





A bit about The Perks...

There will be more perks. We plan to create songs and videos exclusively for supporters and will keep you closely posted on everything as the journey unfolds.  Many of the perks include a Single, and some have the EP.  But every perk comes with our love and devotion for the Arts; and is fuelled by professionals (giving their time to this project) who who have an optimistic view of Live Music's essential place in a community.


Do you have any questions for us? 

I'm sure we'll be talking more over the next few weeks.
story_txt:
"But what's the problem? There's always live music everywhere in Barcelona"Each song you hear in Spotify or iTunes requires a Producer, a Recording Studio, Mastering and a Marketing Team so that the song gets discovered, played and shared-- and thus benefits the musician. That overall cost is often overlooked.Pursuing any career is a challenge, but for musicians in Barcelona it has become exceptionally hard. It doesn’t matter if you are a local Catalan singer-songwriter or an expat British band, the perception here has started to be that buying drinks in a bar or music venue means live music comes with a drink (and that the musicians get paid well).  People willingly pay 15-20 euros on a DJ who plays other people’s music, and 40-50 on a night out, but often hesitate to pay as little as 5 euros to see a live band.  Where does the money go?
We will be producing Spanish and Catalan versions of the website frontpagenewsbcn.com as well as spending on marketing costs for marketing in the local languages.   
We will be recording and mastering songs by three artists featured in this Indiegogo page, who are part of our Spring Campaign. We have events and artists booked for our Autumn and Winter events. This Playlist is refreshed weekly: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify

 You can help four artists (and more) take their next steps in advancing their careers. You can also help enliven local audiences to be part of a thriving artist community.
Meet Barcelona Artists we love and believe in...Each musician and band we have met is at a different point of their evolution as Artists: Zaq Squares is new to Barcelona but certainly not to epic singing and beautiful songwriting. There is always that unmistakable pause in a conversation (or thought) when Zaq bellows something raw in a song about pain, hope or some other melancholic moment. It's a voice that must be discovered.Click here to find him in Spotify, YouTube and all the usual places. Be part of his next album.​              Meet Zaq SquaresYour contribution today will help him record his next EP. As a gift back to you he will call out to you in all the social media circles and also give you his next single before the rest of the world hears it.He is the most easygoing yet professional collaborator we've met this season, and we hope you get to be part of his ongoing journey with artists and music bellowed out from his heart and soul.More Zaq here: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify......Meet Liam CloudLiam Cloud is a young singer-songwriter who can be seen hosting live music nights around Barcelona. He released an album called "I Came from Pluto" in 2016, the single got an honourable mention in the International Songwriters Competition (out of 16,000 entries around the world).  Liam is working on his next releases now. He was most recently seen performing with his band Jezebel Lies in Independence Day celebrations in Barcelona, attended by 1,300+ locals.He is part of a very active "Kalayaan" community that heralds culture, art and family ties in Barcelona and is set to mentor younger musicians to take the next step in their artistic lives.Click here to find him in Spotify, YouTube and all the usual places. Be part of his next album. Your contribution will help him release his next album which has been in production for over a year....More Liam Cloud here: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify...Meet AdelineAdeline is a French singer-songwriter with a British soul, based in Barcelona for over 12 years. Her voice is far more amazing live and we wish for her recorded music to reflect that. Her current repertoire includes acoustic rock/pop/folk covers as well as some original songs, in the lines of artists such as Alanis Morissette and Tracy Chapman, with a mixture of English & French songs. You'll be surprised by the unusual combination of a strong and powerful voice with the tenderness, passion and energy she exudes.Adeline is a teacher as well as musician. She will sing a dedicated song to all her supporters if you choose that perk.Click here to find her in Spotify, YouTube and all the usual places. Be part of her next recorded video production...More Adeline here: Barcelona Acts we love on Spotify...Meet The Monkey MenThe Monkey Men have been singing, gigging and jiving together for just over 3 years. Just like any artist in Barcelona, they love what they do-- often using day jobs to finance their passion projects.  They make huge sacrifices to do what they do.Their shows get packed all over Spain; from people of all backgrounds and persuasions; and now it’s time for them to level up. Each member of the band brings their unique set of influences which have helped them create a sound which is part Delta Blues, a sprinkle of Swing and a dose of Rock. Help them to record a song that accurately represents their live sets.While their music tends to be appreciated by a niche audience, we are all always surprised how packed their events get, with everyone from 16 to 80 year olds; hipsters and hippies; and even grown adults with monkey suits dancing away!BUT it's a brave new world out there, and we can brave it together and make something beautiful.
How the money will help each artist specifically 
We need €7,000 to record songs and create professional videos worthy of international stages and festivals With the interest Zaq Squares, Liam Cloud, Adeline and The Monkey Men already get from festivals right now, this will help nail it for artists in 2020...we have professional videographers and photographers to record them before and after a live set in Front Page News concerts which they can use to promote themselves...and you will be an integral AMAZING part of that spring board to success.For recorded songs to sound like an artist's live music requires the right kind of studio and producer. If we met our target, we would be able to record up to 2 singles per artist in this campaign and also a video.  

ZAQ SQUARES writes almost every day and is one of the most hardworking artists we know. He is prepared to hit the Studio tomorrow, collaborating with local Barcelona artists.Listen to his Spotify and the Playlist we curated for him and in our website.He has so much more where that has come from.Your contribution will go towards helping him record and master his next releases.We are confident he can record two songs in just half a day's recording. 

ADELINE is amazing when she sings live. The radio stations who host her LOVE having her in an intimate setting where her voice elicits emotions whether sung in French or English. We would love for her recorded songs to match the feeling of her live performances!Your contribution will go towards helping her record and master a song recorded live with a new video. 

LIAM CLOUD has at least 14 songs yet unrecorded and has been asked to perform in small venues around the States this year and next. Your contribution will go towards him finishing a release he has been working on for over a year, and perform that in venues and festivals in the US and in the UK in 2020.He is also committed to do mentoring sessions for younger Barcelona locals and your contribution will help towards expenses for rehearsal studios and expenses. 

A SONG WITH A FULL BAND OF 8Recording a full horn section is a bigger challenge than many people would think. The Monkey Men have 2 formats: 5-piece band or 8-piece band. It is time for their full horn section to be recorded professionally where each sound is as distinct and beautiful as their live set. We watch them every Saturday we can - watch out for the next video we post! 

A PRODUCER We have found a beautiful producer we have a lot of respect for (more about them in our next update). He has David Gray and Josh Groban in his discography of artists he has worked with directly. He has always wanted to be part of a project that has a full horn section! What are the odds, right?! This however is a personal relationship between Artist & Producer -- we will let THEM share the story of their music relationship as it unfolds. 

EPIC VIDEOEvery band needs at least 1 awesome video. This requires a Director, Production Crew, Camera Operator, Lighting People, Grips, Gaffs, Sound AND editing time. This may involve a drone or projection mapping. Creative discussions are underway. We have a few people waiting to make this happen for us; in fact one of them is currently working with the Metallica World Tour Crew (more about them in our next update also!) 

MARKETINGWe realise that for every artist-- juggling The Zaq Squares, Liam Cloud, Adeline or The Monkey Men artist thing PLUS marketing themselves as artists-- can be extremely difficult. This is exactly how Front Page News Team started and is just one of the reasons everyone in our team are completely behind these artists to help the local Barcelona Scene -- They need better instagramming campaigns and YouTube marketing and all the essential marketing and content machine stuff hat musicians need today. So it's a win-win for us to be part of this passion project. 

WRITERS & STORY TELLERSWe need people to have conversations about Front Page News and the artists we love  while we're busy recording, writing new songs and putting on great events. This too takes time, and fortunately we have a number of journalists and excellent music writers who will create and share great stories for us.
We will thank each and every one of you in social media platforms and even live onstage and in the radio stations that host us, and just basically holler out to the universe from a rooftop how awesome YOU are.Have a look at the perks.It goes without saying that we will talk more about this in the days to come. Here we are, pressing the proverbial red button...We look forward to this journey with you!!
A bit about The Perks...There will be more perks. We plan to create songs and videos exclusively for supporters and will keep you closely posted on everything as the journey unfolds.  Many of the perks include a Single, and some have the EP.  But every perk comes with our love and devotion for the Arts; and is fuelled by professionals (giving their time to this project) who who have an optimistic view of Live Music's essential place in a community.
Do you have any questions for us? I'm sure we'll be talking more over the next few weeks.

story:
Welcome, I am so very excited you stopped by!

My name is Hannah Dawber. I am a singer-songwriter based in New England. I started singing when I started speaking and taught myself the guitar when I was 12. My style embraces indie, folk, and art-pop vibes. Think Gabriella Aplin meets Maggie Rogers with a touch of the Lumineers. I am a dreamer and bird lover. I admire when others tell me their story. I am an optimist and get jazzed over good conversations. And I tend to eat peanut butter every day.

But what we are really here for is to talk about the dream I’ve had my whole life unfolding before my very eyes. 

It’s real people…. 
I will be recording my first album this fall!!!

Have you ever met someone, applied for a job, or had a conversation and although you might not have had all the pieces figured out, you just knew it was right for you? That is how I felt when I got off my first conference call about this dream. 

Old Bear Records, located in upstate NY is where I will record. My dear friend and producer, Jonas Woods introduced me to Chris Hoisington of Old Bear Records and Brothers McClurg in early fall 2018.  Each conversation following that first has confirmed this perfect fit for me.

Recording isn’t cheap and I am not very good at this, but teamwork makes the dream work right? 

I am inviting you to join me on this journey as I pursue a dream I just can’t shake. As the bio says above- the impossible is possible and I whole heartily believe in this or I wouldn’t do it. Any amount helps- but we only got 60 days! If I’m being raw- that petrifies me, but I believe God’s faithful hand will see this through. 

THANK YOU!!! for your encouragement, love, joy, and prayers through my musical journey thus far and thank you for what is to come! This isn’t just a journey about me making music, this is a journey about learning about the more we are all capable of. 

 

More about me… 

I grew up surrounded by a family that jams together. Every holiday, get together, weekend, or whatever it was, music was embedded in it all. I thought it was normal and all my friend’s families did the same. I quickly found out in high school that that wasn’t the case. I was very shy growing up and would make my mom, or whoever was watching turn around as I would share a “new hit”- It was usually a cheesy song about what I thought love was. Not many people in high school knew I sang. My biggest regret was leaving the Beauty and the Beast audition when I was 15 because I was so afraid what my peers would think of me. As I aged, I have learned- still learning- how to combat those vicious lies. I began performing more and recorded a few rough songs in my cousin’s basement. Nothing was consistent, but I was proud and passionate each time I worked on music. I played small gigs throughout college and after graduating traveled the world doing missions work- guitar in hand. Through it all, I have come to love what rhythms, harmonies, and lyrics bring out. I love watching a crowd feel each note and sing along to each story. It’s the most beautiful thing. 

This past year I continued to battle myself. Do I pursue this thing or not? Is it too late? Am I as good as people in my family or the people out there already? Would anyone even want to hear what I have to say? Those lies have spoken loud, but they have not stopped me. 

In the last 27 years, I've learned- finally, that being you is enough. All the beautiful AND quirky things that come along with being human is what makes us perfect. It is human being not perfect being, right? I have also learned how much more we are capable of accomplishing. No matter how little money or self-esteem you have, you can do more. It is possible. 

I could go another year wondering what would have happened if I stepped out of my comfort zone into the unknown or I could just do it. 

Let’s just DO IT! (no, this isn’t a sponsor for Nike- I work for Timberland ehh) 

Thank you once again for being a great human. 
You are loved and cherished. 

Until next time,
Check out my Instagram for snippets of my songs and covers of humans I look up too along the way!

story:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Polyphony Marimba is so happy to be embarking on national tour at the end of July, playing five to six nights a week, until  mid-September, . We are devoted to exploring new musical frontiers, and are hard at work on a new album with several brand new compositions to share on the road. This is a new autumn time-frame for us, providing new opportunities, like being in New York City in September. Would you please consider contributing to our 2019 musical odyssey?

Over the last ten years, completely self-operated, we have established a steady circuit of gigs in the United States. Polyphony (rhymes with 'epiphany') Marimba has played over 400 concerts around North America and we have sold over 5,000 CDs. Originally more than half of our gigs were busking on the street. When we play this music near any populated area, as we have done in Washington DC, New York City, Chicago, Boston and Asheville, NC, a crowd instantly gathers!

Founded in 2010, Polyphony Marimba has grown steadily with an ever-expanding fan base.  Our mission is to create and sustain an acoustic ensemble of nine fantastic players who want to make a beautiful life out of the roots music of southern Africa, while contributing our own creative expression to that tradition. Founder Peter Swing has taught the music of Zimbabwe for 30 years, has led several previous ensembles, all the while keeping an active shop building and perfecting Zimbabwean-style marimbas which are sold coast to coast. The unique one-of-a-kind E~flat Marimbas built exclusively for Polyphony Marimba are lovingly hand~crafted, and sound phenomenal.

Drawing from all around the country we found the very best marimba players, who have tremendous talent and deep experience playing Zimbabwean marimba music. These stellar musicians have all have grown up in the music within their respective communities and we are so happy to have these incredible marimba players join us: Karyna Swing from Santa Fe, New Mexico, Jesse Larson from Boulder, CO, David Onstott from Albuquerque, NM, Adam Halpin of Spokane, WA, DeeDee and Tessa Wells of Joplin, MO, Conrad Rice from Eugene, OR, and Branson Seamons from Coeur d’Alene, ID.

We are a small organization manifesting the complete logistics of tour and all that it entails, by our own devices and with the loving support of our families and friends. Here is where you come in! We believe we can provide solid, honorable and artistic work for a group of young people and ourselves for 10 weeks out of the year, with up to $500/week guaranteed. Your financial help will nudge us ever closer to this long range vision.

Our fund-raising goal in this campaign is $5,500, half of our total tour budget of $11,000. (The other half we have raised with privates donors and our own humble resources!) This covers our logistical needs, so that all income earned at gigs is paid to our musicians. Here is a breakdown of what your generous gift supports:

1. Gas and Incidentals  . . . . . .$4,500.

2. Hotels  . . . . . . . . . . . .  .  .. . . .  3,900.

3. Insurance . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  . . 1,400.

4. Recording Session.  . . . . . . .  1,200.

We invite you to our concerts! You can find a detailed schedule and much more at www.polyphonymarimba.com   We hope you check out our energetic natural sound, emanating from the depths of southern Africa, that lift our hearts and join us together in a joyful music experience. 

Thank you kindly for your consideration. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

Peter Swing, Director

story:
A Little More Info... 

After finding myself fortunate enough to have received support from Maveriq Studios in Malaysia, and connecting with amazing, inspiring people, I met one more, once I was back in London. 

 

Meet Koko

Agnieszka "Koko" Kokowska is an award-winning Director of Photography and short film-maker. After seeing what she's been involved in, and after realising what an eye she has, I couldn't wait to collaborate with her, as I had soon realised that her mind and her creative spirit was exactly what was needed to fill in the gaps. 

(You can see some of her stuff at https://www.agnieszkakokowska.com) ,

So, since then, we've sat down and brainstormed, created a story-board, location-scouted and solidified what equipment we would need. What we need are the funds to secure the camera and lighting equipment and to support the crew. 

Since we know we're working with a tight deadline, we aimed to come up with what we believe to be an achievable budget. We've carefully researched where to find the best prices, and we've called on the favour of generous friends, but now we need that final push to get us over the finish-line. 

We would be SO grateful if you could support us with this. 

For me, it means that I will finally have some visual content that is all my own, something for fans to hold on to. I've been performing around Asia, in lots of packed venues, and I have engaged with audience members who know my content, and know what I have to offer. But there are 24 hours in a day, and at those times when the artist is not performing, the music videos and visual content are what the fan turns to. 

As for Koko, she's been successful working in film for a while, but this project marks the beginning of her own solo journey in a completely new location and network. 

 

What We Need to Fund

We need to raise costs for: 

Camera Hire (£200)

Developing and Scanning (£200)

Wardrobe (£170)

Crew Expenditures (£260)

Travel and Food (£140)

Site Location Entrance (£60)

Buffer (£70)

Total £1100

People have shown us a great deal of trust - we've already gained access to the camera and have been allowed to pay the rental cost once the campaign is successful. But there are still a few steps to go! 

As mentioned earlier, the deadline for this goal is pretty tight. IF we don't manage to reach our goal, we can still find ways to work with what we raise, so every little bit truly helps! 

 

If donations are too tough to manage, we totally understand. You can still help by sharing this campaign with those you think might be able to contribute! 

Thank you SO much for taking the time to have a look at the campaign and thank you in advance for giving! 

 

_________

 

*Update*

Since drafting this campaign, we've had to start the process, knowing that time is really tight. So we now have some footage, because our generous contacts have allowed us to use equipment, which we can pay for once we have success with the campaign. 

So it's even MORE critical that we reach out for your help! 

Again - thank you so much for ANYTHING you can contribute!!

story:
Short Summary

Dirty Uncle Rose is hitting its stride as a band and we are ready to bring you an album. We have the songs ready to go, the musicians ready to play, and the studio ready to record! We just need your help to make our recording dreams a reality. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to pay for studio time, an engineer and mastering. We have priced it all out and it comes to the total we are campaigning for. 

Not only will you get a digital copy for download of the album when you give $15 or more, but you'll get a Dirty Uncle Rose sticker to display your love for the band. At the $100 level, you'll get a Dirty Uncle Rose poster. At the $500 level, Rose will play an acoustic solo show for your private house concert if you live in the Portland, OR area. At the $1,000 level, Dirty Uncle Rose will play a house show, party, or event for you if you live in the Portland, OR area. 

If you don't dig on digital, you can request an old school cassette tape, made by DUR guitarist Gabe Averre, complete with original artwork. Just send us a note with your order!

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still put what we raise toward an album and begin the recording process. We will then chip away at it with our own funds until it is complete and still get you an album in the end.

The Impact

By chipping in today, not only will you get a great album, but you will help a great band get its music out in to the world! 

Risks & Challenges

There are very few, barring acts of god and nature. :  ) We have the studio time booked and are all ready to record! The album may just have fewer songs if we do not meet our goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give, please share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family!

Follow us on Facebook

Come to our shows in Portland!

story: I'm JJ Demon. Remember Growing iLL, the first Josie album? If you're here, you probably do. Or maybe this thing blew up and it's attracted all sorts of first timers. If so, hey idiots! What took you so long? Look, we're under no illusions about fame or fortune. We started as scraggily dope fiends from Philly, ripping and robbing and rapping in between. They don't let people like us blow up. But shit, that first album was a monster and I'll be damned if we don't have another one ready to go. We just need help getting me to Colorado to record my vocals. We gotta pay someone to shoot a video or two (no one listens to new music anymore if you aint got visuals). And we wanna throw some money at whoever else helps us mix, master, drops off hoagies, does the cover art, etc. Albums cost money. Help us make this thing, it rules you're gonna like it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mary Vanhoozer-Rodriguez. I'm a pianist and recording artist with a passion for sharing music with live audiences, as well as for bringing great music into people's homes and communities through audio recordings. I am especially excited about the music of J. S. Bach; his music features both a purity and rich complexity, a rare sound-world in our current culture. Bach's music is particularly meaningful to me because it exudes a deep joy, not simply a superficial happiness. Originally, Bach wrote these partitas for amateurs of music, 'for their spiritual enjoyment and the refreshment of their minds.' In Bach's day it was not uncommon for amateurs to play at the level where they could play these partitas. Today, it is sadly less common, and for me this is yet another compelling reason to share Bach's music: by recording each of these pieces on our Yamaha C3 model in our living room, I even re-created the most common setting in which contemporaries of Bach would have played. By helping support our campaign you will also help make this joyful music come to life in other people's homes and communities. 

It's also a great privilege to premiere Josh Rodriguez's Partita for Piano. This newly commissioned piece is a beautiful, colorful, and dramatic gem written in five movements: Toccata, Minuet, Fugue, Passacaglia, and a dance inspired by Electronic Dance Music. The opportunity to share this special new work with audiences would be an honor for me and a gift to them. A word about the composer: Josh Rodriguez was born in Cordoba, Argentina. He spent his childhood in Guatemala and Mexico. After completing his doctorate from the University of California, Los Angeles, he has worked on numerous film and classical music commissions. To listen to his work, please visit: joshrodriguezmusic.com.

We also are excited to have theologian Kevin Vanhoozer on the team: he will be contributing an essay, elaborating on Bach's connection with the Reformation, and how this theology impacted Bach's music.

What We Need & What You Get

A project of this magnitude would typically cost well over $6,000. We have already saved and budgeted the first $3,000 for the recording and mixing, and have hired Todd Maki as our sound engineer (http://www.toddmakicomposing.com/). We are using industry standard microphones and mixing techniques and exploring various distribution possibilities. Our campaign is asking for $3,000 to master the tracks, and to manufacture, print and distribute the album as both digital download and collectible CD. As entrepreneurs we rely on friends and lovers of music to help us bring our vision to life. We are making this collectible 2-CD set and theological essay for you. Your contribution will help us finish this exciting interdisciplinary project. There are various contributions you can make, with specific perks for each one. 

This is not our first time raising money to make an album: in 2015 I successfully reached my campaign goal to fund an album of original songs, called 'Songs of Day and Night.' I also successfully campaigned to fund the Brahms’ Ghost Piano Trio tour in Southern California in March 2016, where we played several outreach concerts, worked with students, and premiered a newly commissioned work at Biola University and Westmont College.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can give financially, but you can still contribute! If you like what we're doing, please share our campaign with friends via email, Facebook, etc., and get them excited about this too!

story:
History and Purpose

I began my musical journey in 2013 and have not stopped since. It has been crazy, exciting, and fulfilling. There is nothing better than knowing what it is that makes your heart keep ticking and doing it, really doing it.  My first EP "Free Birds" recorded in Brazil with producer, Ton Molinari, was released in 2014.  Since releasing "Free Birds", I have grown as an artist, finding my sound has been quite a journey and, honestly, I think I'll forever be on it.  However, finding a reason to sing was never been an issue. 

I am passionate about singing with purpose, singing with truth and hope soaked into the lyrics.  I am blessed to have been a finalist in the Unsigned Only song writing competition with my single "Merman" released in 2015.  In a nationwide search for the next Nashville star, I was top 10 out of 715 contestants, but I chose not to continue in the contest feeling that I needed to be true to myself and my music.  That was an extremely hard decision.

 

I am so grateful for the support I have received thus far and I'm so pumped to finish my next EP.  I'm working with Producer, Matt Moss, from Lake Charles, Louisiana.  I felt I needed a product that represented me well, something that would launch me into my next step. I know you guys will love it.  Speaking of next step, I hope to tour/move mid 2017 to spread the music and the love.  I think it's a little scary and challenging to leave everything you know in a little town to some booming city with just a little change in your pocket and a strong will to go for it.  OK so the point----the campaign.

Why I Need You.

Here are some ways your contributions will help me:

  • Studio Time/Production. Including costs of recording, editing, and mixing. (Each song costs over $1,000)
  • Printing Physical Albums. So you can get a cool hard copy and jam it in your car.
  • Graphic Design. (logos, album art, web design, merch design) every artists needs the internet game strong, got to get with the times.
  • Publicity/Promo. Includes helping me reach more people through touring, I wanna go far and wide! (I am willing to sleep in my car, but I do have to eat.)

 

The Impact

I believe this EP is a statement of courage.  It's the thing that's scary.  The thing where your heart says "this is all I've ever wanted and you're trembling as you wait to expose you heART to the world. 

In supporting me:

  • You are become a co-laborer with me in reaching my dreams and my God-dreams.
  • You are giving permission for ALL the dreamers to dream
  • And you are helping me reach more ears that need to hear hope

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is putting all the funds into an EP and not having sufficient funds to travel and promote the music. Touring on my own as a woman would be challenging; however, I'm quite sure... when there's a will there is a way.  I believe that GRIT/PERSISTENCE is key to overcoming any challenges that may come my way, and I have that.  I believe in myself and I believe in the power of music. When you know what it is you were born to do, it's very easy to be all-in and let nothing get in the way.

Share the Campaign with your Network

Hey I've been a "broke" college student before, so if you don't have the green stuff ($):

  • spread the word, let people know via instagram, facebook, word of mouth, twitter, whatever else
  • you can use the Indiegogo share tools
  • hashtag #brittanypfantz

YOU GUYS ROCK.

story:
Leah Marie Debut EP

Hello! My name is Leah Marie. Music has always been my first love. I come from a family with a musical background and started playing drums at age 6 and my interest in music grew from there. Eventually, I began taking piano lessons and started writing lyrics as early as elementary school. I have always been one that if I am trying to convey a thought or idea I do better when I write it down. Constantly writing down thoughts and emotions grew into a love for music.

Music interests have varied from growing up until now. I grew up listening to 80's rock, but now, my biggest musical influences are Loretta Lynn and Janis Joplin. They were not and are not afraid to push the limits in their music and sing about subjects that may not have been the most comfortable for everyone to hear.

I have always drawn inspiration from personal relationships or life events that I have experienced. For example, one of the songs that will be recorded, "Bullet", is about a mixture of things past interests have said to me. This is REAL LIFE and if I've experienced certain circumstances, maybe my lyrics and story can help someone who is experiencing the same thing or something similar.

In the past year I decided to truly pursue a career in music. I have been fortunate to learn from some of the best in the business. I have focused on growing as an artist, finding my voice through playing and writing original music. 

Now, it's time for me to share that music with you! I have been fortunate to find a recording studio I have full confidence in to handle this project with care. They are just as excited as I am to get this music to you!

The songs on this EP are a reflection of lessons learned. There are stories of heartbreak, loving others and loving yourself. My goal with this project is not to simply push numbers but I am hoping that my stories and lyrics are able to resonate with even one person. ❤

 

How Your Donation Helps:

The donations raised will help cover studio costs, including mixing and mastering, bringing in other musicians and CD creation. If there are leftover funds, it will go towards the promotion of this project.

PERKS because YOU ROCK!!!

I am forever grateful for the continued support I have received in choosing a career in music. I have been pretty blessed with such a great support system!!! To show my appreciation for donations for this project, I have put together several PERKS packages.

Feel free to check them out!!!

If you can't contribute financially, there are still ways you can support this project! One of the biggest ways you can help is by sharing this campaign with your friends and family (social media, word of mouth, text messages, etc.). There is an option to share at the top right-hand corner of this page.

THANK YOU ONCE AGAIN FOR TAKING THE TIME OUT OF YOUR DAY AND SUPPORTING THIS CAMPAIGN!!!

story:
Hi,  I'm John D'Amato an independent blues artist about to make my 3rd CD. My 2nd CD "Born Blue : The Sun Session was a great success because of people like yourself who opened their hearts and contributed to my campaign. Because of their generosity:

  • I was able to record my CD at the world famous Sun Studios in Memphis, TN (The Home of The Blues)
  • My song off that CD "Two Dollar Dress" was nominated for an "Independent Blues Award" for "Best Blues/Rock Song of 2016".
  • The CD reached #5 on The National Blues/ Rock Charts and #2 on the National Acoustic Blues Charts.

I asking for a total contribution of $10,000. $

  • $5,000 will be spent on recording, mixing, mastering and production of the artwork and physical CD
  • $5,000 will be spent on promotion. This includes the record promoter, distributor and publicist.

My last CD had great success with out a promotional budget. I can only imagine what the heights it would have reached if I had an additional $5.000 to promote it properly.

Thanks for your generosity.

Many people claim to have the right to sing the blues. That entitlement may come from their birthplace, their heritage, or their circumstances. John D’Amato definitely has the right to sing the blues because he was literally born blue. John was born with a life threatening condition known as Coarctation of the Aorta, where the lack of oxygen through the body actually caused him to turn blue. Back then there was no way to surgically correct this condition, so he had to be monitored closely and tested frequently. His childhood seemed like an endless routine of doctor visits and hospital stays until he reached the age of nine when an experimental procedure corrected his disorder.

During that time the two things that helped him through those rough times were God and his older sisters’ guitar. He would pick it up, on his darkest days and just play. The more he did, the better he felt. Eventually he got his own guitar and started writing down how he felt at the time, and putting it to music. Amongst the great blues songwriters, childhood misadventures can be the ultimate inspiration for the blues. By the age of 14, he was then, by todays’ standards, a child prodigy. He was the first guitarist ever accepted to the prestigious New Haven Educational Center for the Arts. John got his start and found local success at that early age playing for various regional bands around New Haven and Connecticut. Over the years, he played for various artists and in different genres; yet he always came back to the Blues. John has a sense of where he is going creatively and what blues music means to him. He is focused on making an impact with his songs and what they bring to the lives of those that encounter them – especially live.

John D’Amato is one of those rare guitarists that have managed to combine amazing chops with incredible feel. By channeling all of his influences (T Bone Walker, Buddy Guy, John’s good friend Joe Louis Walker, B. B. King, Jimi Hendrix, Jeff Beck, Roy Buchanan, and Howlin’ Wolf, John has managed to create his own brand of music that fuses the passion and feel of blues with his unstoppable energy and intensity. His ability to bring a song to the next level with his fervent solos along with his unique soulful vocal style make John D'Amato one of the new generation of blues men.

“Inventive and original yet true to the genre” - Mark Tucker of FAME magazine

John D’Amato has been making waves since the turn of this century. In 2009 John was selected as one of “Guitar Player Magazine’s Editors Top 8”. John performed with B.B. King in 2010 in Nashville and Billy Cox and Eric Gales in that same year. Joe Louis Walker was so impressed with John he asked him to perform on his Award Winning 2012 release “Hellfire”. Since John’s own 2010 debut album “Ain’t No Big Deal” he has unrelentingly blazed a new artistic blues trail and continues to evolve as a songwriter and performer. He plays guitar for the sheer joy of making music and his love of genre-blending riffs. As usual, this year, he will be focusing on his live-on-stage performances, which is exactly where he’s most comfortable. No one else on the scene, plays with as much passion and reverence for those who came before him, but D’Amato is really just getting started. He will certainly in turn inspire many who come after him, as he continues to conjure up and refine his unique sound with every show. His goal is to hone his craft and grow his legacy to be one of the truly great guitar slingers of all time.

As usual, this year, he will be focusing on his live-on-stage performances, which is exactly where he’s most comfortable. No one else on the scene, plays with as much passion and reverence for those who came before him, but D’Amato is really just getting started. He will certainly in turn inspire many who come after him, as he continues to conjure up and refine his unique sound with every show. His goal is to hone his craft and grow his legacy to be one of the truly great guitar slingers of all time.

story:
In 2014, members of the S.T.A.R.S. (Singers Taking Action Reaching Souls) traveled to Burundi, East Africa. During that visit, the S.T.A.R.S. shared the stage with some of the most incredible choirs we have ever heard.  The music was so inspirational, we immediately decided to form The International Music Exchange (T.I.M.E.). 

For the last several years, we have been traveling around the world sharing our music and we realize that it is time for us to bring some of the amazing voices we've heard to our friends, families and loved ones in America.

In 2016, while attending the Ihlombe Music Festival in Cape Town, we encountered this year's special offering.  

We are happy to announce that our 3rd Annual Music Exchange will be the fabulous South African Youth Choir (SAYC), a fifteen-voice ensemble that gives soul-stirring performances and shares our vision for raising the vibration of our human family through song.  

Our intention, with your support, is to bring the South African Youth Singers to America this October 2017 to perform in venues in New York, Las Vegas, Los Angeles and Minneapolis.  

This project will require your generous support, as flights, hotels, chartered buses and food will be needed during the ten days that the S.T.A.R.S. Foundation will be hosting them.  SAYC will perform in churches, schools and concert halls.

The S.T.A.R.S. Foundation (Souls Taking Action Reaching Souls) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and all of your donations are tax deductible.

Donate Today and Be Part of This Life Changing Miracle!

story:
Short Bio

Jet Lemon Band was created in 2014 in Weimar, Germany. The initial focus of this group was to cover songs of the great rock bands of the 70's. After several rehearsals, however, our inspiration morphed into a desire to honour just one legendary group, Led Zeppelin, with an album titled LED ZEPPELIN II (The Full Album), recreating the genius of this band in the style of jazz. Our mutual respect for this world-renown group has driven our re-arrangement of each song from scratch. The amazing talents of our musicians have fused seamlessly and organically throughout the process of creating this album.

 

The reaction to this album has been overwhelming, resulting in invitations to perform at local festivals, as well as solo gigs at jazz clubs around Thuringia, Germany. So far, our fans' reactions have exceeded our expectations, expressing their enthusiasm for this new take on Led Zeppelin. We are loving the opportunity to embody the life of two very different styles of music--Jazz and Rock--in one cohesive album, and to capture the imaginations of both fan bases.

But you'll be better off hearing the stuff once than reading about it a hundred times! Please, check out the song, entitled "Thank You".

This cover album will feature a number of diverse styles in addition to Contemporary Jazz, including Latin, Funk, and Vanguard. We tried to stick to expressive line from the first to the final note. We have finished the album at the studio and only thing left to do is a mastering. The final product will be 50 minutes, and will match the sequence of songs in the original LED ZEPPELIN album.

Our band consists of:

Jim AvivA - lead singer, keyboards

Sammy Lukas - piano, keyboards, saxophone, backup vocals

Ju Young Cheong - guitars

Benjamin Schlothauer - bass guitar

Jakob Kufert - drums

All of the musicians are graduates of Weimar School of Jazz and bring their own unique flavor to our sound.

Wanna Whole Lotta Love

 

What We Need  (What You Are Supporting)

But, in order to finish this epic work, we need your help to fund the project! Leo Records (English label) has consented to release the album once we have full funding.

The money we raise here will help pay for the studio mastering, release on Leo Records, promo deals and album's booklet pages. Please consider donating and becoming a part of our tribute to this legendary band!

Here are some expenses for the upcoming album:

1) Mastering, CD's pressing, Production, Promo deals - 2 000 $

2) Art Work - 500 $

3) Postage expanses and Indiegogo/CC fees - 500 $

 

What We Can Do For You 

Great thanks, digital download, signed CDs, an invitation to the gigs (free), walking down the nice parks in Weimar, sitting and drinking beer on the bench by Lukas Cranach's grave in Weimar, cool photos with Bach's monument in Weimar, visiting the art gallery dedicated to Vasily Kandinsky in the very centre of Weimar, playing baseball on the grass-plot field near Franz Liszt's house in Weimar, having a party in the fresh air and talking about Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche's works (outside of Weimar). 

For detailed info you can look at PERKS item on the right side of this page.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you can't donate money to this campaign, donate noise, by spreading the word about our project. Tell everyone you know, and even those you don't! We invite you to join us and share in our success by contributing whatever you can to this project! Share, post on Facebook, Twitter, Social media, TV, Radio and etc...

Thank you in advance!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/218231551720318/

story:
Short Summary

Hi friends, family, and all you good Indiegogo supporters. My name is Ras Gumbo, I'm a musician from Tanzania, East Africa. I've been singing since my childhood and writing songs for many years. This is my chance to release my first album, a goal I've been working towards for more than fourteen years. Music is the best teacher in life and my music is about making positive changes. In the last two years, I've released 1 audio and 3 videos on YouTube. You can check out my latest video release called CORRUPTION below.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $5,000 in total and it breaks down like this....

$2,300 to produce, record, mix and master two songs; copy CDs and print CD covers.

$1,700 to organise a launch show - venue, stage, sound and lighting equipment, security, permits, live video recording.

$1,000 Marketing and advertising - TV, radio and print.

If I don't manage to reach my goal of $5,000 I intend to prioritise getting my music to the people so I will finish recording the album and distribute it digitally. 

The rewards are all about the music - that's what I'm all about and that's what my team is all about! I don't have a website yet - that will happen after the album is launched so digital music will be emailed instead of downloaded. 

Depending on the perk you select, you will get some combination of the following: digital copies of each of 4 singles already released sent to your inbox; a  digital copy of the new album Daily Teaching sent to your inbox; a physical copy of  the new album Daily Teaching shipped to your door; a DVD copy of the live launch show shipped to your door. See the panel on the right for the details of the reward packs. Everyone who supports this campaign will be thanked publicly by having their name included on the friends and supporters wall that will be displayed at the live album launch show.

The team is working on making merchandise available (T-shirts etc) so hopefully we will add some more good things to the perks but the budget is tight so we don't want to commit until we are sure we can deliver.

 

The Impact

What is more important than discovering new experiences in this world? This is a chance for people to discover inspiration from original roots reggae music. Inspiration to make a positive change and to make the world a better place. 

We know that Power can create a lot of Corruption, but we Give Thanks and Praises that no matter what, still, We Got Love,  and we know thats all we need to change the world and make the world a better place. 

 

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk that if I don't reach my target it will take me more time to do everything I want to do, but I've made it this far and I'm very confident that I will be able to finish this album no matter what. It may take a bit more time, so your copy might be a bit late, but I am sure that you will get it in the end.

The biggest risk is that if I don't reach my target I won't be able to organise the launch show. If that happens, there is a possibility that the show will be delayed long term, so it may not be possible to fulfil the perk including the live video of the launch show. If that happens, the team will come up with a new item or items to replace it and we will let everyone know as soon as possible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate or purchase a reward, there are plenty of other ways you can help. You can share this campaign with your friends through your networks - especially anyone you know who loves reggae music! Use the links at the top of the page.

You can also watch my videos on You Tube - links below - and if you like how they sound, you can like and share them.

WE GOT LOVE
 

THANKS AND PRAISES

POWER

Thanks to everyone who helped me get this far.

Thanks for all your support, it is REALLY REALLY appreciated.

Ahsanteni sana.

#LoveAndRespectToAll
