story:
Celebrating the 20th anniversary of Dan-e-o's “Dear Hip Hop”

On November 5th, 1996, Beat Factory released the seminal hip-hop compilation, Rap Essentials Volume One. Featuring the likes of such budding superstars as Kardinal Offishall, Choclair and Rascalz, the album also included the now-iconic debut single “Dear Hip Hop” by Scarborough, Ontario-based lyricist, Dan-e-o. Today, the song is considered a classic by enthusiasts of the genre worldwide. In 2016, Dan-e-o will celebrate the 20th anniversary of the legendary track and everything it stands for. And we’d like to celebrate with all of you!

So how can you get involved? 

Without the fans, a record label wouldn't be able to advance the money needed to make an album. Instead of turning to a major record label, these days an artist can turn to the fans in order to fund projects, as many have already proven. Dan-e-o would like both friends and fans alike to help create both the celebratory "Dear Hip Hop: 20th Anniversary Deluxe Edition" album and documentary, by not only helping with funding but also help deciding who Dan-e-o will work with on this project. It will all be up to the fans and Dan-e-o to work together!

For Dan-e-o to complete this incredible venture, he will need to fund both projects which are set to include a series of brand new incarnations of “Dear Hip Hop”. It will involve the creation of new music (recording, mixing, mastering, guests, features etc.), the creation of new packaging (design, photography, more designing, etc.), the filming of new music videos (those get expensive), the financing of a tour to promote the new project (travel expenses, marketing/promotions), the filming and editing of the documentary and last but not least, the duplication of enough physical copies of the new album to meet the requirements of big name retail distribution chains (HMV, Walmart, Best Buy etc.) 

Seeing these projects through to fruition will all depend on how much money is raised to pay for all of the above-mentioned tasks. Doing so will allow Dan-e-o to finally create his full-length ode to hip-hop as a professionally solid product for stores to shelve. 

You are now the record label! (It's better this way. What do those yuppies in suits know anyway, right?) You - the fans - will help Dan-e-o to fund the "Dear Hip Hop: 20th Anniversary Deluxe Edition" album and documentary through the various perks you choose. Together, we will listen to suggestions from all contributors, including your selections for vocalists and producers who will be invited to enter contests to participate on the album. Dan-e-o wants all of you to be involved every step of the way!

What are those contests we speak of?  

This is where things get really interesting! Dan-e-o welcomes emcees to visit http://dearhiphop.com to download the original “Dear Hip Hop” instrumental so that they can record their own guest verses for inclusion in new 2016 incarnations of the classic track! With YOUR help, Dan-e-o will choose his favourite verses and feature them on the Dear Hip Hop: 20th Anniversary Deluxe Edition album.

As well, producers are encouraged to visit http://dearhiphop.com and download the “Dear Hip Hop” a capella so that they can create the own original remixes to the song. With YOUR help, Dan-e-o will choose his favourite beat to create an exclusive new cut for the album!

Finally, for all those who aren't emcees or producers, but still want to voice what hip-hop means to them, we welcome you all to visit http://dearhiphop.com and write a letter to hip-hop that you can share on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook, with the hashtag #dearhiphop. 

What we need and what you get...

As you know, we need the necessary funding to make this all happen! But what do you get out of the whole deal?

You will receive such perks as early editions of the "Dear Hip Hop: 20th Anniversary Deluxe Edition" album, private parties with performances from Dan-e-o himself, tickets to shows on his tour, exclusive merchandising to crowd-funders only, your name in the documentary’s credits (all crowdfunders included) and much more. Let’s not forget that you will play an integral role in making history by helping Dan-e-o to complete these celebratory projects!

If the entire goal isn't met, Dan-e-o and his team will do everything they can to work with what they have. Obviously, the more funding we receive, the better the projects will be. Of course, something will always be better than (an advance from a major record label) nothing!

Every contribution counts, from $1.00 to $10,000.00! From one share of this campaign to 100 shares of the campaign. It all helps. 

Side note...

You can donate any amount by typing in the amount under "Your Contribution" just above the perks. 

It’s the Dan-e-o album every fan has ever wanted to hear!

If you've ever said to yourself, “I'd like to hear Dan-e-o on a track with _____”, this is the greatest chance to get that to happen! With a classic track like “Dear Hip Hop” celebrating its 20th year of existence, Dan-e-o has proven that the best emcees in the game are the ones who enjoy longevity. Meanwhile, Dan-e-o feels like he’s just getting started! 

Now you can contribute to the next phase of his career in the strongest way possible. By donating straight into the artist’s hands, the artist can create exactly what you want!

If we're able to raise more than the goal...

As mentioned, the projects will only get better! Basically, the amazing features that we have suggested in the perks can only be achieved if you really want them. The project can only go as far as YOU take it.

Where the money goes...

    Features - Even big name artists need to pay other big names to feature on their tracks. Estimated at ($2,000.00+).

    Recording - (4 days of recording x $250 a day = $1,000)

    Mixing/Mastering - (Roughly $100 - $200 a track) Estimated at 14 tracks = Low $1,500.00 Highest (Best quality) = $2,000.00

    Merchandising (Shirts, Hats, Sweaters, Bobbleheads, etc...) We estimate around $5,000-$10,000.00 in merchandising needed.

    Marketing/Videos is estimated at around $10,000-$25,000.00 (3 Videos)

    Advertising is estimated to be at $1,500.00 min.

    Album duplication will need a start of $2,500-10,000.00 to reach the retail stores we'd like to reach.

    Publicist - min of $1,500.00 to start.

For a more detailed example of the breakdown... 
Expenses
Documentary $4,500.00
Editing $500.00
Studio Fees
Studio Time $1,000.00
Feature Fees $2,000.00
Producers (engineer, assistants) $2,000.00
After Recording
PR Fees $1,500.00
Mixing/Mastering $2,000.00
Other Expenses
Videos (x3) 10,000.00
Hard drives and other random expenses $700.00
Grand Total (Estimated) $24,200.00
Fundraising Goal $31,460.00
Indie GoGo Fees (4%) -$968.00
Credit Card fees (11%) -$2,662.00
Adjust Gross $32,830.00
Cost of Goods for Perks (est. 20%) -$5,000.00
Final Total To Use $27,830.00
Obviously, there is more expenses than listed, and these are only examples/projections so we're going to have to adjust as we go, but these breakdowns are a good way to know why it costs so much to create great works of art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make noise about the campaign by letting others know about it.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Examples will be added here:


...

As mentioned, the projects will only get better! Basically, the amazing features that we have suggested in the perks can only be achieved if you really want them. The project can only go as far as YOU take it.

Where the money goes...

    Features - Even big name artists need to pay other big names to feature on their tracks. Estimated at ($2,000.00+).
    Recording - (4 days of recording x $250 a day = $1,000)
    Mixing/Mastering - (Roughly $100 - $200 a track) Estimated at 14 tracks = Low $1,500.00 Highest (Best quality) = $2,000.00
    Merchandising (Shirts, Hats, Sweaters, Bobbleheads, etc...) We estimate around $5,000-$10,000.00 in merchandising needed.
    Marketing/Videos is estimated at around $10,000-$25,000.00 (3 Videos)
    Advertising is estimated to be at $1,500.00 min.
    Album duplication will need a start of $2,500-10,000.00 to reach the retail stores we'd like to reach.
    Publicist - min of $1,500.00 to start.


For a more detailed example of the breakdown... 



Expenses

Documentary
$4,500.00


Editing
$500.00

Studio Fees

Studio Time
$1,000.00


Feature Fees
$2,000.00


Producers (engineer, assistants)
$2,000.00

After Recording

PR Fees
$1,500.00


Mixing/Mastering
$2,000.00

Other Expenses

Videos (x3)
10,000.00


Hard drives and other random expenses
$700.00


Grand Total (Estimated)
$24,200.00


Fundraising Goal
$31,460.00


Indie GoGo Fees (4%)
-$968.00


Credit Card fees (11%)
-$2,662.00


Adjust Gross
$32,830.00


Cost of Goods for Perks (est. 20%)
-$5,000.00


Final Total To Use
$27,830.00

Obviously, there is more expenses than listed, and these are only examples/projections so we're going to have to adjust as we go, but these breakdowns are a good way to know why it costs so much to create great works of art.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Make noise about the campaign by letting others know about it.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!








Examples will be added here:

story:
Yet Another F!#@ing Crowd Sourced Record, well, not exactly. 

I will call it a pre-order with benefits.

Hello, my name is Eric Ott, and am putting out a solo record.

My friends and I started recording this a while ago. I have been blessed with these fine musicians/friends and other great players on this project. I have purchased equipment, hired full-time pro musicians etc. I have realized, in order to properly release this and not max out yet another credit card, I need to sell some records/bundles to help finance the rest of this record.

We still need to Mix, Master and Print. Your pre-order will help us get to the finish line!

The Record: The record is called “In Lieu of Flowers”. The record is a huge departure from my other records. It has a common theme, death, and the songs are intertwined with each other. It is somewhat of a concept record. There are songs with huge production/arraignments and multi-layered vocals.  I set out to put out a record that was a little strange but still accessible.

If you pre-order, you will have the record the same time publishers/reviewers will have it. We will not release this record to the public until 1 month after the press has it.

Check out the special packages (bundles) we have put together and help us reach our goal. Thank you so much for reading this.

Eric
